response: Mix together flour, sugar and butter. Cut in egg yolk and vanilla. Spread in 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Blend together instant coffee, powdered sugar and milk. Pour over baked base. Sprinkle with almonds and bake at 350 for 5 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

Mix bread cubes with sausage. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add celery, onion, and sausage mixture. Stir fry until sausage is browned. Add mushrooms. Stir until mushroom are tender. Add brothstir until heated through. Add sage. Salt and pepper to taste. Stir until heated through. Serve hot.

Mix together bread cubes, turkey and onion. Add eggs and milk and beat well. Season with salt and pepper. Add poultry seasoning. Pour into greased 10 inch ring pan and bake at 350 for 1 hour. When done, remove from ring and cut into wedges. Serve with warm gravy.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti in the boiling water until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain the spaghetti and immediately return to the pot. Add the broccoli and toss to coat. Mix together the peanut butter, vegetable broth, soy sauce, seasoned rice vinegar and red pepper in a small bowl. Pour over the pasta and stir to combine. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking prepare the sauce. In a medium bowl combine yeast with milk substitute and whisk until smooth. Add mayonnaise and stir until smooth again. Add nutritional yeast, salt and pepper to taste. Drain pasta and put into a baking dish. Cover with sauce. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Top with breadcrumbs if desired.

Brown sausages in a little butter. When cooked remove to a plate. Brown bacon. Add onions to the pan and cook until soft. Drain the frozen vegetables. Add the vegetables to the onions along with the french onion soup mix. Add 1 cup of boiling water. Return the sausages to the pan. Stir until heated through. Pour into a greased 9x13 baking dish. Top with the chopped bacon. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Remove the cover. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve.

Toast the white bread. Spread one slice of toasted white bread with crunchy peanut butter. Layer the goldfish crackers on the peanut butter. Spread the other slice of toasted white bread with grape jelly. Layer the grape jelly slice on top of the goldfish crackers on the peanut butter slice of toast. Place the two pieces together so the goldfish crackers are in between the two slices of toast. Place the whole wheat bread slice on the top of the goldfish crackers in between the two slices of toast. Slice the sandwich into 9 rectangular pieces and serve.

Cut up chicken breasts into cubes. Dip cubes into flour. Heat olive oil in a skillet and fry chicken cubes until golden brown. Add soy sauce and sugar. Heat through. Serve over white rice. Garnish with parsley and a sprig of parsley.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugars until well blended. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Stir in the flour and baking powder. Divide into two balls. Roll one ball into a log shape and cut it into 1/4 inch wide strips. Place on a parchment paper-lined cookie sheet. Repeat with second ball. Bake for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 1 minute. Add the chips and sprinkle on top of cookie strips. Return to the oven for another 2 minutes and allow to cool completely on a wire rack. Store in an air-tight container.

Fill a tall cocktail glass halfway with ice cubes. Squeeze lime wedges into glass and drop into glass. Add vodka and ruby red grapefruit juice to glass and stir well. Add 1 teaspoon white sugar to mixture and stir well. Add 1 maraschino cherry and 1 grapefruit wedge to glass and stir well to combine. Serve immediately.

Heat 1/4 cup of the water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the orange juice and lemon juicebring to a boil. Remove from heatlet cool for 5 minutes. Pour into a 1-quart pitcherstir in the remaining water. Add the almond flavoring, vanilla extract and the spices. Serve over ice cubes. Garnish with orange slices if desired. Makes 8 servings.
In a large skillet over medium heat, beat the eggs in milk. Cook for a few minutes or until set. Stir in the cheese. Mix in green onions & jalapeno. Serve on toasted bread.

In a saucepan, combine 1/2 cup of the strawberries with the ginger ale and milk. Cook over low heat until the milk thickens and the strawberries are softened, about 10 minutes. Puree the mixture in a blender or food processor. Add the remaining strawberries to the pureepuree again. Stir in the sugar, lemon juice, and vanilla extract. Chill the mixture thoroughly. Divide among 6 bowls. Top each with a dollop of sour cream.

In a small bowl combine orange juice and hoisin sauce. Place salmon in a large baggie and add marinade. Seal bag and place in refrigerator for at least one hour. Remove from marinade and place on a non-stick grill pan and grill for about 8-10 minutes on each side. You will need a little cooking spray on your grill pan. If you have a grill you may use that also and then you don't have to worry about spraying your pan. Serve with rice.

Marinate the chicken breasts with a mixture of olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, oregano, and a little salt for at least 2 hours or overnight. Thread the breasts onto bamboo or wooden skewers, leaving space between the pieces. Melt a small knob of butter over medium heat with the sliced garlic and cook until the garlic is golden brown. Add the remaining pesto ingredients, and bring to a boil. Add the breasts to the sauce, turning until they are coated well. Turn off the heat and simmer for a couple of minutes more before serving. Serve the chicken on a platter with the pesto sauce spooned over the top. Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs, if desired.

Blend blue cheese and butter in food processor until smooth. Preheat broiler. Broil cut-side-down bread until crispy and light brown. Turn over and broil 4 to 6 inches from heat until cheese bubbles and is beginning to brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with celery, if you like. Cut bread into 1-inch pieces. Mix vegetables and salt and pepper in small bowl. Preheat broiler. Line baking sheet with foil or broiler pan with rack. Arrange vegetables in 1 layer in small mounds on rack or foil. Broil 2 to 3 inches from heat until lightly browned and tender, 5 to 7 minutes for asparagus and 8 to 12 minutes for squash and zucchini. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and sprinkle with basil. Serve immediately with croutons.

Combine all the ingredients in a zip lock bag. Remove the air from the bag and seal the bag. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. Preheat oven to 375. Place the pork in a large shallow baking dish. Roast for approximately 1 hour or until the thermometer registers 140-145 degrees. Remove from the oven. Cover tightly with foil and let rest for approximately 10-15 minutes before slicing.
Place fruit in bottom of pie crust. Combine remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Pour over fruit. Bake at 375 for 1 hour. Let cool.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add brown sugar and vanilla. Cook and stir until smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in flour until blended. Press into a 13x9-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 12-14 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack. In a microwave safe bowl combine marshmallows and chocolate chips. Cook on high for 1 minute and stir until smooth. Spread over crust and sprinkle with walnuts and any remaining chocolate chips. Cut into bars and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl combine the oats and wheat germ. Mix in the cinnamon and nutmeg. Set aside. Combine the honey and vanilla in a small saucepan. Heat until warm. Pour over the dry ingredients and mix well. Add in the craisins and apricots. Spread the mixture in a 9 x 13 baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove and stir. Bake for another 15 minutes. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees C. Line a baking tray with baking parchment. Cut each orange into 6 segments. Arrange the segments on the baking parchment. Mix the sugar and vanilla together. Brush each segment of each orange and place each brushed segment into a muffin case. Brush the tops of the segments with the sugar and vanilla mixture. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and leave to cool. In a small pan, boil the liqueur for 5 minutes. Allow to cool. Carefully remove each segment from its muffin case and place onto a plate. Spoon over some of the liqueur. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray an 8x8x2 inch baking pan with cooking spray or use non stick cooking spray. Melt the margarine in the microwave. Mix the cocoa and the boiling water and stir until smooth. Set aside for a few minutes until it is cool enough to touch. Mix the sugar, the eggs and the vanilla in a mixing bowl until smooth. Add the cocoa mixture and the flour and stir until smooth. Add the nuts and the miniature chocolate chips and stir well. Spread in the baking pan. Bake for about 30 minutes in the preheated oven or until the brownies are set and a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for a few minutes and cut into squares.

Mix together butter and splenda sugar substitute. Add egg substitute and pineapple, mix well. Add in flours, soda, and salt, blend together. Add vanilla. Pour into greased & floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 8-inch square baking pan. Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat, stirring often until smooth. Add the sugar and stir until combined. Add the dutch-processed cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, and vanillastir until combined. Beat the egg into the mixture. Stir in the flour until just combined. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake until center is set and edges begin to pull away from pan, about 25 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. Sprinkle the chocolate chips over the top of the cooled browniesspread into an even layer using an offset spatula. Let chocolate set for 20 minutescut into squares.
In a medium bowl combine sugar, vinegar and miracle whip. Mix well. Add all other ingredients. Toss together. Chill until ready to serve.
Mix the Bacardi Limon, lemonade and lime concentrate together in a large pitcher. Add the ice. Stir well. Serve in tall glasses. Garnish with lemon slices.

Combine the port wine, jelly, orange rind, cherries, and berries in a large bowl. Chill for one hour. Arrange berries on an attractive platter or individual dishes. Top with mint leaves. Makes 10 servings.

Peel the mangoes. Cut out the large pit, cut the flesh into small cubes and place in a food processor or blender. Pulse until it becomes a smooth puree. Add orange juice and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add lime juice and continue to blend until the mixture is smooth. Pour mixture through a strainer to remove any remaining pulp. Add to a tall glass with ice cubes. Top the mixture off with some club soda or sparkling water to taste.

In a bowl mix all ingredients except for condensed milk. Spread on a cookie sheet and then drizzle condensed milk over the top and mix well with a spoon. Let it stand and harden for an hour before eating.

Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Add beer and stir until well mixed. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Stir in onion and pepper. Heat oil in a deep fryer or Dutch oven. Drop batter by teaspoons into oil and fry until golden brown. Remove from oil and drain. Makes 3 dozen.

Heat a griddle to medium high heat. Add challah slice to buttered side of griddle. Place one slice of brie cheese on top of the bread slice. Sprinkle with basil and tomatoes. Top with a second slice of challah bread with butter side down on top of the cheese slices. Press down lightly to melt the cheese a bit and cook for 2 minutes on each side until the bread is golden brown. Repeat for remaining bread slices.

Soak the cutlets or chops in a balsamic vinegar and oil mix. Leave to soak for 15 minutes or longer. Drain and pat dry. Drizzle with lemon juice and rosemary and sprinkle with a little sea salt. Roast in a hot oven until brown.

Slice off ends of zucchini. Cut lengthwise into thin strips, or into small cubes. Combine chicken broth and garlic and let stand for 10 minutes. Toss zucchini with broth mixture and set aside. Combine lime juice and oregano and mix well. Stir into zucchini mixture and mix well. Serve sprinkled with fresh parsley.
Combine first five ingredients in a medium bowl. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour or up to 2 days. Serve with pretzel sticks or crackers.

Slice pears into 1/4" thick rounds. Wrap each piece of bacon around 1 pear slice. Arrange the dressed greens in the center of a large serving dish. Place the wrapped bacon-wrapped pear slices around the perimeter of the salad. Top with parmesan. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 13x9-inch glass or ceramic baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange bread cubes in bottom of prepared pan. Sprinkle cheeses over bread cubes. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and hot pepper sauce until well blended. Pour egg mixture over bread cubes. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted 1 inch from the edge of the strata comes out clean. Top evenly with bacon before serving.

Melt butter in a large non-stick pan and add the rind and juice of lemon and cook for 1 minute. Add the green peppercorn and cook for a few minutes. Season with salt and black pepper and cook for 3 to 4 minutes more. Place the scallops and fish fillets into the pan and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until cooked through and golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour and the baking soda and salt. Set aside. In another large bowl, beat together the granulated and brown sugars and the butter with an electric mixer. Beat in the egg yolks and the vanilla extract. Reduce the mixer speed to low and add the dry mixture in 2 additions, mixing until just incorporated. Stir in the chocolate chips. Turn the dough out onto a clean counter top. With a bench scraper or large spoon, shape the dough into a 12x6 inch rectangle. Place the dough on the prepared baking sheets. Cut the dough into 12 equal rectangles. With a paring knife, cut each rectangle into 4 equal triangles. Bake the cookies until golden and puffed, about 25 minutes. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the cream cheese in a bowl in the microwave. Microwave it on the defrost setting for a couple of minutes to slightly soften the cream cheese. Add sugar to cream cheese and beat it with an electric mixer until smooth. Add frozen topping and blend until smooth. Spoon into ready made crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool. Top with cherry pie filling and chill.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle bouillon powder, garlic powder and onion powder on top. Cook for 2 minutes while stirring continuously to avoid burning. Add long-grain rice and stir well to coat. Pour warm water into skillet until it covers the rice by 1cm. Cover skillet with lid and cook for 20 minutes. Uncover skillet and add lemon juice to taste. Stir thoroughly and serve hot.

Shred the cabbage, carrots and yellow onions into thin matchsticks. In a medium sized mixing bowl combine the cabbage, carrot, yellow onions. In another medium sized mixing bowl combine the sugar, apple cider vinegar, yellow mustard, ground mustard, mayonnaise, salt and pepper. Add the dressing to the cabbage mixture. Toss well to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes prior to serving. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 5 days.

Combine brown sugar with low sodium soy sauce and mirin in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until it has become thick and syrupy, stirring often to prevent burning. Peel and chop potatoes into 1/2-inch pieces and add to saucepanstir to coat well. Cover and cook over low heat until soft, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring often until it has softened, about 5 minutes more. Spoon the glazed potatoes into individual bowls. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. Garnish with nori strips and serve hot or cold.

Heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add cherry tomatoes and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add wine and boil until reduced by half. Add garlic and cook until tender, about 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and cook for another 30 seconds. Add the clams and cover. Cook until the clams open. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide the clams and sauce among plates. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with french bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In shallow bowl, combine flour, garlic salt, salt and celery saltstir well. Coat each chicken piece with flour mixture on both sidesset aside. In shallow bowl, combine paprika, cayenne and black pepperstir well. Place chicken into bowl with seasoningsturn to coat both sides. In skillet, heat canola oil over medium heat until hotadd chicken to skillet and cook over medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side or until crusty and golden brownplace on wire rack and allow to drain. Place chicken on ungreased cookie sheet and place in oven for an additional 10-12 minutes until tenderremove from oven and place on serving dish.

Peel, core and cut the pears in half lengthwise and place in a large bowl. Add the raisins and toss gently. In a small bowl combine the maple syrup and butterheat in the microwave until melted and warm. Pour the syrup mixture over the fruit mixture and toss well. Transfer the mixture to a 2-quart casserole dishset aside while you prepare the topping. In a small bowl combine the sugar, cinnamon and saltset aside. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heatstir in the cinnamon and sugar mixture and stir until well blended. Pour the mixture over the top of the fruit and spread evenly with a spoon. Bake for 20 minutes or until the sugar is melted and the fruit is heated through. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 6-8.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Add the carrots, stock, thyme and season with the salt and pepper. Bring to the boil then turn down to a simmer and cook until the carrots are tender. Drain the carrots and return to the saucepan. Using the back of a fork mash the carrots until smooth. Serve warm or chilled with your choice of protein. I love this with grilled chicken breasts.

Unfold 8 biscuits and separate. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile, beat together cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add egg and beat well. Add cinnamon and beat well. Spread about 1 teaspoon of the filling on each biscuit half. Top each with the other half. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until golden. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Mix taco seasoning and olive oil together. Dice onion and toss with potato slices. Wrap potato/onion mixture in foil and bake in oven for 40-50 minutes. Remove from oven and top with mexican cheese. Bake until cheese is melted.
Mix oatmeal and milk together. Add banana slices and cereal.

Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until softened. Add turkey. Season with cumin seed, red chili power, black pepper and sazon goya. Add tomatoes. Add kidney beans. Add more sazon goya if desired. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with cornbread or crackers.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook potatoes in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cool slightly. Peel and coarsely shred. In large bowl stir together sour cream, milk, chives, salt & pepper. Gently stir in potatoes. Transfer to greased 3 quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle with cornflake crumbs. Bake covered for 1 hour. Uncover & bake about 15 minutes or until golden.

In a saucepan, cover the lentils with 1 inch of water. Bring to boiling. Cover, reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Add the orange zest. Drain, rinse under cold water. Transfer to a large bowl. Add the orange juice, olive oil, bay leaves, salt and pepper. Toss well. Add the orange segments. Mix gently. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In medium bowl, stir together flour, baking powder and salt. In large bowl, beat butter, sugar and vanilla with electric mixer until creamy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in flour mixture. Stir in nuts and chocolate. Spread in greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until top is golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into 2-inch squares.

Heat oven to 350f degrees F. In a small skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot. Cook onion in hot oil until tender, about 2 minutes. Spoon half the mixture into each tortillaroll up. Place seam side down in a 9x13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spraytop with remaining mixture and remaining tortillas. Pour enchilada sauce oversprinkle with cheese. Cover and bake at 350f degrees F for 25 minutes or until heated through and cheese is lightly browned and bubbly. Uncoverbake 5 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Divide hamburger meat into 8 portions and form each portion into a patty. In a medium sized bowl combine lipton onion soup mix and water to form a paste. Spread each patty with about 1 tablespoon of the paste. Arrange 2 sliced onions on one half of each patty. Place 1 red potato and 1 baby carrot on the other half of each patty. Wrap tightly in foil and seal. Place the packages on a rack on the bbq over indirect heat. Cook 25-30 minutes or until meat is browned and done. Serve on buns.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Slice the bacon into small pieces. Cook the bacon until it is crisp. Pour off the fat. Drain the bacon on paper towels and sprinkle with the seasoning salt. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl, beat the eggs with the milk, cream, green onions, bacon, and sweet onion. Add the extra sharp cheddar cheese. Beat until well blended. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until firm on the edges and set in the middle. Let stand for a few minutes before cutting into wedges to serve. Serves 6-8 people.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish and set aside. Cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the sifted flour and cocoa powder. Mix well. Stir in the white chocolate chips by hand. Spread evenly into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into squares and serving.

Cook the potatoes and green beans separately. Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender. Cook the green beans in a steamer basket. In a large pan of boiling salted water cook the pasta. Drain and rinse under cold running water until cool. Add the beans and potatoes to the pesto and toss to coat. Add the pasta and toss to combine.

Cook macaroni in salted boiling water until it is done. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Melt butter and stir flour into it until a smooth mixture is formed. Gradually add the milk until thick and smooth. Stir in the egg and salt. Remove from heat. Stir the macaroni into the mixture. Pour the mixture into a greased cake pan. Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on the top. Bake at 350f degrees until firm, about 30 minutes.

In a large stock pot, add the oil and cook the onion until tender. Add the carrots, potatoes, corn and cook until tender. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the ground beef and cook until it is done. Add the water, bouillon and paste. Cook for 15 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Wash the dried beans in cool water until no more grit is coming out of them (I used 4 cups of beans). Drain them well and put them in the saucepan with 5 cups of boiling water, 1/2 of an onion, the garlic cloves, and 2-3 tablespoons of chili powder. Simmer for 3-4 hours until tender. Melt the TVP in the microwave for 20-30 seconds, then add it to the cooked beans. Add the cooked rice and remaining 1/4 cup of chili powder, along with the ground cumin and sea salt to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes to combine flavors. Serve hot.

Cook pasta according to directions. Add peas to pasta during the last 4 minutes of cooking. Meanwhile, fry chopped onion in a little olive oil until translucent. Add cooked bacon, chopped garlic and continue to fry for 1-2 minutes. Add ricotta cheese and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in pasta, parsley and parmesan cheese. Add light cream to taste. Serves 6-8.

Heat the oil in a large heavy based saucepan over a medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add the thyme sprigs and parsnip and cook for a further 2 minutes. Stir in the broth to cover. Bring to the boil then reduce heat to medium low. Add the chicken thighs, skin side up, cover the pan and cook for 20 minutes. Turn the chicken skin side down. Stir in the coarse grain mustard. Cover the pan and cook for a further 10 minutes or until the parsnip is tender. Remove the lid. Stir in the honey and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Divide between serving plates. Sprinkle parsley over. Serve.

Combine first four ingredients in heavy-duty saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture comes to a boil. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Beat in peanut butter, vanilla, and cocoa. Drop dough by teaspoonsful onto waxed paper. Cool completely.
Pour all ingredients except orange juice into a blender. Mix well. Pour into a tall glass. Top with pineapple juice. Garnish with a slice of pineapple.

Place carrots in pot and cover with cold water. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes. Drain carrots. Place back in pot and add butter, brown sugar, cider and stock. Bring to simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Add mustard and parsley. Taste and adjust seasonings.

In a large saute pan with olive oil, saute mushrooms and onions. Add roasted red peppers to the mushrooms and onions. Add penne to the mushroom mixture. Toss mushroom mixture with the penne until coated. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown meat together and drain. Add remaining ingredients and cook until cheese melts. Spread a tablespoonful of mixture on each slice of rye bread. Freeze until ready to use. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Makes 15 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Peel off the skin from the eggplant with a sharp knife. Slice into 1/4 inch thick slices and place in a bowl. Peel off the skin from the onion, and dice finely. Toss eggplant with onion and 1/4 cup olive oil in the bowl. Transfer to a baking sheet, and bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until tender. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. When done, add roasted red peppers, garlic cloves, and diced tomato to the bowl. Toss to combine. Toast bread slices with remaining 1/4 cup olive oil. Spread roasted vegetables mixture on toasts. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if desired.

Cook the chicken until it is no longer pink, let cool,. Cut into small pieces,. Combine the chicken,. Cream cheese,. Mustard,. Lemon juice,. And nuts in a bowl,. Mix well,. Form into balls,. Refrigerate,. Serve with crackers,. Serves 20

Prepare the meat first. In a skillet heat 1 tablespoon of oil. Add the ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Drain grease. Add the taco seasoning according to package directions. Stir in the water. Add the refried beans. Heat through. For each serving, place a flour tortilla on a microwave safe plate. Add 1/3 of the meat mixture. Add a tablespoon of sour cream. Top with 1/2 of the shredded cheese. Place another flour tortilla on top. Microwave for 30 seconds. Repeat for the remaining servings. Top with taco sauce and a sprinkling of diced onion. Serve with extra cheese.

Wash, core, peel and grate the carrots. Drain on paper towels to remove excess moisture. Mix the onions, mayonnaise, water, prepared horseradish and pepper. Add the drained grated carrots. Mix thoroughly. Transfer to a casserole. Sprinkle with the dry breadcrumbs. Dot with the butter. Sprinkle with the grated sharp cheddar cheese. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Serve hot.
Cream together butter and cheese. Add rice krispies. Stir in flour and add tabasco and worcestershire.

Cook and drain pasta according to directions on package. While pasta is cooking, heat oil in 3 quart saucepan over medium heat. Cook garlic in oil about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until garlic is tender but not brown. Remove from heat. Stir basil, avocado and tomatoes into garlic in saucepan. Toss vegetable mixture and pastas. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rinse the fillets and pat dry. Set aside. In a shallow bowl, whisk together the butter, dijon and lemon juice. In a separate shallow bowl, combine the bread crumbs with the parsley and a few shakes of salt and pepper. Dip each fillet into the lemon-butter mixture and then dredge it in the bread crumb mixture to coat both sides evenly. Place the fillets in a sprayed or lightly oiled baking pan and bake, uncovered, for 20-30 minutes, or until thoroughly hot and tender.

Prepare orange juice concentrate as directed on package. Stir together cornstarch and 1/3 cup hot water until smoothstir into orange juice concentrate until well blended. Heat to boiling over medium heatcook and stir 1 minute until thickened. Stir in butter and lemon zest until melted. Serve over carrots.

Boil the potatoes and bay leaves together for 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Melt the butter in a separate pan. Stir in the potatoes and peascook for a further 2 minutes to heat through. Stir in the marjoram, thyme and pepper.

In a frying pan sauté Jimmy Dean sausage until cooked through. Remove from pan and place in a bowl. Pour the excess fat out of the frying pan and place over medium high heat. Melt the butter and add the flour stirring constantly until the flour is cooked. Slowly pour the milk into the pan while continuously stirring and adding the sausage and sour cream to the pan. Cook on medium high until the sauce starts to bubble. Take off of the stove and add the cooked Jimmy Dean sausage and stir. Serve on top of omelets.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Cream butter, add sugar. Add egg and beat well. Stir in vanilla, sifted dry ingredients and mix well. Chill dough 1 hour or till easy to handle. Fit cookie press with desired cut-out template. Fill press with chilled dough and press onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8 minutes or till edges of cookies are set. Remove to wire racks to cool. Melt chocolate confectionary coating in a double boiler or in a microwave oven in 30 second intervals, stirring after each heating. Dip bottoms of cookies into melted chocolate and place on wax paper to cool. Decorate as desired if desired or enjoy them plain. Store in an airtight container layered between foil or waxed paper, if needed. These cookies freeze well.

Place tea bags in boiling water. Steep 10 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add cloves, cinnamon sticks and sugar. Stir. Add remaining ingredients. Stir well. Simmer 15 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 18 servings.

Scrub the potatoes then cut them into wedges of your liking and set them aside. Heat the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until it is melted and foamy. Stir in the cajun seasoning and mix thoroughly. Dip each potato wedge into the seasoned butter and place on the baking sheet. Drizzle the remaining seasoned butter over the potato wedges then sprinkle with coarse salt and bake for 35-45 minutes at 375 degrees F until the wedges are crisp and golden.

Trim bottom of asparagus. Preheat oven to 350. Wrap each spear of asparagus with a strip of bacon. Wrap each spear with a thin slice of butter. Wrap each spear of asparagus with a strip of bacon. Wrap each spear with a thin slice of butter. Wrap each spear of asparagus with a strip of bacon. Wrap each spear with a thin slice of butter. Wrap each spear of asparagus with a strip of bacon. Wrap each spear with a thin slice of butter. Place in shallow baking pan. Mix brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and melted butter. Pour over asparagus. Bake 20 to 30 minutes or until tender.

Combine the first four ingredients in a heavy saucepan and cook over medium heat to 236f on a candy thermometer, stirring frequently. Remove from heat and add chocolate and butter. Beat until chocolate is melted and blended. Beat until thick and mixture loses its gloss. Cool, then beat until thick and mixture looses its gloss. Pour into buttered square pan and let cool before cutting.

Place the raisins in a small bowl, add very hot water to cover and soak till plump, 10-15 minutes. Drain well and pat dry with a paper towel. Heat the oil in a large skillet or wok over low heat. Add the garlic, pine nuts and soaked raisins and cook till the nuts and the garlic are light golden, 3-5 minutes. Increase the heat to medium add the chopped spinach or chard and cook for about 1 minute, stirring to combine evenly. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Transfer to serving bowl. Serve immediately.
In a blender combine coffee, granulated sugar and ice cream. Blend until smooth. Add chocolate syrup and blend until smooth. Serve in a tall glass.

Bake potatoes in microwave or oven according to package directions. Slice in half. Arrange evenly in a 9x13 inch pan. Top with ham. Combine soup and water. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in a 400 degree oven 15 to 20 minutes or until bubbly.

Sift together the flour, blue cornmeal and baking powder and set aside. In a small bowl combine the egg and buttermilk. In a medium bowl combine the bacon bits, jalapenos and bacon drippings and set aside. Preheat oven to 375. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients and the bacon mixture. Stir in the buttermilk mixture. Spoon the batter into the cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. Cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Peel the eggplants and cut into 1/2-inch slices. Beat together the remaining ingredients until well blended. Dip the slices into the batter and then coat with the bread crumbs. Fry in the hot oil until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.
In a non-stick pan, heat 1 tbsp oil over medium heat. Saute the garlic. Add in the tomatoes, olives and sugar. Simmer over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add in the fresh basil. Stir in the pasta. Serve.

Place fish in baking dish or glass baking pan. Drizzle with orange marmalade. Blend in low sodium soy sauce and minced garlic. Sprinkle with salt. Bake uncovered 30 minutes at 350 degrees f. Check to make sure fish is cooked through.

Soak sweetbreads in vinegar overnight. Remove from vinegar, pat dry. Drain fat from bacon and save 1 tbsp for the sauce. Fry sweetbreads in bacon fat until crispy. Set aside. Add butter to skillet. Cook flour to light brown. Add vinegar. Add sweetbreads to skillet. Add 1/4 cup water. Cook until thickened. Add garlic powder and bacon fat. Pour over sweetbreads.

Preheat oven to 400. Combine apple juice and apple in a small saucepan and cook until tender. Mash or puree. Combine apple mixture, syrup, spices and rice in a large bowl. Coat a 13x9 baking dish with cooking spray. Season chops with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chops and cook until browned, about 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Place chops in baking dish and bake for 30 minutes. Add squash and cook for additional 40 to 50 minutes. Serve with rice.

Heat the olive oil in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the country ham. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until crisp. Remove the cooked ham with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate. Add the butter to the skillet. Stir the red bell pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add the eggs and cook for 30 seconds. Add the heavy cream. Continue cooking for 1-2 minutes or until the eggs are set. Stir in the ham. Season with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the chili powder and the garlic powder. Serve immediately, garnished with the cheddar cheese.

Place a large saucepan over medium heat and add butter, sugar, honey and syrup. Heat gently until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in oats. Spread mixture into a 35cm x 25cm baking tray lined with baking parchment. Press down lightly with the back of a spoon to smooth the surface. Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Leave in the tray for a few minutes before cutting into squares. Cool completely in the tin on a wire rack before storing in an air-tight container.

In a large mixing bowl, mix cookie mix, egg, oil and water until a soft dough forms (no longer than 3 minutes). Divide into two equal portions, form each into a disc about 1/2 inch thick. Press one disc into the bottom of a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Spread raspberry jam over the top of the dough in the pan. Place the second cookie disc over the top of the jam and press lightly to adhere. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F. oven for about 35 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack before frosting with the cream cheese frosting (see above).

Mix the first five dry ingredients in a bowl. Add butter, cut into small pieces. Cream well. Add the orange peel and juice. Beat well. Add the eggs one at a time. Beat well. Add the fruit and nuts. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Cool before cutting. Makes one loaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9x13x2-inch pan with aluminum foil. Spray with cooking sprayset aside. Mix the chocolate chips and pecan pieces in a small bowl and set aside. Combine the cake mix, half-and-half and kahlua in a large mixing bowlbeat on low speed for 1 minute or until moistened. Add the egg and egg substitutebeat on medium speed for 2 minutes or until well blended. Spoon half of the batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle with the chocolate chip/pecan mixturegently spread the mixture evenly over the batter with a spatula. Drop the remaining batter evenly over the chocolate chip/pecan mixturespread with a spatula. Sprinkle with the coconut. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutesremove from the pan and cool completely on a wire rack before removing the foil.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paperset aside. Trim asparagus and cut into 1 inch piecesplace in a bowldrizzle with olive oil and toss to coat evenlysprinkle lightly with garlic salt and toss again. Spread evenly on prepared baking sheet. Roast until crisp-tender, about 12 minutesremove from oven and set aside. Meanwhile, in a small frying pan, combine toasted almonds and lemon juiceset aside. Drizzle warm asparagus with balsamic vinaigrettetoss to coat evenly. Sprinkle with toasted almond mixture and serve immediately.
Mix eggs, sugar, and flour together with the milk. Add cooked rice and margarine. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, or until well set. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Serves 4-6.

Mix together fine breadcrumbs, flour, paprika, margarine and poultry seasoning. Add salt and pepper to taste. Keep covered until ready to use. Melt margarine in pan and add chicken pieces. Cook on each side until done. Sprinkle with coating. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Heat butter over medium heat in a skillet until butter melts, then saute onion until it is soft. Add cranberries and cook for a few minutes longer. Add wine and honey and boil until it is reduced by half, then add rosemary and season with salt and pepper to taste. Slice the tenderloin into a thin round and roll it in flour and place the pieces in a baking dish. Pour the sauce over the meat and bake at 375 degrees for about an hour or until the meat is done (about 160 degrees). Let it rest for about 15 minutes before cutting it. Serves 12-15.

Rinse chicken and pat dry. Pour contents of rice mix in pan. Lay chicken on top of rice. Add the amount of water listed on the rice mix, i think its 2 cup, for each box. Sprinkle on dry soup mix. Dot with butter. Cook in a 350 oven for 45 minutes. Cooking time will vary based on type of chicken parts used. If you use boneless skinless chicken be sure to to adjust time or chicken will be very dry. Serve with veggies on the side.

In a large bowl, combine greens, apples, blue cheese, pecan halves, dried cherries. In a small bowl, combine mustard, maple syrup and apple cider vinegar. Slowly whisk in the olive oil. Season the dressing to taste with the salt and pepper. Drizzle over the salad. Serve immediately.

In a bowl of a food processor, combine butter, basil, marjoram, rosemary, chives and garlic. Process until smooth. With the machine running, drizzle in lemon juice. Add lemon zest and process briefly. Pack butter into molds or crocks or form balls with a melon baller. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Can be stored for upto 1 month in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer.

Boil water. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and return to pot. Melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in cream, garlic salt, pepper and bring to a simmer. Turn off heat and add cheeses. Add pasta and stir to combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate. Will keep for up to 3 days.

Brown beef stew meat in a skillet. Add potatoes, carrots, water, and onion soup mix to the crock pot. Brown meat in a skillet. Add to crock pot. Cook low for 6-8 hours. Add tomato sauce. Cook 1 hour longer.

Wash your hands. Slice your chicken breasts into long strips, and place them in a bowl. Add your garlic powder, white pepper, and salt. Mix together. Add your spaghetti sauce, and mix together. Add your mozzarella cheese. Put a small piece of goat cheese on each piece of chicken. Roll it up. Place it in a greased baking dish. Bake in a 325 degree oven until done.
Drain canned beans well. Combine all ingredients except lettuce leaf in a large bowl. Gently toss to combine. Place salad on lettuce leaf. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add onion and celerycook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add bell pepperscook until tender-crisp, about 8 minutes more. Drain fat from skillet. In a large saucepan, combine cooked barley with vegetable mixturestir in broth and water. Bring to a boilcook until barley is tender, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium-high heatadd ground turkeycook until no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Stir in tomato pastecook until mixture thickens slightly, about 2 minutes more. Add barley mixturebring to a boilcook for about 1 minute. Stir in parsleyseason with salt and pepper. Serve hot with crackers or bread.
Combine all ingredients in food processor or blender. Process until smooth. Refrigerate in airtight container. Yield: About 1 cup.

In a small bowl, combine the first seven ingredients. In a gallon zip top bag combine the seasoning mixture with the chicken thighs. Seal the bag and marinate for 2 hours. Preheat the barbecue to medium heat. Grill the thighs until well browned and cooked through. This recipe is perfect for barbecuing on the beach! The seasoning mixture is great for a variety of other dishes.

Combine sugar and water in medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Cook and stir 1 minute. Remove from heat and add lemon juice. Stir in watermelon and strawberries and let stand 15 minutes. Stir until well blended and refrigerate overnight. Divide between two tall glasses and top with 1/2 cup frozen lemonade and garnish with lemon slice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.In a large plastic bag combine the cereal, flour, thyme, and poultry seasoning.In the bag, place 1 chicken breast at a time, shaking to coat.In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter.Add the coated chicken to the skillet, turning to brown on both sides.In a 9x13-inch baking dish, place the browned chicken.Melt the remaining butterpour over the chicken.Bake uncovered for 30 to 40 minutes or until cooked through.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and green bell pepper and cook until soft. Add eggs and sour cream. Stir in picante sauce. Add flour tortillas. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch square pan with butter. In a medium bowl, combine the butter with the white sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the almond extract. In another bowl, combine the flour with the baking powder. Stir the ground almonds into the flour mixture. Alternate adding the dry ingredients and the milk to the egg mixture in three batches. Add the ground almonds. Mix until just blended. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. In a small bowl, mix together the confectioners' sugar with the corn syrup until smooth. Drizzle the glaze over the top of the cake. Garnish with the red glazed cherries.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet cook ground turkey until no longer pink. Drain off any fat and return turkey to skillet. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes over medium-high heat. Add cut green beans, undrained, stir well. Cook 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. In a medium bowl stir together the cream of mushroom soup and milk. Pour over turkey mixture in skillet. Sprinkle with cheese. Spread the tater tots evenly over the top. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until hot.

Combine ground meat, barbecue sauce, teriyaki sauce, chipotle chile in adobo and salt. Divide into 6 portions. Form into patties. Cook in a skillet over medium-high heat for 5 minutes per side or until cooked through. Place meat in hoagie rolls. Serve with extra barbecue sauce.

In a large bowl cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Stir in almond extract, flour, baking soda and salt. Chill dough for about half an hour. Divide dough into balls about the size of a small walnut and place on ungreased cookie sheet about two inches apart. Flatten each ball with a fork and place a sliver of almond in the center of each cookie. Beat egg white with a teaspoon of water to a glossy consistency. Brush each cookie with the egg white and sprinkle with granulated sugar. Bake in preheated oven for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on a rack. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl combine the bread, milk, eggs and butter and let sit for 15 minutes. In a large skillet brown the onions and green peppers and let cool. In a large bowl combine the tomatoes and the onions and green peppers with the mozzarella cheese and the basil and mix well. In a greased baking pan spread the bread mixture and top with the tomato mixture and bake for 1 hour. Serve warm.

Cook rice as directed. Cool. Add artichoke hearts. Arrange vegetables and parsley in a large bowl. Make dressing by combining lemon juice, rind and sugar in a small bowl. Add dressing to vegetables and rice and toss gently. Garnish with capers.
Mix all the dry ingredients and store in an airtight container. Apply liberally to the chicken and let sit for 15 minutes. Roast the chicken at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

In a bowl whisk together the egg whites with the water, and bring just to the soft ball stage (175-185). Turn off the heat, add the cinnamon and the salt, beat for a minute or so longer, then add the nuts all at once. Stir constantly while pouring onto the waxed paper, so that the nuts are evenly coated with the syrup. Cool and store in an airtight container.

Heat crushed pineapple in saucepan over medium heat until it thickensremove from heat and stir in orange zest, sugar and juice and allow to cool until lukewarm. Sprinkle in gelatin and stir until dissolved, then beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in neufchatel and vanilla until smooth and pour into prepared pie shell. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes to an hour until golden brown on top and center is set. Remove and let cool completely at least two hours before slicing. Serve at room temperature and refrigerate leftovers.

Combine all ingredients except wonton wrappers. Place 1 teaspoon mixture in each wrapper. Seal edges and roll up. Place 3 inches apart in a greased 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes or until puffed and golden. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.

For the crust: Mix the crumbs and butter together. Press into the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan.Bake for 10 minutes at 375 f degrees.For the filling: In a food processor combine the cream cheese, fat free cream cheese, lime juice, and salt. Blend until smooth. Add the splenda and beat until the mixture is smooth and fluffy.Beat the eggs in a large bowl with a mixer and slowly add them to the filling mixture. Blend until well incorporated.Pour the filling over the baked crust and bake for 45 minutes at 375 f degrees.Remove from the oven and let sit for one hour.Serve with fresh fruit.

Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, corn, eggs, milk, heavy cream, salt, and cayenne pepper. Stir until combined. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the melted butter and cornmeal. Sprinkle over the top of the rice mixture. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut 3-4 green peppers lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Place in a large bowl. Add 1 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp sea salt & 1/4 tsp black pepper, tossing to coat. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the peppers in 2 batchesstirring to prevent sticking & cook for 5 minutes per side or until they are crispy& golden brown. Serve with any meal or as an appetizer with dip of choice. Serves 2 to 4.

Toss red cabbage, orange bell pepper and canola oil together. Spread out on baking sheet. Broil for about 2 minutes or until vegetables are lightly browned. Let cool completely. In small bowl mix chili powder, celery seed and balsamic vinegar. Stir in sugar and mayonnaise. Toss with cooled vegetables. Sprinkle with peanuts.
Combine sugar, dry mustard, and salt in a small bowl. Add vinegar, onion juice, and oil. Blend well. Cover and chill. To serve, sprinkle over fruit. May also be used as a dip for vegetables.

Prepare pie crust according to package directions. Roll out bottom crust and place in a lightly greased 9-inch pie plate. Bake according to package directions. Meanwhile, mix together sugar, cornstarch and spices in a large saucepan. Stir in milk and bring to a boil. Add peaches and cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Pour peach mixture into baked pie shell and top with remaining crust. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 350. Cut each green chile lengthwise into three strips. In a large bowl combine chicken with soup, green chile strips, cream cheese, cumin, garlic and pepper. Add half of colby-monterey jack cheese and mix well. Spoon mixture into 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Bake 20-25 minutes until bubbly. Serve warm with toasted tortilla chips or crackers.

Place spinach leaves into a large bowlsprinkle with salt, then cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap to press out moisture. Heat oven to 375f. Working with 1 wonton wrapper at a time (cover remaining wrappers with a damp towel to keep from drying out), place 1 teaspoon ricotta in center of wrapper. Brush 1 corner of wrapper with water to seal. Fold corner to opposite side to form a trianglepress edges to seal. Repeat procedure with remaining wrappers and fillingplace pillows 1-inch apart on a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Bake in 375f oven about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle pillows evenly with parmesan cheese. Cut pillows in half diagonally before serving. Makes 36 pillows

Preheat oven to 350f. Toss together dressing and lemon juice until blended. Thread each fillet onto 2 to 3 skewers and place in an ungreased 9x13-inch baking dish. Combine remaining dressing ingredients in a small bowlpour over fish and bake uncovered for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 200 degree celcius. Cut chicken breast into cubes and toss in a bowl with the olives, the onion and the garlic. Season with the herbs and the juice of the lemon. Stir through the tomatoes. Toss to coat and place in a dish. Bake for 15 minutes and then scatter the lemon zest over and cook for a further 10-15 minutes.

In a large frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat, cook bacon until crispy. Remove bacon from pan leaving the bacon fat in the skillet. Add onion, garlic cloves and cook until onion is translucent. Add black beans and hot sauce and cook until heated through. Add ground cumin, salt and pepper to taste. Stir in sour cream and serve on your favorite baguette.

In a skillet cook ground beef until no longer pink. Stir in red beans and salsa. Stir in polenta until heated through. Spoon mixture into pie shell. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes. Cut into wedges.

Cook potatoes in large pot of boiling salted water until tender, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, bring half-and-half, goat cheese, butter, and basil to boil in small saucepan over medium-high heat. Remove from heat. Drain potatoes and return to pot. Add hot milk mixture and mash. Add goat cheese and mash until blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with basil leaves.

Melt 1/4 cup of teriyaki sauce with 1 teaspoon olive oil. Pour over strips. Let marinate for 1 hour. Put a slice of oysters on each strip. Grill 6-7 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Garnish with grated onion.
Place all ingredients in a medium-sized pot. Bring to boil on medium heat. Simmer for 2-3 minutes while stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Cool for 5-10 minutes. Serve warm over ice cream.

In a large bowl, stir together frozen concentrate and honey. Add poppyseed and toss with grapes and melon chunks. Chill until ready to serve. To serve, spoon over pear slices and sprinkle with almonds.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celcius and line two baking trays with grease proof paper. Cream together the unsalted butter and the caster and brown sugars until pale and creamy. Add the eggs and the milk and mix well until the mixture is light and creamy. Sift in the plain and self raising flours and the cocoa and mix well until there are no lumps left in the mixture. Add the melted chocolates and mix until just combined. Place spoonfuls of the mixture on the trays and press down slightly with a fork so they are about 3 cm in height. Bake in the oven for 12 minutes. Leave on the trays for a few minutes before transferring to a cooling rack and then store in an airtight container.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch slices. Place them in a large mixing bowl. Add the oil and Cajun seasoning and toss well. Spread the potato slices in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for about 35-40 minutes, until the potato slices are crispy and brown. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste and serve.

Place artichoke hearts in a sauce pan with the extra virgin olive oil and thyme leaves. Cook for about 20 minutes or until the water is mostly evaporated. Remove from heat and drain the water. Set aside. Pound the chicken breasts flat with a mallet or a rolling pin until they are about 1/4 inch thick. Place a heaping teaspoon of the artichoke heart mixture in the center of each chicken breast. Fold the sides of the chicken breast over the top of the artichoke heart mixture and press the edges together until the filling is covered. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on all sides. In a large skillet heat the vegetable oil over medium high heat. Cook the seasoned chicken breasts in the skillet for about 4 minutes on each side or until they are cooked through and golden brown. Remove from heat, top each breast with a tablespoon of the reserved artichoke heart mixture and a sprinkling of the grated parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Cook mushrooms in the microwave for 3 minutes or until tender, stirring once halfway through cooking time. Cut asparagus into 1-inch pieces and microwave in 2 tbs water for 5-7 minutes on high. Drain and rinse in cold water. In a large bowl, combine mushrooms and dressing. Add asparagus and toss lightly to combine. Top with almonds.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Mix oats and nuts. In a saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Stir in honey and cinnamon. Pour over oat mixture and stir to coat. Spread on cookie sheets. Bake for 30 minutes. Stir and bake for an additional 20 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in dried fruit. Allow to cool and store in an air tight container.

Bring a pot of salted water to boil. Add edamame and return to a boil. Cook 5 minutes. Drain in a colander and set aside. In a small bowl, stir together lemon juice and cajun seasoning and cayenne pepper. Toss with the edamame. Serve chilled or at room temperature. Serves 10-12

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt 1/2 pound of the braunschweiger sausage in a saucepan over low heat. Add the remaining braunschweiger to the saucepan, and cook for 45 seconds to 1 minute, stirring constantly. In a bowl, combine the sausage with the cream cheese, the garlic, diced onions, parsley, and chives. Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape into balls. Place the balls on an ungreased baking sheet, and bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Season fish with salt and pepper. Spray 10 x 15 glass baking dish with cooking spray. Lay fish in dish. Cover with foil. Bake 40 minutes. Mix remaining ingredients. Pour over fish. Cook 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped thyme.

In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in the barbecue sauce, then the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine the dry ingredientsstir into the creamed mixture. Divide into four partsroll each part into a log about 1 inch in diameter. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for one hour. Slice each log into thirdsplace on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake in a preheated 375 degree F (190 degree C) oven for about 12 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the cookie sheet for a few minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine 1/2 of the grated cheeses with 1/3 cup cornstarch. Heat the mixture until it starts to bubble. Whisk in the remaining grated cheeses. Remove from heat. Add the champagne. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Place the mixture into a fondue pot or slow cooker. Add the almond extract. Serve with apples, breadsticks or cubes of french bread. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F/Gas 4. Brush two 20cm/8in pie dishes with olive oil. Heat 1 tbsp. olive oil in a large pan. Add onion and garlic and sauté over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add tuna and season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Mix well to combine and cook for 5 minutes. Add beans, oregano, spinach and pecorino. Cook for 1 minute. In a bowl, beat together eggs with milk. Pour over the tuna mixture and mix well. Pour into pie dishes. Bake for 25 minutes or until set. Cool for 5 minutes before cutting into wedges.

Preheat a grill or grill pan. Brush the bread on both sides with a thin layer of olive oil and sprinkle with a little salt. Grill until lightly toasted and lightly charred on the edges. Rub the slices of eggplant with a little olive oil and season them with salt and pepper. Grill them for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until softened but still firm. Cut the plum tomatoes into 1/4 inch thick slices. Grill them for 1 to 2 minutes on each side until they start to soften. Sprinkle the top of the toast with the tomato slices and a few of the basil leaves. Place a slice of mozzarella on the bottom half of the toast. Top with a few more tomato slices and basil leaves and a slice of mozzarella. Top with the top half of the toast and serve.

Melt butter in 10 inch pie pan. Stir in the oats and press onto bottom and up sides of pan. Bake in a 350 degrees oven for 8 minutes. Cool completely. Beat cream cheese until soft and fluffy. Blend in sugar and flour. Beat in eggs. Add frozen juice concentrate and mix well. Pour into crust. Bake in a 350 degrees oven for 25 minutes. Cool completely. Drain mandarin oranges, reserving juice. Puree oranges with juice in blender until smooth. Spread over cheesecake. Top with marshmallows. Refrigerate 8 hours or until firm. Spread with frosting before serving.

Peel carrots and chop into 1/2 inch pieces. Core pears, chop into small pieces, or grate. Combine all together in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil for 5 minutes. Add lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove. Cook an additional 5 minutes or until carrots are tender. Add sugar and cook for 1 minute more or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in pectin. Ladle into hot jars. Let cool and seal. Process in boiling water bath for 15 minutes.

Combine the chicken, kidney beans, salsa, tomato sauce, chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic clove and cheese in a large bowl. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until heated through. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
Heat oven to 375. Cream together butter, sugar. Add eggs, one at a time. Add dry ingredients. Stir in jam. Drop by teaspoon onto cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Wash and scrub the potatoes, then cut them into wedges. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add potato wedges and garlic clovesstir-fry for about 2 minutes. Season with salt, black pepper, and rosemary sprigsstir-fry for an additional minute. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes, or until golden brown. Serves 6.

Heat a large saute pan over medium high heat. Add the oil. When it shimmers add the brussels sprout halves. Season with the salt. Saute, stirring occasionally, until the sprouts are nicely browned. Sprinkle the sriracha sauce over the top. Pour over the lime juice. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Top the sprouts with the honey. Serve immediately.

Beat eggs with icing sugar, kirsch and anise seed. Add flour, mix well. Turn out onto lightly floured surface. Roll out very thinly. Cut into shapes with biscuit cutter or knife. Bake on lightly greased tray at 400 f for 10 minutes or till lightly browned. Remove from oven, brush with egg yolk wash if desired. Cool on trays.

Bring water to a boil. Stir in cream of tartar and salt. Stir sugar into hot mixture until dissolved. Bring mixture to a full boil. Cook 3 minutes or until a candy thermometer reads 220 degrees f. Pour mixture through a strainer into a glass bottle. Allow to cool to room temperature before using.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease and flour a 9x13 pan. Stir together all the dry ingredients. Add the bananas and mix together. Add the beaten eggs and mix. Add the vegetable oil and mix. Add the chocolate chips and stir. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Prepare the onion soup and water in a bowl. Prepare the meat according to the package directions. Place the meat into a shallow casserole dish. Pour the onion soup mixture over the meat. Bake for 2 hours. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a large skillet or saute pan, brown the veal in hot olive oil on both sides. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and their liquid. Stir in the oregano and season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. In another heavy bottomed saucepan, melt the butter and add the white wine. Stir and let simmer for 1 minute. Add the veal and its cooking liquid and simmer for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Melt margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook, stirring frequently, until golden. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove skillet from heat. In a small bowl combine soymilk and cornstarch. Stir into skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add garlic powder to taste. Combine green beans, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a 2-quart baking dish. Pour sauce over the top. Sprinkle with fried onions. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees. Toss broccoli with garlic and teriyaki sauce. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray and spread broccoli out on pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Toss and bake for another 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Cook the rice in the water until tender but not mushydrain and set aside. In a large bowl combine the rice with the marshmallows, the pineapple and cherriesstir until mixed. In a separate bowl combine the heavy whipping cream and the sugarstir until the mixture is thick enough to spread over the rice mixture. Spread the mixture over the rice mixture and sprinkle with the slivered almonds and the maraschino cherriesrefrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat the oil over medium-high heat and add the onions. Cook until they are soft. Stir in the mushrooms and cook until they are soft. Add the spinach and the stock and simmer until the spinach is wilted. In a 2-quart casserole dish, combine the spaghetti and the onion mixture. Add the tomatoes and the rest of the stock and mix well. Bake at 375 degrees F for 35-40 minutes. Top with the grated cheddar and serve.

In a medium soup pot, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until softened. Add the potato and saute for 2 minutes. Add 2 cups of the chicken stock, bay leaf, sweet red pepper and brussels sprouts. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for about 20 minutes. Add remaining chicken stock as needed. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove bay leaf. Ladle into bowls and garnish with parsley. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f (220 degrees c).Place the beets, parsnips, baby carrots, brown sugar, and olive oil into a medium bowltoss to coat well.Transfer the vegetables to a single layer on a large baking sheet lined with parchment paper.Roast in the preheated oven until the vegetables are tender, stirring once halfway through the cooking time.Remove from the oven and place into a large serving bowlstir in the shiitake mushrooms, apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper.

Combine the soy sauce, green onion, sesame oil, honey and garlic in a small bowl. Rub the mixture evenly over the chicken and sprinkle the ground ginger and black pepper over the top. Roast in the oven at 450 for 45-60 minutes or until the chicken is cooked and the skin is crispy.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 2 cup in a muffin tin. Break an egg in both and break the yoke with a fork. Cook for 10 - 15 minutes until eggs are white and cooked. Cook the sausage rounds over medium heat in one teaspoon of oil till cooked. Toast english muffins. When finished toasting, use margarine or butter as spread. Make your sandwich. Add sausage, cheese, then the egg. Enjoy and review recipe.

Season steak with salt and pepper. Heat 1/2 teaspoon oil in skillet. Brown steak over high heat for 5 minutes on each side. Remove steak and keep warm. Add remaining oil and onion to pan. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Stir in soup, water and mustard. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Spoon steak over rice and top with mushrooms. Sprinkle with parsley.
Mix together the flour, water, vinegar and salt. Bring to a boil. Add the potatoes. Boil for 3 minutes. Add the cucumbers, radishes and onion. Boil for 5 minutes more. Serve.

Season the chicken with garlic powder, dried basil, salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken, turning once. Place the onion in a slow cooker. Add the garlic. Add the chicken. Combine the vinegar and water and pour over the chicken. Cook on low heat for 3 hours. Sprinkle with parsley.

Sift together the dry ingredients. In a bowl, mix the eggs, vanilla extract and melted margarine. Combine the dry mixture and the liquid mixture until well blended. Add the nuts, the candied cherry and the dates and mix thoroughly. Place batter in a greased loaf pan and bake for 50 minutes at 350 degrees F.

Spray skillet with nonstick spray. In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add the cheese slice, place a tomato slice on each slice of bread. Add the bacon. Place the sandwiches on the skillet, spread the sides of the breads with mayonnaise, and top the sandwiches with the remaining cheese slice. Cook on each side until golden brown and the cheese is melted, about 4 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9-inch pie plate with a pastry crust. Trim to fit plate. In a large bowl, stir together sugar, flour, nutmeg, salt, and eggs. Stir in rhubarb. Transfer rhubarb filling to pie crust. Place top pastry crust on filling and seal. Crimp edge of pie crust and brush with melted butter. Sprinkle with sugar. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour in the preheated oven until filling is bubbling and pastry is golden. Cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Mix together soup and corn. Set aside. Mix together corn muffin mix and milk until soft dough forms. Stir in eggs. Drain cooked chicken. Divide mixture between two large pie plates. Top each pie with half the corn/soup mixture and half the chicken. Bake for 45 minutes. Let cool for ten minutes. Serve with chilled sour cream.

In a heavy nonstick pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until golden. Stir in the broccoli, cook for 4 minutes. Add the lemon juice, stirring to coat. Add the chicken. Heat through for 3-4 minutes. Cook the spaghetti according to directions. Drain. Add the tomatoes and basil. Stir. Top with Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Cut the lemongrass stalks into 5cm pieces and thread onto skewers alternating with the chicken. Heat the oil in a wok until smoking hot. Add the chicken and lemongrass and cook for about 2 minutes or until the chicken is just cooked through. Add the lime rind and cook for 30 seconds. Remove from the wok and set aside. Dissolve the sugar in the lime juice and stir in the coriander leaves and chiles. Season with salt and serve with the chicken and skewers.

Bring large pot of salted water to a boil. Add ziticook 8-10 minutes or until al dentedrain. Combine olive oil, italian-style stewed tomatoes (with juice), italian-style tomato sauce, oregano, parsley, black pepper, and sausage in large skillet. Bring to boil. Add ziti to skillet. Sprinkle ziti mixture with cheese. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over ziti. Bake 8-10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve topped with parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Bring the water to a boil. Remove from heat and add the tea bags and let steep for five minutes. Remove the tea bags and discard them. Slice the navel oranges and lemons into thin slices and add them to the tea. Add the orange and lemon juices to the tea mixture. Stir in honey to taste and cool to room temperature. Pour over ice and top with ginger ale.

Place water and sugar in your bread machine. Let sit for 5 minutes until foamy. Add oil and melted butter to mix, then add skim milk powder and flour. Select basic or white bread setting and press start.

Rub pork with salt and pepper. Place in slow cooker with onions and ginger ale. Cover and cook on low for 16 hours or until tender. Strain off fat and shred with a fork or two forks. Add barbecue sauce to taste. Serve on a bun with coleslaw.

Melt the margarine in the microwave and stir in the cocoa until smooth. Stir in the marshmallows and mix until smooth. Stir in the nuts and chocolate chips until evenly distributed. Press into a greased pan and refrigerate until solid. Cut into bars and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Dice the meat into one-inch cubes. Brown the meat lightly in the oil in a skillet. In the Crock Pot combine the meat with the other ingredients except noodles. Cook on low for 8 hours or until tender. Add noodles to serve.

Combine sugar, corn syrup, butter and cream in a 2 qt heavy saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, to the hard ball stage. Remove from heat. Add chopped almonds. Pour into small fluted paper dessert cups or drop from teaspoon onto waxed paper- to make patties.

In food processor place garlic, salt and pepper. Process to a smooth paste. Add cheese and process until smooth. Add olive oil and vinegarprocess until smooth. Add the Worcestershire sauce. Remove processor lid and add the egg yolkprocess until smooth. Add romaine lettuce leaf. Toss until coated. Add bacon bits and toss. Chill until ready to serve.

In a small bowl, combine the green onions and the jalapenos. Mince and stir in the honey and lemon juice. Reserve 1 tablespoon of the mixture. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the remaining mixture. Add the chicken and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator at least 1 hour or overnight. Grill the chicken, turning once, until cooked through and lightly charred. Serve with the remaining minced mixture.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper muffin cups. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt into a bowl and set aside. In a large bowl cream together butter, sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. Stir in milk and vanilla extract. Add the dry ingredients and stir just until combined. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Combine all but the beef in a bowl. Brown the beef in the skillet with the oil. Place the browned beef in the bottom of the slow cooker. Pour the remaining mixture over the meat. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve on buns.

In a large mixing bowl cream together the butter and sugars until well blended. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until smooth. Sift in the flour and add in the salt and baking soda. Stir just until blended. Fold in the walnuts and chocolate chips. Cover dough and refrigerate at least one hour. Preheat oven to 350. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks and cool completely. Makes 4 dozen.

Cream eggs and sugar together for about a minute or two, then add banana and mix well. Sift together the potato flour and the salt in a bowl and add it to the mixture. Pour mixture into a greased and floured bundt pan and bake at 175 for about 40-45 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean from the center of the cake. Cool for ten minutes and then take out and cool completely on a wire rack.

Mix together the cheese spread and the cream cheese in the crock pot. Add the rotel and smoked sausage to the mixture. Stir in the sour cream. Turn on the crockpot on high heat until the dip is melted. Then turn it to low heat to keep warm until served. Serve with crackers or vegetables of your choice.

Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium high heat. Saute the onion and garlic for 5 minutes. Stir in the wine and cook for 3 minutes more. Meanwhile, chop the bacon into small pieces and cook in a small saute pan until crisp. Stir the onion mixture into the pan and add the bacon and salt and pepper to taste. Continue cooking for 2 minutes more and serve at once.

Pour caramel topping into the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Combine milk with pudding mix in a small bowlset aside to thicken. Crush toffee bars into small pieces and sprinkle on top of caramel. Spread pudding mixture on top of toffee pieces. Spread cool whip over pudding mixture. Chill for 2 hours before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Combine the pineapple-orange juice concentrate with 1/2 cup water in a small saucepanbring to a boil over high heat. Stir in the butterremove from the heat. Place the chicken between 2 sheets of plastic wrappound to 1/4-inch thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin. Combine the remaining 1/2 cup water, the soy sauce, the ground ginger and the cornstarch in a small bowlstir well. Heat the vegetable oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over high heat until hot. Add the chickencook until no longer pink in the center, about 2 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pankeep warm. Add the pineapple-orange juice mixture to the panstir and scrape up any browned bits. Cook until thickened and reduced to 2 tablespoonsstir in the soy-ginger mixture. Return the chicken to the panturn to coat. Bake until no longer pink in the center and the

Cook the barley in a large saucepan of boiling water for 50 minutes. Drain and rinse under running cold water. In a small bowl combine vinegar, oil and basil. Toss with the barley. Add the corn and tomato. Season with salt.

Peel and slice the sweet onions. Place them in the bottom of the Crock Pot. Add the brisket, making sure it is fat side down. Sprinkle with garlic salt, salt-free lemon pepper and spicy brown mustard. Pour the bourbon over the meat and place the top on. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Remove the brisket and slice thin. Strain the cooking juices into a measuring cup. Add the bourbon and barbecue sauces to the juices and bring to a simmer. Stir in the brown sugar and cook for 10 minutes. Serve the brisket over mashed potatoes with the barbecue sauce drizzled over it. Garnish with green onions and more bourbon, if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the rolled oats, walnuts, golden raisins and flax seed. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, honey and oil. Heat the brown sugar mixture in the microwave for about 1 minute or until it is runny. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the dry mixture and stir well. Spread the mixture out on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for about 15 minutes. After baking, remove from the oven and stir well. Add in the cinnamon and vanilla. Store in an air tight container.

Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse meal. Spread in a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Cream together margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg beating well. Beat in lemon juice concentrate. Spread over the hot crust. Bake for another 15-20 minutes. Cool completely. Sprinkle with coconut. Cut in squares.

Place all ingredients into bread pan fitted with kneading blade. Select the dough cycle. Scrape down the pan sides 5 and 10 minutes into the cycle. Transfer to clean jars. Let cool and cover with a lid. Refrigerate up to 4 days. Keeps refrigerated 2 weeks.

Dice 2 of the strawberries.
