Set aside.Cut a thin slice from the stem ends of each remaining strawberry, forming a base for strawberries to stand on.Cut each strawberry into 4 wedges, starting at the pointed ends and cutting to but not through the stem ends.Beat cream cheese until fluffy.Stir in diced strawberries, nuts, splenda, and extract.Pipe about 1 tablespoon mixture into each strawberry.Chill until serving.

In a large skillet or saucepan, brown the meat with the onions and bell peppers in butter. Add the garlic and continue cooking until vegetables are tender. Add the remaining ingredients, except the cabbage. Heat to boiling. Add cabbage and simmer until tender. Cook 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add more water if sauce becomes too thick.

Soak dry chilies overnight in water, until soft. Remove seeds. Add all ingredients except meat in food processor. Puree until smooth. Spread mixture over chicken, or other meats and refrigerate at least one hour, up to 24 hours. After marinating, heat grill to about 400 degrees f, or if cooking inside, heat small amount of oil in skillet or grill pan over high. Heat. Salt meat to taste, and grill lightly, turning only once, until done. 4 minutes per side of chicken.
Arrange romaine and baby spinach in a large salad bowl. Top with hearts of palm and cucumber. Arrange tomatoes and carrots next. Top with red onion and frozen green peas. Add capers and toss well.

Heat the olive oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Saut the onion until soft and translucent. Add the ginger and continue to saut for another 30 seconds. Stir in the carrots and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Add honey and reduce heat to medium. Simmer uncovered for 25 minutes. Allow to cool slightly and then pure in batches in a blender or food processor until smooth. If you prefer to serve the soup hot, return to the stock pot. Add additional chicken broth to thin and heat through. If serving cold, transfer to individual bowls and serve topped with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut the top and bottom off of the squash, and then slice in half the long way. Place the two halves, cut side down, on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or foil. Bake for 1 hour 30 minutes, or until the flesh is soft when pierced with a fork. Remove from the oven and set aside for 10 minutes to cool slightly. In a mixing bowl, beat the melted butter and brown sugar together until smooth. Brush the mixture onto the inside of each half of the squash. Sprinkle with the ground cinnamon. Return to the oven for 10 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Pound the filet of beef to 1/4-inch thickness and season with salt and pepper. Dust with flour. Brown in hot butter. Add a little beef stock and continue cooking. Add the tomatoes and a little more stock. Stir in prepared mustard and the onion and continue cooking for about 10 minutes. Add the white mushrooms and cook for another 10 minutes. Stir in the sour cream and simmer for another 2 minutes. Serve with rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl, combine all the above ingredients except the swiss cheese. Lay the canadian bacon slices on the bottom of a 13x9-inch glass baking dish. Place the chicken breasts on top of the canadian bacon. Pour the milk mixture over the top. Sprinkle with the cheese. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 minutes longer until the top is browned. Serve hot.

In a heavy skillet, melt the butter. Saute the celery, green onions, and rice for about 2 minutes. Add the juice, salt and pepper. Cover the skillet and cook until the liquid is absorbed. Add the almonds. Serve hot.

In a skillet cook the beef and onions until no longer pink. Drain. Add taco seasoning, water and sweet corn. Heat through. In a greased 1-1/2 quart casserole combine the macaroni and soup. Spoon the beef mixture over the macaroni. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake at 400F for about 20 minutes. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes and sour cream.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 loaf pans. In large bowl, cream together 1 cup of the sugar and 1 cup of the butter. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in lemon juice. Combine the flour, baking powder, and saltmix into the creamed mixture on low speed just until combined. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes more. Divide evenly between prepared loaf pans. Bake for 1 hour 25 minutes to 1 hour 35 minutes, until golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire racks.

Slice mushrooms 1/4-inch thick. Cut shallots into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Combine vinegar and olive oil in a small bowl. Add thyme. Place half of the vinegar mixture into a 1-cup glass measure. Add 1/4 cup vinegar mixture and half of the shallot slices and mushroom slices to an 8-inch square glass baking dish. Repeat layering. Cover and refrigerate 24 hours. Garnish with remaining vinegar mixture and remaining shallot and mushroom slices. Let stand 1 hour before serving.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Meanwhile, heat oil and garlic in large skillet over medium heat. Add tuna and cook until heated through, stirring occasionally. Add broth and simmer 2 minutes or until reduced slightly. Add pasta and stir until well coated. Sprinkle with parsley and season with cayenne pepper before serving.

In a bowl combine the cucumbers, cherry and yellow pear tomatoes. Stir in the lemon juice and vinegar. Slowly add the flax seed oil while whisking. Add the dijon mustard, garlic clove and the fresh dill. Toss until well blended. Chill for one hour or until ready to serve.
In a blender or food processor, combine all ingredients and process until very smooth. Pour smoothies into 4 glasses and serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375. Whisk together first 6 ingredients in medium bowlset aside. In a large bowl, beat together strawberries and rhubarb. Add flour mixture and beat until combined. Fold in 1/2 cup chopped walnuts. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden and a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pancool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar.
Place bread cubes in 9-inch pie pan. Mix together remaining ingredients and pour over cubes. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 13-in x 9-in baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine cheese, garlic and water. Combine 1 1/2 cups water, butter and stuffing in a large bowl and mix well. Spread half the stuffing mixture over bottom of prepared dish. Top with half the cheese mixture. Top with 4 chicken breast halves (skin side down), then sprinkle with half the remaining cheese mixture. Spread remaining stuffing mixture over top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese mixture. Bake 45 minutes or until juices run clear and crust is golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut into 2-inch squares. Garnish with parsley, if desired. Makes 9 servings.

Combine all ingredients except the fish in a bowl and mix well. Pour half the mixture over the fish and bake for about 45 minutes in a 350 oven. Turn the fish over and pour the remainder of the sauce over the fish and continue to bake for 45 minutes more. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut the top off the pear so you can core it. Cut out the core. Drizzle the pear with melted butter. Sprinkle with the spice. Bake until soft. Sprinkle the almonds on top. Serve warm.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl and transfer to a 9 x 13-inch baking pan that has been greased and sprinkled with flour or cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour or until potatoes are tender and golden brown on top. Serves 8-10.

In 9-in. X 13-in. Baking dish, layer salmon and top with dressing. Cover with vegetables. Cover with foil. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine all ingredients and marinate shrimp for at least 1 hour in refrigerator. Preheat broiler. Remove shrimp from marinade and place on broiler pan. Broil 3 inches from heat for 5 to 8 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through and firm to touch. Serve with tooth picks for easy serving.

Peel the potatoes and slice thinly. Wash the leeks thoroughly and slice thinly discarding about the last 2 inches of the green tops. Mix together the flour, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Grease a casserole dish. Put in alternate layers of potatoes and leeks sprinkling each layer with the seasoned flour and small chips of butter. The top layer should be potatoes. Dot the top with butter, pour hot milk on top of the casserole. Bake in the oven uncovered for about 1 hour.

Peel ginger root and slice thinly. Combine vinegar, sugar, and water in saucepan. Bring to boil and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add sliced ginger and cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Combine dates, soft brown sugar, crystallized ginger and 400 ml cold water in a saucepan over low heat. Bring just to the boil, then simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally until the dates have softened and the liquid has reduced by half. Set aside until cool enough to handle. Preheat oven to 175 C. Grease a 20 cm x 20 cm square pan. Sift together self-raising flour and bicarbonate of soda into a large mixing bowl and set aside. Beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat the eggs, one at a time, until well combined. Add the mixture from the saucepan to the flour mixture. Stir until smooth then fold through the beaten mixture until combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the surface. Bake for 35 minutes or until the edges start to brown and a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool slightly before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the green bell pepper and mushrooms and saute until the mushrooms have given off their liquid. Add the tomatoes and garlic powder. Cook and stir until the tomatoes have broken down. Add the rice and stir to coat with the tomato mixture. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in the condensed chicken broth, cover and simmer an additional 10 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Serve hot.
Cook the spinach as directed on the bag. Drain and cool slightly. In a large bowl combine the spinach with the rest of the ingredients and toss to combine. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil, garlic & onions and cook until tender, about 2 minutes. Add the brussels sprouts and saute for 3 minutes. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and cook until the liquid is absorbed and the sprouts are tender-crisp. Season with butter, salt & pepper to taste.

Place 1/2 cup of seeds in a food processor or blender along with 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil. Pulse a few times to combine. Then add 1 tablespoon of granulated sugar and 1/4 teaspoon of sea salt and pulse until the seeds are ground into a paste. Add more oil if needed to help move things along and until you achieve your desired texture. Once you’re done, store your sunflower seed butter in an air tight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 6 months! Enjoy!
Microwave 4-5 minutes or until done. Add nuts. Combine butter, syrup, sugar, & vanilla. Bring to boil& stir in soda. Pour over popcorn. Cool.

Combine the flour, eggs, milk and salt in a large bowl. Beat the mixture with an electric mixer until well blended. Stir in the cheese. Pour into the pie crust. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Continue baking for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the ham over the top. Bake for 15 minutes longer or until set. Serve hot or cold.
Mix all ingrediants together. Serve chilled. Garnish with frozen cranberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line an 8 x 8 inch baking pan with parchment paper. In a medium bowl combine the beans with 1 cup water. Set aside. In a separate bowl combine the eggs, granulated sugar and canola oil. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the vanilla extract. Add the bean mixture and mix until well combined. Add the baking powder, cinnamon and oats. Mix until just combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spread evenly into the pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Cool in the pan for 15 minutes before cutting into 16 bars.

Heat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. Melt half the butter in a large non-stick frying pan. Add the cutlets and fry for 2-3 minutes, turning once, then remove from the pan. Add the remaining butter to the pan with the sliced garlic. Cook for 30 seconds until the garlic is golden. Add the apricots and cook for 3 minutes. Pour in the stock and reduce to a syrup. Transfer to a bowl to cool. Stir in the parsley. Mix together the breadcrumbs and parmesan. Brush the cutlets with the remaining butter. Season with salt. Roll the cutlets in the breadcrumb mixture and arrange in a single layer on a large baking tray. Bake for 10-15 minutes until cooked through. Spoon the cooled sauce over the pork. Serve with the corn.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the low sodium chicken broth. Bring the broth to a boil and then reduce the heat and let simmer for about 5 minutes. Then add the pumpkin puree and cook for about 10 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and allow the mixture to cool. Then transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Then return the mixture to the pot and whisk in the whipping cream. Add the dark brown sugar, ground cumin, chili powder and ground coriander. Whisk until the sugar and spices have dissolved and the mixture has heated through. Just before serving stir in the fresh cilantro. To serve place a dollop of sour cream in the center of each bowl and sprinkle with shredded sharp cheddar cheese.

Dip the tortillas in a small amount of milk and place in a single layer in a shallow dish. Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in flour, sour cream and cream cheese. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes or until the mixture is thick and smooth. Stir in the green pepper and onion. Remove from heat. Heat oven to 450 degrees f. Place a small amount of sour cream mixture in the center of each of 4 corn tortillas. Layer 1/4 of the sour cream mixture over the chicken in each of 4 large baking dishes. Add 1/2 cup of the sour cream mixture to each baking dish. Top with 1/4 of the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheese. Spoon 1/4 of the sour cream mixture over the cheese in each dish. Add 1/4 of the sour cream mixture and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes or until the

Lightly spray large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Mash Special K cereal in small bowlset aside. In another bowl, beat the egg substitute and milk with whisk until blended. Add 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg. Dip 1 side of each slice of bread in egg mixture. Cook on skillet 1 minute on each side until golden brown. Serve with mashed cereal and sliced bananas. Makes 4 servings.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of mixture into each olive. Refrigerate overnight to blend flavors. Makes about 3 dozen stuffed olives.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat eagle brand and margarine until smooth. Add cracker mixture and mix well. Stir in raisins, coconut and nuts. Drop by rounded tbsp onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheet to wire racks. Cool completely.

Cut steaks into 1-inch cubes. Sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet. Add steak. Cook until no longer pink. Drain. Add parsley and mix well. Put in rolls. Spread mayonnaise on rolls. Sprinkle with water. Wrap. Squeeze gently. Serve with sour cream.

Wash and dry the bell peppers. Cut the tops off the peppers. Cut out the seeds and membranes. Save the tops for decorating the dish. Add the meat, garlic, and Tabasco. Cook until done, about 10 minutes. Drain and add the lemon juice. In the meantime, mix the egg with the breadcrumbs. Beat the egg well. Mix the meat mixture with the egg. Stuff the bell peppers. Roll the peppers in the breadcrumbs. Drizzle with the melted butter. Place the bell peppers in an ovenproof pan. Cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover the pan. Bake for 15 minutes.

In a wok or frying pan heat the oil. Add the curry paste and stir fry for about 30 seconds. Add dried shrimp and stir for another 30 seconds. Add greenbeans and stir fry for about 2 minutes. Add pork and stir fry for about 2 minutes or until pork is no longer pink. Add chicken stock and fish sauce. Bring to a boil. Add palm sugar. Simmer for 1 minute. Add lime leaves. Serve over rice.
Cut a pocket in the thick part of the chicken breasts. Stuff with cheese and bacon. Close pocket with toothpicks. Grill breasts until done.

Mix all ingredients except the tequila in a large container, such as a pitcher. Chill until ready to serve. Mix in the tequila just before serving. If you want a stronger drink, add more tequila. Serve in a punch bowl or individual cups. Garnish with a slice of lime if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a 9-inch pie dish, combine broccoli, salmon, swiss cheese, chives, dill weed and cayenne pepper. In a medium bowl beat together eggs, whipping cream, milk and salt. Pour egg mixture into pie dish. Bake for 1 hour or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Set aside. In a medium bowl, beat the egg yolks until fluffy. Gradually add the sugar and beat until thick and lemon-colored. Add the milk and vanilla extract. Stir in the cream cheese. Spread the filling evenly on the prepared loaf. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove and let cool. Slice diagonally and serve with fruit and sweet cream.

Preheat broiler. In a medium, non-reactive bowl, combine the butter, lemon juice, parsley, garlic, black pepper and crushed red pepper. Set aside. Thread thawed shrimp onto skewers and cover with marinade. Broil 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until done. Serve over cooked pasta.

In a small bowl combine tapioca and 1/2 cup water and let stand until tapioca is softened. In a large bowl combine berries, sugar, lemon juice and cinnamon. Add tapioca mixture and stir well. Pour into pastry shell. Beat sour cream and remaining sugar until blended. Spread over filling. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Serve at room temperature. Garnish with berries.

Grease and line a 30cm x 20cm baking tray with baking paper. Beat the butter and golden syrup until pale and creamy. Add the sweetened condensed milk and beat to combine. Stir in the sliced biscuit until well combined. Press into the baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until set. Remove from oven and sprinkle over the slivered almonds. Place back into the oven and bake for a further 5 minutes or until the almonds are toasted. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Meanwhile, melt the Copha. Drizzle over the almonds and sprinkle over the chocolate. Place in the fridge until set. Cut into squares.
beat egg in large bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cool 5 minutes. Shape into 32 patties. Coat with flour. Fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serves 6.

In large mixing bowl, cream butter until fluffy. Beat in the sugar, beating constantly. Beat in the egg, then add the flour gradually. Stir in the orange juice, orange zest and vanilla. Divide the mixture evenly into four 4-ounce ramekins or custard cups. Place the ramekins in a large glass bowl. Bring the water to a boil in a large skillet, reduce the heat to low and place the bowl into the skillet. Cover with the lid of the skillet. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until the edges are set. Remove from the skillet, place in the refrigerator for 1 hour or longer. Make the sauce while the pudding is baking. In another bowl, combine the butter and the cocoa powder until smooth. Slowly whisk in the water and the orange juice. Serve the warm pudding with the sauce. Makes 4 servings.

Cream the butter with the granulated sugar. Add the milkbeat well. Combine the cocoa and quick-cooking rolled oatsstir into the creamed mixture. Add the coconut, walnuts, salt, and vanillamix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 for 6-8 minutes or until the edges are firm. Cool on a wire rack. Makes about 2 dozen.

In a large bowl beat together the butter and brown sugar until light and creamy. Beat in the treacle, eggs and vanilla until well blended. Sift together the plain and self-raising flours and add to the mixture along with the spices. Mix well and wrap in cling film and chill for at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 180c or 350f. Divide dough into 10 even pieces and roll out flat. Cut out using a star shaped cutter and place on a lightly greased baking tray about 1 inch apart. Bake for about 10 minutes until lightly brown on top. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add eggs, milk, nutmeg, salt and pepperstir until well blended. Add fresh corncook until heated through. Transfer to a 2 quart baking dishsprinkle with 1/3 of the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheesebake for 5 more minutes. Serves 6.

Place cauliflower florets, carrot & red onion into a large bowl. Add margarine. Toss until evenly coated. Add mushrooms & stir until coated with margarine. Place into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F oven for 15 minutes. Add lemon juice & stir. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with basil & marjoram. Makes 12 servings.

In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine the heavy cream, whole milk, and brown sugar. Heat over low heat until just before it boils. Remove from heat, cover, and let steep for at least 1 hour and up to 3 hours. In a large bowl, combine the egg yolks, gingerroot, and honey. Whisk together until smooth. Temper the ginger mixture into the hot cream mixture by pouring it a little at a time into the bowl with the ginger mixture while whisking constantly until smooth. Return the mixture to the pan over low heat and cook until the custard thickens enough to coat a spoon and registers 185 degrees on an instant read thermometer, 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, combine the salt, heavy cream, and vanilla in a large bowl and beat until soft peaks form. Fold the warm ginger custard into the heavy cream mixture using a rubber spatula or large spoon. Place in an ice-cream maker according to the manufacturers instructions. Serve immediately or transfer to an airtight container

In a small saucepan combine milk, honey, ginger, cloves and red pepper. Heat over medium heat until very warm. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa until well mixed. Stir in vanilla. Pour into cups. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

Cook pasta and set aside. In a medium skillet heat butter and add the mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are brown and juice is gone. Add turkey and cook for a minute. Add the soup and milk. Heat through and add sour cream. Salt and pepper to taste. Place pasta in a large bowl and mix turkey and soup with pasta. Add the parsley and toss well. Serve hot.

Place cereal and nuggets in large bowl. Add spaghetti mix and garlic powder. Toss lightly. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add cereal mixture and stir fry until thoroughly heated. Drizzle with olive oil and serve warm.

Heat oil in skillet over med-high heat. Brown chops on both sides. Sprinkle onions over chops in skillet. Coverreduce heatsimmer 10 minutes, stirring often. Stir in soup mix. Add vegetablesbring to boil. Cook uncovered 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Combine broth and rice in bowlspoon over vegetable mixture in skilletcovercook over med-low heat until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes.

Preheat the grill to medium-high. In a saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the butter. When the butter is melted, add the mushrooms and the garlic. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the mushrooms have released their juices. Stir in the chives. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes more. Transfer the mushrooms to a shallow bowl. Top with the chives, if you like. Serve hot or warm.
Put all the ingredients in a bowl or jar and stir well until the mixture is smooth. Pour into cups. Serve hot with lots of cinnamon sprinkled on top.

Fry the onion and garlic until they turn golden brown. Add the passata, and add the spices and the green cardamom seeds. Mix well. Add the water and salt and simmer. Add the vegetable oil just before serving.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallot, Hungarian paprika, and 1 teaspoon salt. Cook until the shallot is softened, about 4 minutes. Add the tomatoes and their juices. Cook until the mixture is thickened, about 2 minutes. Pour into a small bowl. Add the sour cream, 1 teaspoon salt, and the pepper. Stir to combine. In a medium saucepan of boiling salted water, add the potatoes. Cook until they are just tender, about 10 minutes. Drain well. Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Add the cooked potatoes. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Stir in the cream mixture. Stir well. Serve.

In a 10 inch square casserole dish spread 1/2 can of the enchilada sauce. Microwave tortillas until soft. Put 2 tablespoons mozzarella cheese on top of each tortilla and roll up. Place rolled up tortillas on top of enchilada sauce in casserole. Pour the other can of enchilada sauce on top of tortillas. Bake in 350 oven for 45 minutes. Serve with chopped onions on top.

Wash the broccoli and cut into florets or small pieces. In a fry pan with oil, fry the garlic until light brown then add red pepper and fry well. Add the vegetable stock and let it simmer for 3-5 minutes then add the broccoli and cover with lid and let it simmer until tender. Season with soy sauce and a pinch of sea salt.

Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Melt the butter in the skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and saute until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in the soup and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Remove from the heat. Stir in the sour cream and garlic salt. Arrange the chicken on the bottom of a greased shallow baking dish. Cover with the mushroom mixture. Sprinkle the tops with the cheese. Bake, uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

1. Prepare the base: In a large bowl, beat together the double cream and lemon zest, then gradually beat in the sugar. Place in the fridge to chill while you make the filling.2. Prepare the filling: In a medium bowl, beat together the low-fat cream cheese and lemon juice until smooth. Gradually beat in the cold cream to the cheese mixture to make a spreadable consistency.3. Assemble the mousse: In small dessert dishes or glasses, spread half the base over the bottom of each dish. Spoon over the filling. Smooth the top with a spoon or spatula to create a level layer of filling. Spoon the rest of the base on top to create the second layer. Chill for at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Stir in garliccook for 2 minutes. Add scallionscook until softened. Stir in winesimmer until almost evaporated. Add parsley and scallops. Cook until scallops are firm and just opaque in center. Stir in creamcook until heated through. Garnish with scallions.

Mix all dry ingredients together in large bowl. Add cheese. Work together til just moistened. Add egg, beat til blended. Add vanilla extract. Gather dough together in ball. Wrap in plastic wrap or place in large ziplock freezer bag. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to an hour or until dough is easy to roll into balls. Roll into balls about 1 inch. Place on parchment paper lined baking sheets. Chill for another 30 minutes or until firm. Bake at 350 degrees for 7-10 minutes or until bottoms are lightly browned. Let cool on rack completely. Store in air tight container up to three days or freeze for up to three months.

Pierce each tomato with 2 or 3 toothpicks and set aside. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine all ingredients. Simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat and cool 5 minutes. Dip each tomato in coating and place on paper toweling. Chill until ready to serve. Remove toothpicks.

Mix all ingredients together except the lettuce leaf and the cherries. Refrigerate for a good couple of hours. Just before serving, slice peeled bananas and add to the salad. Serve in a shallow bowl. Garnish with a single lettuce leaf and a maraschino cherry.

Heat oil in a saucepan. Saute the pork until cooked through. Add soy sauce and pepper. Add ginger and stir. Add broth. Add vegetables and bring to a boil. Add noodles and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

Heat oil in a large frying pan over low heat. Add onion and saut for 2-3 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add the spinach and cook for a further 2-3 minutes until spinach has reduced to a half-size portion. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Place spinach in a medium bowl along with feta and stir in crème fraiche. Season with pepper and set aside for 1 hour to chill and flavours to blend. Serve with crackers.

Cut up whole chickens into serving portions. Heat oven to 375. Melt butter in saucepan until bubbling. Add breadcrumbs & stir until coated. Add parsley and cheese. Put chicken in baking pan & cover with sauce mixture. Bake for about one hour or until done.
Cook and drain pasta. In a large bowl add all the other ingredients and toss with the cooked and drained pasta. Chill and serve.

Combine 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of margarine in a large skillet over low heat until melted. Dip each slice of bread in butter mixture then roll in corn flakes until coated on both sides. Saute over medium heat until brown and crispy. Remove from pan and place on a baking sheet. In a small bowl mix together the remaining butter and margarine with garlic and onion salt. Pour over each slice of toast. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve hot.

Heat the milk in a pot until it is just about boiling and then turn off the heat and add the nutmeg and the maple syrup. Stir and let cool until just warm. Whisk together the egg yolks and the egg in a bowl, then stir in the warm milk. Pour the mixture back into the pot and stir over medium heat until the mixture begins to thicken and coat the back of a spoon. Pour the mixture through a strainer into a bowl and let cool completely before serving. You can refrigerate the custard for a few days before serving. Serve cold or warm.

Mix all ingredients together. Divide meat mixture into 12 portions and form into patties. Cook in skillet or on barbecue grill for 4 minutes a side for well done or 2 minutes a side for rare. Serve with hot dog bun and fixin's of your choice.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil and swirl to coat pan. Place 1 teaspoon of pork mixture in center of wrapper. Fold wrapper to make a triangle with point toward you. Press edges together and twist to seal. Repeat with remaining pork mixture and wrappers. Add more oil to skillet as needed to prevent sticking. Cook 30 seconds on each side or until browned. Drain on paper towels. Combine remaining 1/2 tablespoon of vegetable oil with remaining 2 tablespoons of hoisin sauce and 2 tablespoons of soy sauce. Serve with dumplings. Serve with remaining sauce. Serve with soy sauce, hoisin sauce and hot mustard.

Mix soy sauce, cider vinegar, and sugar in a shallow bowl. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heatcook chicken in hot oil until no longer pink inside, about 5 minutes per side. Cut each roll in halfspread the bottom halves with mayonnaise. Arrange a few chilies on each half of the sandwichsprinkle with cheese. Add cooked chicken to each sandwich halfspoon sauce over top of sandwiches. Serve immediately on plates. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Melt butter and add garlic in a medium sauce pan. Cook over medium for 1 minute. Add flour and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in broth and milk and cook, stirring frequently, until sauce boils and thickens. Add parsley, salt, pepper and cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Toss hot pasta with sauce and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook onion and garlic in butter until onion is softened. Stir in flour and cayenne. Cook until slightly browned and mixture is smooth. Stir in milk, cream and broth. Bring to a boil. Add salt and pepper. Add bacon. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Arrange half the bread crumbs on bottom of shallow baking dish. Add the oysters and pour remaining sauce over them. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs. Dot with butter. Bake uncovered at 325 for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and heated through.

Melt butter in a 4-quart saucepan over medium-low heatadd onions and cook, covered, 20 minutes or until the onions are very soft and brown, stirring occasionally. Stir in the flour and cook 2 minutes. Stir in the milk and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in mace and egg yolks and cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Serve hot. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with french bread.

In small bowl, stir together butter, orange liqueur, rind, salt. Toss with nuts until coated well. Spread in single layer on greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or just until nuts are toasted. Cool completely on wire rack. Store in an airtight container.

In a small bowl combine cider vinegar and red pepper. Rub chops with oil. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar, salt, cayenne, and cumin. Rub both sides of each chop with the mixture. Place the chops on the grill and brush with the vinegar mixture. Grill for 6 minutes per side or until done. Remove the chops and brush with the vinegar mixture and sprinkle with the parsley. Serves 4.

Melt margarine in a skillet on medium heat until it is hot enough to fry an egg. Place a slice of swiss cheese on half of each piece of whole wheat bread. Place a slice of tomato on half of each piece of swiss cheese. Sprinkle yellow bell pepper over each piece of swiss cheese. Top each piece of swiss cheese with a few olives. Place a slice of swiss cheese on top of each piece of sandwich. Put sandwiches on skillet until each piece is golden brown on both sides. Serve warm.

Cook the carrots in water to cover until just tender. Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the onions and saute for a few minutes or until the onions are tender and translucent. Stir in the flour and cook for about 1 minute. Slowly add the low-fat milk stirring constantly. Bring the mixture to a boil and cook for 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the Swiss cheese and the cooked carrots. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish and sprinkle the top with the breadcrumbs. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Sprinkle roasting chickens with a mixture of the salt, garlic powder and pepperplace in a baking dish and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least two hours and up to one day. Heat grill to medium-high. Remove plastic wrap and place the chickens on the grill. Brush with the apricot preserves and grill, covered, until golden and cooked through, about 25 minutes. Serve with a spoonful of the sweet chili sauce and a sprinkling of the scallion and ginger. Makes six servings.

In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients except for the beef. Add the beef to the mixture and mix with your hands until well combined. Form into golf ball size meatballs. Spray the bottom of a 9x13 pan with cooking spray and place the meatballs on the pan. Bake at 350 for 20 to 30 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with pasta and sauce for an easy meal or freeze for later use.

Rub the birds inside and out with a little salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Place the birds in a plastic bag along with all of the remaining ingredients except for the tarragon and close the bag securely. Turn the bag over several times so that all the birds are coated with the marinade. Refrigerate overnight. Bake the birds at 375 degrees F for 40 minutes, basting frequently with the marinade and adding a little water or stock if the pan seems dry. Check the temperature of the meat with a meat thermometer. When done the meat should register 160 degrees F in the thickest part of the breast. To serve: carve each bird into two portions and place one portion on each of four plates. Add a few spoonfuls of sauce over each portion. Garnish with a few sprigs of tarragon and a drizzle of lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Melt butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add red onion. Saut until translucent. Add corn. Cook 2 minutes. Add edamame. Season with sherry wine. Cook until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in fresh basil. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, bring 3 cups of water, the sugar and the ginger to a boil over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Add the plums and return the mixture to a full boilcook for 1 minute, then skim off any scum that has risen to the surface of the jam. Cook the jam for 20 minutes more, skimming from time to time. Add the lemon juice and cook for 2 minutes more. Transfer the jam to a bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate the jam for at least 24 hours before serving.
Melt butter and chips on low. Remove from heat. Add milk and marshmallows. Stir well. Pour over nuts. Chill and cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 275 degrees. In large mixing bowl whisk together the egg white and water until foamy. Stir in the nuts and brown sugar. Add seasoning salt, curry powder, ginger, cinnamon, and cumin. Toss until well coated. Spread on a cookie sheet and bake until dry and lightly golden brown. About 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove from oven and cool completely. Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Cut the onions and carrots into thin strips. Fry them and the chicken legs with a little oil until the meat is cooked through (about 20 minutes). Put the cooking water into a small saucepan and add the carrots and onions. Simmer for about 2 minutes. Then add the sour cream and milk and cook for another minute. Season with black pepper and serve with the fried meat and vegetables.

Place crackers in a food processor and pulse to crumbs. Put in a large bowl with the brown sugar and melted butter. Stir in the egg and the milk until blended. Add baking powder and flour and mix well. Press the mixture evenly into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Cool. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the marshmallows and chocolate chips together. Remove from heat and stir in the almond extract. Spread evenly over the top of the crust. Chill. Cut into bars. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chorizo and onion until onion is tender. Remove from heat. Stuff peppers with sausage mixture. Place on foil-lined baking sheet. Top with enchilada sauce. Bake 25-30 minutes or until heated through.

Bring 2 cups of water to a simmer in a small heavy-bottomed pot. Add 2 Tbs. butter and mushroomsseason to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cover and cook over medium heat until mushrooms are tender and liquid has evaporated, 10 to 12 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the wine and remaining 1/4 cup butter in a small bowlset aside. Lay the salmon on top of the mushrooms and pour wine mixture over. Cover and cook until fish is just cooked through and opaque in the center, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer the fish to a plate and tent with foil. Meanwhile, heat the heavy cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until just barely boiling. Remove from heat and stir in the tarragon. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve the fish with the mushrooms and the sauce.

Grease 6-qt. slow cookerlayer half the potatoes, half the soup mixture and half the cheese. Repeat layers. Cover and cook on low 4-1/2 to 5 hours. Check when potatoes are done as cooking temperatures differ. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Just before serving, sprinkle with pimiento and pepper.

Cream together butter, sugar, vanilla and eggs. Add almonds. Sift together flour and baking powder. Combine with the almond mixture. Pour into a tube pan. Bake at 177 degrees for about one hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool. Spread strawberry jam on top of the cooled cake. Put heavy cream in a pan over low heat. When it just starts to boil, remove from heat and add vanilla. Pour over jam. Garnish with sliced strawberries.

Boil potato slices for about 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. In large pan over medium heat, melt margarine. Add green pepper and onion. Cook and stir until soft. Add onion soup mix and water. Heat through. Pour over potato slices. Serve.
Combine all in a large bowl. Chill several hours. May add shrimp, crabmeat or ham.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in the onion, and cook until softened. Add the soups and milk. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the half-and-half. Add the crabmeat and sherry. Cook over low heat until the mixture comes to a simmer. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Serve with freshly made crusty bread.

Soak 4 pomegranates in water overnight. Drain water and rinse the seeds. Mix the orange and lemon juices together with the pomegranate seeds in a bowl. Add sugar and stir well. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight before serving. Cut 2 oranges into wedges. Lay on a plate. Add strawberries and mint leaves. Drizzle with the pomegranate juice just before serving.
Fill tall glass with crushed ice. Pour whiskey and lime juice over ice. Add squeezed lime. Stir. Enjoy.

In a food processor combine all ingredients. Pulse a few times to combine. If you want a thicker consistency add more sugar and process for a few seconds longer. Store in an airtight container for up to one week.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place the hamburgers in an 8 inch square baking dish. Top with the cheese and the chilies. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and milk until blended. Pour evenly over the hamburgers mixture. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Grease and flour a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, beat together the butter, 2 cups of the granulated sugar, the orange juice concentrate and the eggs until smooth. Add the flour, orange extract and zeststir just until combined. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden. Cool for 10 minutes on the wire rack. Beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add the powdered sugar, orange juice and the remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugarbeat until smooth. Spread the glaze over the cooled bars. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a large bowl combine all ingredients well and form into balls about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. In a large frying pan heat oil over medium heat and fry for about 3-4 minutes until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot.

In a medium saute pan over medium-high heat, saute the shrimp in 1 tablespoon of olive oil for 2 to 3 minutes or until they just turn pink. Stir together 1 tablespoon of each of the dried herbs, 1/8 teaspoon of pepper, 1/8 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, 1/8 teaspoon of salt and the lime zest. Serve immediately with a squeeze of lime.

Bring water, sugar, and salt to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Stir in baby carrotscover and cook for about 15 minutes or until tender. Uncoveradd butter and bourbon. Cook until heated through, about 1 minute more. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Cut mozzarella into strips. Wrap each strip with a slice of prosciutto. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Pan-fry mozzarella until golden brown, turning once. Remove from skillet and place on a serving plate. Sprinkle with black pepper. Arrange salad greens over and around mozzarella. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and cranberry sauce. Insert a toothpick in each strip of prosciutto. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Steam cauliflower for 3 minutes. Drain well. Melt margarine in small skillet. Add in garlic powder, oregano, dried basil, italian seasoned breadcrumbs. Mix well. Place in a baking pan. Pour margarine mixture over cauliflower. Bake in 375 oven for 10 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except peppers, dill and dressingtoss well. Sprinkle with peppers and dilltoss well. Serve with dressing on the side.

In a Dutch oven or stockpot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the sausage and cook, breaking it into small pieces, until no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Add the carrot, seasonings, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the kale and cook until wilted, about 10 minutes more. Ladle the soup into bowls and sprinkle each serving with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Bring stock to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in couscous and pine nuts and simmer for 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Meanwhile cook chicken in a non-stick frypan until browned. Add onion and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add to couscous and mix. Add dried apricots, sultanas and mint. Drizzle with dressing and toss.

Place salmon fillets in shallow baking pan. Combine dressing and water in saucepan and bring to boil. Pour dressing mixture over salmon and sprinkle mushrooms on top. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork.

Add honeydews, lime juice and 1/4 cup honey to a blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Add yogurt and process until blended. Chill until cold. Divide among 4 glasses. Top each with a few honeydew balls and sprinkle with cinnamon.

Heat the oil in a wok. Add the onion and stir-fry over medium heat for 1 minute. Add the capsicum and broccoli and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the fish and stir fry for 1 minute. Add the prawns and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the noodles and marinade and mix well. Stir fry for 1 minute until the noodles are heated through. Serve immediately.

Heat margarine in a saucepan over low heat. Stir in shallots and cook until translucent. Stir in green beans and chicken broth. Cover and simmer until tender. Stir in salt and serve over rice or noodles with sprinkled with cheese.

Combine buttermilk and beaten egg in a large bowl and set aside. In a second bowl combine cornmeal and flour and set aside. Salt and pepper the catfish fillets and dunk them first into the egg and buttermilk mixture and then into the flour mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat and cook the fillets for about 4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the fillets from the skillet and drain them on paper towels. Sprinkle with sea salt and black pepper before serving.

Puree strawberries and sugar in a blender or food processor until smooth. Beat together sour cream and reduced-fat whipped topping until well blended. Fold in strawberry mixture. Spoon into 6 individual dessert dishes or 1 large bowl. Cover and chill at least 3 hours before serving.

In saucepan bring water to a boil, add salt and rice. Cook until liquid is absorbed, about 18 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in eggs and milk. Stir in mushrooms. In a skillet over medium heat, cook onion in butter until tender. Stir in rice mixture and heat through. Add cream cheese and toss lightly until blended. Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until heated through.

Heat milk and water in medium saucepan over medium-high heat to just boiling. Remove from heatadd Splenda Brown Sugar Blend, dark cocoa, cinnamon sticks, and chili powder. Stir until blended. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Serve in mugs with whipped topping and a cinnamon stick.

Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Cook the spaghetti according to the packet instructions. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon and set aside. Add the zucchini and cherry tomatoes to the pan and fry for 5 mins. Add the pesto and bacon and toss together. Drain the spaghetti and stir into the pan. Top with grated parmesan.

Cook and drain bacon. Cook and drain vegetables. Whisk eggs and add seasonings. Add vegetables and bacon to egg mixture and stir well. Spread evenly in greased 9x13 inch pan. Sprinkle with cheeses and bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with favorite beverage and toast of choice.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender. Pulse until smooth. Serve with pita chips.

Combine ground coffee and crushed red pepper flakes in a small bowl or plastic bag. Store for up to 3 months in an airtight container or in the freezer for longer storage. Use as directed in your drip or percolator coffee maker. Or, for French press, grind coffee beans for French press brew method. Add ground coffee to French press pot as instructed in recipe. Pour boiling water over coffee grounds and let brew for desired amount of time. Once brewed, add honey, coconut milk, whole cloves, and cinnamon sticks. Stir until well mixed. Serve hot in cups over ice or as is. Serve hot or cold.

Cook potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain well. Chop the potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. In a large skillet cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Drain the fat from the skillet. Add the onion and cook until softened but not brown, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Whisk together the broth, mustard, vinegar, and 1 tablespoon of the oil in a small bowl. Add the potatoes to the skillet. Add the broth mixture and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Season the mixture to taste with the salt, pepper, and green onion. Toss with the bacon. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a 9x13-inch baking pan with foil extending up sides. In a bowl beat together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl beat butter and sugars until creamy. Add vanilla and beat well. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Beat in flour mixture just until combined. Spread batter in prepared pan and sprinkle with nuts and/or chips. Bake for 19 minutes or until top is dry and a skewer inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Remove from pan and cut into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Sprinkle both sides of chicken breasts with cumin and pepper. Cook chicken breasts in non-stick skillet coated with cooking spray until done. Remove cooked chicken breasts, cover, and keep warm. In the same skillet, combine chicken broth and curry powder and mix well. Bring to a boil. Stir in couscous, peas, and raisins. Place chicken on top of couscous mixture, cover skillet, remove from heat, and let stand for 5 minutes.

Place a small amount of olive salad on one half of each of 2 slices of bread. Top with ham and mortadella. Sprinkle with a pinch of black pepper. Top with a slice of cheese. Top with the other slices of bread. Spread a little butter on each side. Place the sandwiches on a heated skillet over medium heat and cook for 4-6 minutes. Flip the sandwiches and cook for an additional 4-6 minutes. Serve.

Mix sugar and water in medium sauce pan over medium heat to dissolve sugar. Bring to boiling point, stirring occasionally. Dip a small amount of almonds into the syrup and put onto wax paper. Bake in preheated oven for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally to coat evenly. Pour the remaining almonds into the pan and cook another 5-10 minutes. Dip out of the oven when the almonds are lightly toasted. Remove from pan with slotted spoon, cool on wax paper. Put almonds in an airtight container and sprinkle with almond oil if desired.

1.Preheat oven to 300C/Fan 280C/Gas 4.2.Break up amaretti biscuits. Put the biscuits into a bowl with the rice and add the caster sugar.3.Pour in the whole milk and the white chocolate and mix well until evenly distributed. Spoon into individual ramekins or custard cups and bake for 20-25 minutes until set.4.Remove from oven and serve warm with a sprinkle of icing sugar if liked.
Brown meat and drain. Add pasta and water. Stir in tomato paste and pasta sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degree. Brown steak in a large skillet. Add onions, carrots and green peppers. Combine water and gravy mix. Add to steak. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and pour into a 2-quart casserole dish. Bake covered for 1 hour. Uncover and bake 30 minutes longer.

Preheat oven to 350F. Melt bacon fat in 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add baconcook 2 minutes or until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with slotted spoondrain bacon fat from skillet. Stir rice and next 4 ingredients into bacon fatcook 1 minute. Add 1 cup chicken brothstir well. Bring mixture to boilreduce heat to low. Coversimmer 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heatstir in corn and next 2 ingredients. Pour mixture into greased 8-inch square baking dishsprinkle evenly with bacon bits and cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Makes 4 servings (serving size: 3/4 cup).

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Spray 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pan with cooking sprayset aside. Whisk together egg white and vanilla in small bowl until frothyset aside. In large bowl, combine sugar, cinnamon and saltstir until well blended. Add egg white mixture, stirring constantly with a spoon until mixture is thick and clings to sides of bowl. Add almondstoss until well coated. Transfer to baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until almonds are lightly browned and mixture is crispstir gently after 10 minutes. Remove from ovenimmediately pour almonds onto wax paper to cool and separate. Sprinkle with additional cinnamon if desired. Store in an airtight container.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat. Add the pepperscook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until crisp tender. Transfer to a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil to the pan. Add the spinachcook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until crisp tender. Add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of pepper flakescook for 1 minute. Transfer to the bowltoss with the red peppers. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Cook pasta per instructions on package. In a separate pot add cream cheese, butter and garlic powder on medium to high heat. Melt and mix together until well blended. Once melted add the milk a little at a time and continue to stir until smooth. Add the parmesan cheese and continue to stir until blended. Once pasta is cooked add to the pot with the sauce and parsley flakes and mix together until well blended and noodles are coated with the sauce. Remove from heat and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Pull husks off of 3 ears of corn. In a small bowl combine water and 1 tablespoon of the adobo saucepour mixture into a foil square large enough to wrap a single ear of corn. Place a corn ear in the center of the foil and close the foil around the ear to completely wrap it. Repeat with the remaining ears of corn. Bake in the oven until the corn is tender and the foil is darkened, about 45 minutes. Remove foil from the ears of corn and allow to cool. Peel back husks and silks. Cut corn from the cobs. In a blender add corn and remaining 2 tablespoons of adobo sauceblend until smooth. In a saucepan over high heat add 1/4 cup of water. Stir in the corn mixture. Add chipotle chiles and lime juice. Stir until combined. Season with salt to taste. Garnish each bowl with 1/2 tablespoon of feta. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine beans and 1 cup of the shredded cheese. Spread 1 cup of the bean mixture over chips in 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Top evenly with remaining beans and remaining 1 cup shredded cheese. Bake for 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining 2 cups shredded cheese. Bake for 2 more minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with remaining toppings and serve immediately.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the meat and brown on both sides. Remove the meat and set aside. Add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the meat back to the pan and add the red wine and enough water to cover the meat. Add the cracked black pepper and the salt. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer for 1-1/2 hours. Serve with parsley.

Boil water in a large saucepan. Peel okra, and trim the ends. Roughly chop the okra and the onions. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 2 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger and chilies. Cook for 2 minutes more. Add the spices, water and the lemon juice. Boil for 3 minutes. Add the chopped onions. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the water evaporates. Serve hot.

Beat together egg yolks and sweetened condensed milk. Add key lime juice and blend well. Pour into prebaked pie shell. Bake at 325 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool completely and refrigerate. To prepare whipped cream, beat cream until soft peaks form. Fold in powdered sugar until well blended. Spoon over the pie and garnish with lime slices.

Mix all dry ingredients together. Add eggs. Add vegetable oil. Add white and brown sugars and mix. Add rhubarb and mix well. Add quick-cooking oats and mix well. Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Beat the first 5 ingredients until light and creamy. Add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the flour mixture in 3rds, beating until just blended. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Preheat oven to 350. Drop batter by rounded teaspoons 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool on wire racks. Sprinkle with cinnamon before serving.

Cook the pasta according to package instructions. In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter until bubbling. Pour the evaporated milk into the melted butter and stir with a whisk until well combined. Pour the evaporated milk/butter mixture into a mixing bowl and stir in the milk. Next stir the cheddar cheese into the mixture and then the monterey jack cheese. Stir the cheeses until they are completely melted. Stir the pasta into the cheeses and stir until well coated. Pour into a casserole dish and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until the top is browned.
Combine ingredients and marinate for at least 2 hours. Drain off excess marinade before cooking. Broil or grill. Makes 4 servings. Serve with rice or noodles.

Cook beef and sausage until no longer pink. Drain fat. Add cayenne and seasonings. Cook for 5 minutes. Add vegetables and cook 5 minutes. Add rice and cook until liquid is absorbed. Cook covered 20 minutes. Add cheese and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Combine flour, sugar and cardamom and cut in the butter with pastry blender. Add the egg and mix well. Fold in the lingonberry preserves. Spread into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Combine the streusel ingredients and spread over batter. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool. Lift out a quarter or half of the cake and cut into slices. Continue with portions in this way.
Pour the sauce over the pickles in an attractive glass or ceramic container. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Boil whole, unpeeled potatoes in unsalted water until fork-tender. Drain and allow to sit until cool enough to touch. Peel potatoes, then chop into 1 dice. In a saucepan over medium-high heat, stir together butter and flour to make a light roux, but do not allow to darken. Add heavy cream and whisk steadily until incorporated and thickened into a creamy sauce. Stir in chopped potatoes and turn heat to medium-low, allowing potatoes to stew just until warmed through. Remove from heat and stir in freshly grated nutmeg. Serve with roasted chicken, pork chops or roast beef.

Place pumpkin, skim milk, brown sugar and spices in 2-cup microwave safe bowl. Stir well. Microwave at 100% for 5 minutes or until hot and steaming. Stir again. Microwave at 100% for 2 minutes more or until hot and steaming. Beat in eggs until well blended. Microwave at 100% for 1 minute more or until hot and steaming. Remove from microwave to a greased 1-cup microwave safe cup or bowl. Microwave at 100% for 3 to 4 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean when tested in center of custard. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine soup and water. Dip chicken in the flour and place in a greased 13x9 pan. Combine wine and sour cream. Pour over the chicken. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until the juices run clear. To prepare sauce, mix browner with the flour left from dipping the chicken. Stir in wine and cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in the green onions and pour over the chicken. Sprinkle with paprika.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add zucchini and onioncook 5 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes, roasted red pepper and next 3 ingredientscook 3 minutes or until heated through. Place fillets in a single layer in skilletcook 3 minutes or until no longer pink in the center. Sprinkle with parsleyserve immediately.

Place all ingredients in blender and blend till smooth. Pour into ice cream maker according to manufacturers directions. About 4-6 hours before serving, crush graham crackers and sprinkle over top of ice cream in storage container. Freeze until solid. About an hour before serving, cut the hershey bar into small pieces and sprinkle over top of ice cream. Serve with miniature marshmallows in a bowl on the side for individual servings.

In large saucepan, bring water to boil. Add butterreduce heat and simmer. Add all remaining ingredients. Stirring frequently and simmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Do not boil. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet. Add the squash and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until just tender, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for a minute or so longer. Add the water and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for a minute or so longer. Stir in the basil and serve immediately.

Drain string beans and rinse. In a sauce pan add sugar and water. Cook until sugar dissolves. Add string beans and cook until crisp tender. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add seasoning and cook until heated through. Add whipping cream and heat through. Serve hot.

Place family size tea bag into large pot or pitcher. Pour in 3 quarts of boiling water and stir. Allow the tea to steep for 5 minutes. Discard tea bag(s). Add 1/2 tsp of baking soda. Add the sugar while the mixture is hot to dissolve it. Add 3 quarts of cold water and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Store the mixture overnight. Serve cold over ice cubes.

Combine cabbage, butter and apples in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Combine breadcrumbs and seasoning in a small bowl. Spray 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Lay cabbage mixture in pan. Sprinkle with breadcrumb mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.
Combine in a bowl eggs, light cream, salt and pepper (to taste). Heat in nonstick pan on low heat until set. Sprinkle with Worcestershire sauce. Serve hot.

Combine wine with 1/2 cup water and salt in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add fish and cook for 3 minutes or until firm to the touch. Remove the fish from the pan and drain, reserving the liquid. Combine the breadcrumbs with the remaining liquid and spread over the fish. Broil for 8 minutes or until the fish flakes easily. In a small bowl stir the mayonnaise with the sour cream and season with the paprika and salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the sauce over the fish and sprinkle with the onions.

Soak parmesan in warm water for 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to food processor. Pulse in garlic and green chilies until finely chopped. Add pine nuts, parsley and cilantro and process until smooth. With motor running, slowly add the olive oil in a thin stream and process until thick and spreadable. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in large skillet set over medium high heat. When foam subsides, add the remaining tablespoon butter and the green chili pesto and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add the shrimp and cook for about 1 minute per side or until pink throughout. Serve immediately on top of the green chili pesto sauce.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking. Add the garlic and ginger, stirring constantly until fragrant, about 15 seconds. Add the snow peas and radishesstir-fry until the vegetables are crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Reduce the heat to mediumadd the soy sauce, vinegar, and chili sauce, stirring until the soy sauce is dissolved. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil, the scallions, and the cashews. Heat until hot. Serve at once.

In a bowl combine first 6 ingredients. Mix well. Add 4 tbsp butter and toss lightly to coat. Set aside. Pat fish dry. Place skin side down in an ungreased baking pan. Brush with remaining butter and sprinkle with thyme. Cover with bread crumb mixture. Bake at 425f for about 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with green onion.

Cut apples into 1/2-inch slices. Place in a large bowl with cranberries, cashews and 1/4 cup mayonnaise. Stir gently to coat with dressing. Chill for 1 hour or more. Place celery in a serving bowl, top with apple mixture and remaining 2 tablespoons mayonnaise. Stir gently. Garnish with radish slices, onion slices and cranberries if desired.

Mix all the dry ingredients together. Work the butter in with the marzipan until it is smooth. Then add the currant jam, the egg and the salt, then the poppy seeds. Wrap the marzipan tightly in cling film and leave it to rest for 30 minutes. Then roll the marzipan out to about 1 cm thick and cut into 2.5 cm rounds with a small cutter. Place each round on the baking tray lined with baking parchment and bake for 10-15 minutes at 200 degrees C. Leave to cool completely before serving with tea or coffee.

Preheat oven to 200c/gas mark 6. Place the creamed corn in a medium sized bowl with the ginger and thyme leaves, then stir through the flour, milk, egg and sweet potato until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Heat a couple of tablespoons of oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat until hot. Drop heaped tablespoons of the batter into the oil and fry until golden on both sides, then place on a baking tray lined with kitchen paper to drain. Repeat with the remaining batter until the fritters are cooked. Transfer to the oven to keep warm. Makes 6-8 fritters.

Preheat the oven to 180 C. Trim the tops of the fennel bulbs off. Cut the bulbs in half lengthwise. Place the pieces on a baking tray lined with baking paper. Drizzle with a little of the olive oil and sprinkle with a pinch of salt. Roast for about 25 minutes until the fennel is tender. Remove from the oven and set aside. Heat a large pot of salted water over high heat. Bring the water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook for 10 minutes. Meanwhile in a large skillet add the remaining olive oil and saute the garlic over medium heat until softened but not brown. Add the wild fennel and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the anchovies and red pepper flakes. Stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute. Drain the pasta. Toss with the fennel mixture and roasted fennel. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley.

Process the cheeses together with the garlic and onion powder till smooth. Stir in the remaining ingredients except the olive and the cracker. Stir the olive into the mixture and then spread over the cracker.

In a small bowl combine all the mayo ingredients. Set aside. Cook bacon in a skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from pancrumble. Preheat grill to medium high heat. Lay each tortilla flat on grill for about 1 minute or until grill marks form. Remove from grill and top with bacon, turkey and romaine lettuce leaves. Roll up tightly. Serve with chipotle mayo.

Bring 6 quarts of salted water to a boil in a large pot. Add the farfalle and cook until al dente. Drain the farfalle and rinse with cold water. In a large bowl, combine the farfalle and all other ingredients. Toss to combine. Add the mayonnaise and toss again. Add the vinegar and toss once more. Season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Heat canola oil in large non-stick skillet over med-high heat. Cook green beans in hot oil, stirring frequently, until crisp tender, about 6 minutes. Stir in onioncook until crisp tender. Drain liquid from pan. Add green beans and onions to pancook over med-low heat until onions are lightly browned and beans are heated through. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 3 cups.

Cook chicken in boiling water until done (about 15 min). Chill in the refrigerator until ready to use. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, fat-free mayonnaise, paprika, dried cranberries, celery, green onion, green bell pepper, pecans, seasoning salt and black pepper. Stir until well mixed. Serve in a bread or lettuce leaf with a slice of cheese.

Wash and cook the lentils with the celery ribs and onion in the stockpot until soft. Meanwhile, slice the pork hock into 1 inch thick strips and brown them in the oil. Then add the garlic and stir until fragrant. Pour the stock over the lentils and meat and bring it back to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour covered. Remove the hock from the stock and take the meat from the bone. Bring the stock back to a boil and add the brown sugar and cook until the sugar dissolves. Turn off heat and stir in the meat and parsley.

Preheat oven to 180c. Wash and thinly slice the potato and onions. Place in a large bowl with the tomatoes, herbs and margarine. Season well with the salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the milk and plain flour. Mix well and transfer to a 1.5 litre ovenproof dish. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake for 45 minutes until the top is golden brown and bubbling.

Bring to boil sugar, hot water, light corn syrup and egg whites in large bowl. Stir constantly until thick. Add vanillabeat until cool. Fold in mayonnaise, orange rind and salt. Chill for 1 hour before serving.

Spread softened cream cheese on bottom of glass baking dish. Stir together lemon juice, garlic salt, milk, black olives, and garlic. Spread over cream cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Serve with crackers.

Mix all ingredients together until the consistency is like a soft bread dough. Shape into patties and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 450f for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool before serving.

Mix flour, sugar, soda and salt together. Add shortening and cut in with pastry blender until crumbly. Mix in rolled oats. Store in air tight container. Use as a topping for oatmeal, pancakes or cookies.
Place all ingredients in the crock pot. Cook for 5-6 hours or until the chicken is tender. Serve over rice with sprigs of mint.

Preheat oven to 350. Butter a 2. 5-quart casserole. Peel the apples. Cut them in half. Remove the cores. Scoop out the seeds. Cut the apples into 1/2-inch pieces. In a small saucepan. Combine the apples. Sugar. White wine. And orange zest. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand for 15 minutes. Remove any excess liquid. Transfer the apples to the prepared casserole. In a medium saucepan. Heat the butter. Add the bread cubes. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Add the wine. And the orange juice. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add the apples. The milk. Eggs. And zest. Spoon the mixture over the apples. Sprinkle with the walnuts. Bake for 45 minutes. Or until the custard is set. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Cook meat and onions in a skillet until no longer pink. Drain grease. Blend in biscuit mix and milk. Cook over low heat 5 minutes or until bubbly. Blend in brown gravy and water. Pour into greased 2 quart casserole. Bake 15 minutes at 350. Invert onto plate. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium-sized pan combine all the ingredients except the cornstarch. Heat until boiling. Add the cornstarch dissolved in the cold water. Stir constantly. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and cool. Serve at room temperature. Makes about 1 cup.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a large bowl, sift together the first 5 ingredients. In another large bowl combine the next 4 ingredients and stir until smooth. Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry and stir just until moistened. Spoon into greased 8x4 inch loaf pan and bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine sugar, flour, and cinnamon. Toss with berries. Spoon into pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes. Meanwhile, mix brown sugar, orange juice, and butter in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until blended. Spread over hot pie. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.
Mix all ingredients well. Pour into 8 inch square pan. Bake at 350 for 30 min or until firm. Makes 8 servings.

In a large bowl combine the first four ingredients. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Divide the dough into 4 equal portionsform into balls and place on a wax paper lined sheet. Refrigerate about 1 hour or until firm. Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Place about 1 inch apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 11 to 13 minutes or until set. Cool on wire rack.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add bell peppers and saute 3 minutes. Add onion and cook until tender. Add spices and saute 1 minute. Add chicken breasts and saute 5 minutes. Add hot peppers and cook 2 minutes. Add lemon juice and toss. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Wash lentils and rice. In a pan, saute onion in oil until it is a golden brown. Add the lentils, rice, salt, cumin, pepper, and water. Bring to a boil and then turn to low heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, making sure to add more water as it absorbs. Lentils will be soft when ready.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Saute onion in skillet over medium heat in oil until softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and chiles, let cook 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and stir in spinach, cheese, cream cheese, half and half, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon mixture into shallow baking dish like a 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate. Bake in the preheated oven until the dip is bubbly and the top is light brown, about 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook sausage until done. Cool sausage, cut into small pieces. In a large bowl combine sausage, eggs, cheese and seasonings. Separate crescent rolls into 8 triangles. Press 1 triangle into the bottom of each cup in a 12-cup muffin pan, making a crust. Fill each cup with sausage mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine cooked white rice, whole milk and unsweetened coconut milk. Increase heat to bring to a simmer. Add sugar and salt. Cook until thickened and creamy, stirring constantly. Stir in coconut extract and flakes. Pour into serving dish. Allow to cool. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Crush graham crackers in a plastic bag using a rolling pin. Melt margarine in a small pot and add graham crackers. Press crumbs into the bottom and sides of a 9 inch spring form pan. Beat soy cream cheese and sugar with a mixer until fluffy. Add pumpkin and beat again until just combined. Beat in rum. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn oven off and leave the cheesecake in the oven with the door closed for 1 hour. Then remove cheesecake from oven and cool to room temperature. Chill for at least 4 hours. When ready to serve, spoon a small amount of whipped cream into the center of each slice.
Combine eggs, water and biscuit mix. Add the cheddar cheese and onions and combine well. Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake at 350 degrees for 55 minutes.

In a saucepan, add the brown sugar, Dijon mustard, vinegar, molasses, and cumin. Whisk until mixture is smooth and blended. Bring mixture to a boil, over medium heat. Stir often. Lower heat, cover pan and simmer 2-3 minutes or until thickened. Place chops in a 13x9 inch baking dish sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Spoon sauce over chops. Turn chops to coat. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 18-22 minutes or until juices run clear. Baste occasionally.

Boil potatoes in water until tender. Peel and mash. Mix with shredded coconut and chopped almonds. Add almond extract and powdered sugar. Press into greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Melt chocolate and pour over the top of the cooled needhams. Let cool. Cut into squares.

Boil the boneless chicken breasts until done. Remove from pot and let cool. Cut into bite sized pieces and place in a large bowl. Add 1 can of cream of chicken soup and 2 cups of shredded cheese. Mix well. Remove the crescent rolls from the cans and separate them into the pre-cut triangles. Roll them out slightly and put 2 heaping tablespoons of the chicken mixture in the middle of the triangle and fold the crescent rolls up. Put the rolls in a baking dish, seam side down. Put any remaining chicken mixture around the rolls. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 25 minutes or until the tops of the crescent rolls are golden brown, remove and cover the rolls with the other cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Return to the oven for an additional 10 minutes.

In a large frying pan, melt butter and fry onion for 2-3 minutes. Add the courgettes and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the pasta to the pan and stir over high heat until the pasta is coated. Stir in the parsley and season. Serve the pasta in individual bowls sprinkled with parmesan and the toasted walnuts.
Combine coffee and sugar in a blender. Add almonds and vanilla bean pods and process until blended. Add bananas and process until smooth. Add ice cubes and process until frothy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a loaf pan with cooking spray and set aside. In a large mixing bowl combine turkey, soup, eggs, and oats. Add garlic and onions. Mix thoroughly. Spoon into loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool slightly before slicing.
