Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion until tender. Stir in rice. Cook and stir until the rice is golden brown, about 3 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce, seasonings, water, and beans. Cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large stockpot put in ham shank cover with water. Make sure there is lots of water as this will be boiling a long time. Heat on high until boiling reduce to medium-high heat for a low boil. Boil 2 hours. Add potatoes onions and carrots add more water if needed bring back to boil and boil 1 hour add cabbage boil 15 minutes scoop out onto platter and serve.

Heat oven to 350. Cook spinach in microwave with 1/4 cup water until tender. Drain and let cool. Mash potatoes and egg yolks in large bowl. Add spinach and 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Season with salt. Add enough flour to make stiff dough. Turn out on floured board. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Cook in boiling water until they rise to the top. Drain. Melt butter in pan. Add gnocchi. Toss until lightly browned. Serve with remaining parmesan cheese.
Mix sugar and corn syrup over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Add rice flour and peanuts. Stir until mixture is soft enough to pick up with your hand and then mold into shape of choice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, butter and sugar in medium bowl. Mix in egg yolks and milkstir to blend well. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar in large bowl until foamybeat in lemon juice. Gradually beat in 3 tablespoons sugarcontinue beating until stiff peaks form. Fold 1/3 egg white mixture into batterfold in remaining egg white mixture gently but thoroughly. Spoon batter into 8 muffin cups coated with cooking spray or buttersmooth tops with wet spoon or knife. Bake at 400 f for 20 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Let cool 5 minutesremove from muffin cupscool completely on wire racks.

Sauté the ground beef in a nonstick skillet, add sweet onions and green bell peppers, and sauté until browned. Add tomatoes and cook over medium heat until thickened. Add cooked kidney beans and heat through. Ladle into bowls and top with shredded monterey jack cheese. Garnish with parsley.
Brown the meat and drain. Add the other ingredients except the refried beans and stir to combine. Heat the refried beans and stir in.

Cook the penne in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but firm. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pine nuts and cook until lightly browned. Add the chard and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Drain the pasta. In a small bowl combine the broth with the sun-dried tomatoes and balsamic vinegar. Stir into the pasta and toss to coat. Add the chard mixture, the garlic and the parmesan cheese. Toss well to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Line a baking sheet with foil. In a large bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar and sesame oil. Add chicken and turn to coat well. Arrange in a single layer on the baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the scallions. Return to the oven and bake until cooked through, about 10 minutes more. Serve over rice.

Place Brussels sprouts in a medium saucepan and cover with water by about 1 inch. Add the salt and cook over moderate heat until the Brussels sprouts are tender-crisp and bright green, about 12 minutes. Drain the Brussels sprouts in a colander set in the sink and let cool slightly. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over moderate heat. Stir in the sugar and lemon juice and bring to a boilcook until thickened and reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Add the Brussels sprouts and toss over moderately high heat until warmed through, about 1 minute. Season the Brussels sprouts with the pepper and serve right away.

In a heavy pot melt butter over medium heat. Stir in onions and cook until translucent. Add buttermilk, dijon mustard and sugar. Cook until heated through. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Season with salt and pepper. Serve in bowls and garnish with green onions and cucumber slices. Serves 4.

1. In large pot, combine dried apple and waterbring to boil, and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and place in bowlstir in orange juice and zest. Cool. 2. In saucepan over low heat, stir together sugar and cinnamon until well blendedstir in butterstir in dried fruit mixturespread into unbaked pie cruststop with pastry lidsseal and cut decorative slits in lids. Bake at 375 for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Store in refrigerator or freezer. Makes 2 (9-inch) pies.

In a large bowl combine sugar, vinegar, soy sauce and mustard. Whisk until sugar is dissolved. Add the spinach and toss until coated. Sprinkle on the sesame seeds and toss again. Serve immediately. Serves 8.

Sprinkle gelatin over 1/4 cup water and allow to swell for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve. Add the juice of 2 limes and the lime rind to the gelatin mixture. Set aside for 30 minutes to allow to set. In a large bowl, combine the lime juice with the gelatin mixture. Stir well. Add the condensed milk and mix until well combined. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for 3 hours until the mixture begins to harden. Beat the cream until stiff peaks form. Fold into the chilled mixture. Pour into the pie crust and freeze for 6 hours until hardened.
Melt margarine in microwave for 45 seconds. Add sugar and cream. Add eggs one at a time. Mix in flour, cocoa and salt. Add nuts. Bake at 325 for one hour. Cool. Cut into squares.

Put the tea bag into the bottom of the cup or mug. Fill the cup with hot (or cold) water. Let it steep for 10 minutes. Remove the tea bag. Add the fresh lemon slices, lemon juice, and sugar to the cup. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Enjoy.

Line a 9 x 13-inch pan with whole graham crackers placed diagonally. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and nuts. Melt margarine and mix with brown sugar. Pour over top of nuts and chips and spread evenly over crackers. Cool and cut into squares or rectangles.

Slice raw carrots diagonally into 1/2-inch thick slices. Heat cooking spray in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add carrot slices and saute 4 minutes or until tender-crisp, stirring constantly. Add onionsaute 1 minute or until tender-crisp, stirring constantly. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

In a bowl combine the egg whites and the cornstarch and beat to combine. In another bowl combine the breadcrumbs, parsley, salt and pepper. Cut each breast in half. Dip each piece into the egg whites then into the breadcrumbs to coat. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot add the chicken. Cook for about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Drizzle with the lemon juice and serve.

Combine lemon gelatin and 1 cup boiling water in a bowl and mix until well blended. Add 1/3 cup boiling water, stirring constantly. Pour into an 8 x 8 inch pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Meanwhile, in a bowl combine cream cheese and 1 cup whipping cream until smooth. Add lemonade concentrate and food coloring. Beat until well blended. Fold in the remaining 1 cup whipping cream. Spoon over the gelatin mixture. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Top with additional whipped cream and serve.

Place potatoes in a large bowl. Drizzle them with the olive oil. Add the garlic and season the potatoes with the kosher salt and black pepper. Toss to coat evenly. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet. Roast the potatoes for 20 minutes. Toss the potatoes once or twice during cooking. When the potatoes are done to your liking, remove them from the oven. Sprinkle the parsley over the top. Serve hot.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until they are well blended. Beat in the molasses. Add the egg and mix well. Sift the dry ingredients together and gradually add them to the wet mixture. Stir in the spices and mix until the dough is smooth and well blended. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets and press down with the back of the spoon or the bottom of a glass dipped in granulated sugar to make a round cookie. Bake for 8 to 12 minutes or until the edges begin to brown and the centers are set. Let stand on the cookie sheets for 1 minute before removing. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to two days.

Boil water in a saucepan. Add orzo. While the orzo is cooking, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion. Add chopped spinach. Add butter. Add parmesan. Season with onion powder, salt, and pepper. Stir in lemon juice. Add cooked orzo. Toss. Serve hot.

Spread sour cream in the bottom of a 12-inch pizza pan. Sprinkle with onion and oregano. Layer 4 slices bacon and 4 tomato slices over the bottom of the pan. Layer 4 bread slices over the top. Spread with half the sour cream mixture. Top with mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with the remaining sour cream mixture. Bake at 375f degrees for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Slice into 4 pieces.

Pour the honey into a pitcher. Stir in the lime and orange juices. Add the ginger ale and rum. Chill. Before serving, add the pineapple chunks and melon balls to the pitcher. Garnish with lime wedges.

Heat oil over medium heat in large nonstick skillet until hot. Add eggs in 1 tablespoon portions and cook until firm, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove eggs. Add bok choy and onioncook until bok choy is tender. Remove from heat. Add soy sauce, powdered garlic and salt. Stir well. Add eggs, bamboo shoots and shrimp. Stir well. Return to heat. Cook until shrimp is pink.

Mix egg whites with sesame seeds until well blended. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Dip each chicken piece in egg white mixture, then roll in sesame seed mixture. Add to skilletcook for 2 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from pankeep warm. Combine remaining ingredients. Serve with chicken tenders.

In a large saucepan, bring the broth to a boil over high heat. Add onion, garlic and lemon juice. Reduce heat to moderate and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend in a blender until smooth and creamy. Return to pan. Stir in avocados. Cook for 10 minutes over moderate heat until very hot but not boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in yogurt and crabmeat. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve cold, garnished with green onion.

Dissolve raspberry jello in boiling water. Add cold water. Stir in raspberries. Refrigerate until thickened but not firm. In a bowl mix the pretzels and 1/2 cup sugar. Spread in an ungreased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Bake at 350f for 5 minutes. Cool. Mix the cream cheese and 1 cup sugar until blended. Add the cooled raspberry jello. Fold in the whipped topping. Spread over the cooled crust. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with more raspberries if desired.

Prepare potatoes according to package directions. In a large skillet, cook the hamburger with the onion, pepper, and salsa. Drain. Stir in the black beans. Transfer the potatoes to a greased 1-1/2-qt. casserole. Top with the hamburger mixture. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Stir the souppour over the hamburger mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes.

Boil the chicken in water seasoned with salt for about one hour or until tender. Let cool and shred into bite size pieces. Cook the celery in the broth till tender and set aside. Combine the breadcrumbs and parsley and sprinkle over the top of the chicken. Add the eggs and stir well. Add the chicken and celery mixture and pour in the broth. Pour into a buttered baking dish and bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

In a large deep skillet over medium-high heat, melt 3 tablespoons butter. Add shallots and cook 1 minute. Add garlic and herbs and cook 1 minute. Add beer and mussels. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered about 5 minutes or until mussels open. Stir mussels and spoon into 4 serving bowls. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a casserole dish. Layer chicken breasts in bottom of the dish. In a bowl, combine dressing mix, wine, soup, cream cheese, butter, and chives. Pour over chicken breasts. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Remove chicken from casserole dish and slice. Add cooked pasta to casserole dish. Top with slices of chicken.

In a large bowl combine sour cream, lemon juice, sugar and salt. Add food coloring. Blend until smooth. Stir in the crushed pineapple and banana. Fold in the pecans and maraschino cherries. Pour into 24 paper baking cups. Cover and freeze 4 hours. Serve in cups or cut into squares 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour an 8 x 4 inch loaf pan. Beat together butter and sugar until light and creamy. Beat in vanilla. Add egg and beat well. Stir in mashed bananas. Stir together flour and baking powder. Add to creamed mixture and beat just until smooth. Stir in nuts. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for about 1 hour or until wooden pick comes out clean. Let cool in pan for about 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on rack. Store in airtight container. Yields 1 loaf.

Cream together sugar and butter, then mix in eggs and vanilla. Sift together the flour and cocoa. Mix in baking powder, salt, and then add flour mixture alternately with the buttermilk and Wesson oil (do not overbeat). Pour into a greased and floured tube pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until a wooden toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely before frosting.

Melt butter in skillet. Add onions. Cook until transparent. Add broccoli. Cook until done. Add rice. Stir in cheese whiz. Add sour cream. Heat thoroughly. Spoon into greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with extra cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Uncover last 5 minutes of baking.

Beat cream cheese, lemon juice and mustard until smoothstir in garlic-pepper seasoning. Spread evenly on bottom halves of bread. Layer turkey and spinachtop with cheese and roasted sweet peppers. Close sandwiches. Cut in half and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oven to 425f. Peel, core and slice the apples and place in a bowl with the sugar, salt and spices. Toss until evenly coated. Place apple mixture in unbaked pie shell. Mix together the streusel ingredients and sprinkle over the top of the pie. Bake for about 45 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the streusel is golden. Serve warm or cool completely and serve cold with whipped cream or vanilla ice-cream.

In 3 quart microwave-safe bowl, combine the frozen mixed vegetables, mushrooms and almonds. Microwave on high until tender but still crisp. Drainreturn to bowl. In small bowl mix remaining ingredients. Add to bowl. Toss until well mixed.

Preheat oven to 350. In a heavy medium sauce pan, over med-high heat, melt butter. Add onions & garlic & saute for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Add barley & stir. Add chicken broth & bring to boil. Cover & simmer for 25 minutes. Uncover & remove from heat. Add pepper & salt & stir. Transfer to a baking dish. Bake for 10-15 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and core apples and cut into 8 pieces. Unroll each can of cresent rolls and separate. Roll one piece of apple around each cresent roll. Place in a greased 9-in. X 13-in. X 2-in. Baking dish. In a bowl, combine the sugar and butter. Drizzle over the top of the apple dumplings. Slowly pour the mountain dew around the dumplings. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Bake uncovered for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a deep dish 9-inch pie plate. Place one pastry crust in the plate. Bake for 10 minutes. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour into the baked crust. Bake for an additional 35 minutes, or until the center of the pie is set. Cool on a wire rack for 2 hours before serving. Store in the refrigerator. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Place fillets on the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with oregano, salt and pepper. Cover the fish with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.

Cook the cauliflower in water with the leek until tender. Drain the water from the vegetables and add the stock. Mash the vegetables with the stock, stir in the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped parsley.
Put the chicken breasts into a slow cooker. Combine the other ingredients together and pour over the chicken. Cook on high for 4 hours. Serve over egg noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut each bagel in half. Place each half on a cookie sheet with sides. Beat the egg yolks in a bowl with a little salt and pepper. Spoon a bit of egg yolk mixture over each half bagel. Sprinkle each with some grated cheddar cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until bagels are golden brown. Serve warm with the remaining egg yolk mixture for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium saucepan combine apples, raisins and water. Cover and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in cinnamon and salt. Place in a 3-quart baking dish. Combine soymilk and real maple syrup. Stir in oats. Spoon mixture over apples. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until apples are tender and mixture is set. Serve warm.

Rinse the chicken inside and out under running water. Pat dry with paper towels. Pour the relish into the bottom of the slow cooker. Place the chicken on top of the relish, skin side down. In a small bowl, combine the salt, ground black pepper, lemon juice and oil. Pour over the relish and chicken. Cover with the lid and cook for 6-8 hours on low heat setting or 4-5 hours on high heat setting or until the meat is tender enough to pull away from the bones with a fork. Remove the cooker lid and shake the relish from the bottom of the crock into the relish mixture with the meat. Serve the meat with the relish on the side or mix it all together with the meat. Serve with rice or buns or bread of your choice.

Heat the olive oil in a stockpot over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the canned tomatoes with their juice. Raise the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the mixture thickens slightly. Season with chili pepper flakes, balsamic vinegar, and sugar. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil. Serve over your favorite pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl toss together all of the vegetables. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Spread vegetables onto baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender and beginning to brown. Remove from oven and stir in brown rice. Add basil and oregano. Mix well. Store any leftovers in an airtight container. Makes about 3 cups.

Cook pasta shells according to directions on package. Brown ground beef and drain well. In a large bowl combine the spaghetti sauce, sour cream, whipping cream and mozzarella cheese. Fill the shells with the meat mixture. Top with sour cream mixture. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350. Prepare macaroni and cheese according to package directions. Spread in ungreased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Mix together tuna fish and potato chips. Spread on top of breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes or until heated through.
Rinse and dry tofu. Cut into 1/2" cubes. In food processor combine tofu with remaining ingredients except lettuce. Process until smooth. Serve over lettuce. Makes two servings.

In a large skillet over high heat, combine olive oil and crushed red pepper flakes. Add shrimp and saute 2-3 minutes or until pink and curled. Add salt and stir. Add sherry and old bay and let cook for 2-3 minutes more. Top with parsley.

Grease an 8 inch (20 cm) square baking pan with butter. Cut the dry white bread into 2 inch (5 cm) cubes. Spread half the cubes with butter, sprinkle with nutmeg. Top with remaining cubes. Melt the sweet butter in a small saucepan over medium heat, then stir in the golden raisins and cook until the raisins plump, about 1 minute. Transfer the raisins with a slotted spoon to a small bowl. In another small bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, milk, superfine sugar, white sugar, and vanilla. Pour the custard over the bread cubes. Arrange the golden raisin over the top of the custard. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake until the custard is set, about 1 hour. Run a sharp knife around the edge of the pan before inverting the pan onto a serving platter or large plate. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Peel and boil the potatoes until soft. Mash well and add the remaining ingredients. Mix until smooth. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bake for about 1 hour or until golden brown on top. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream and garnish with blanched slivered almonds.

Cut the top of the leeks off and discard. Cut leeks crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. Heat oven to 350°F. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add leek slices and stir-fry 3 minutes. Add carrots and garlic and stir-fry 3 minutes longer. Add wine and water and bring to a boil. Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and cook 5 minutes longer. Stir in butter. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Cut broccoli florets in half. In a large bowl, combine the rest of the ingredients with the dressing. Pour the dressing over the broccoli and stir to coat. Refrigerate. Let the flavors blend at least 2 hours before serving.

Line 2 large cookie sheets with waxed paper. In a large bowl, combine wafers with 1/4 cup almonds (reserve remaining 1/4 cup almonds for garnishing). In another bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Place 1/2 teaspoon of coffee mixture onto waxed papertop with wafer mixture. Repeat to form ballsroll balls to coat. Place on sheetspress 1/2 teaspoon of reserved almonds onto each ball to resemble a strawberry. Place 1/4 cup white chocolate chips and remaining 1/2 cup almonds in a bowlmelt chocolate chips in microwave, stirring frequently. Dip balls into chocolateplace on sheetssprinkle with reserved almonds. Refrigerate about 20 minutes or until chocolate is set. Makes 24 balls.

Pull apart dough into small pieces. Melt butter in a small bowl, add sugar and cinnamon. Toss with dough. Place in a greased bundt pan. Bake at 350 for about 25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Remove the tough outside skin of the kohlrabi. Slice in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds. Drain any liquid. In a nonstick skillet melt the butter over medium heat. Add the kohlrabi. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring often, until the vegetable is golden brown and tender. Serve with the sugar and the chopped parsley. Serves 4.

Cream butter and icing sugar on medium speed until smooth. Add cornstarch and continue beating until smooth and creamy. Add flour and beat until combined. Add vanilla and mix until just combined. Spread into a shallow pan and freeze for at least 1 hour or until firm. Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Break into pieces and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until golden. Remove from the oven and place on a cooling rack. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Spray baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Place carrot strips in dish. Drizzle with apple cider. Sprinkle with brown sugar, tarragon, and salt and pepper. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes.

Remove the stems from the broccoli and cut the heads into florets. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and add the broccoli and beans. Stir fry until crisp and tender and then remove from the pan and place on a plate. In the same pan, stir fry the almonds and cashews until golden brown and crisp and sprinkle over the vegetables. Sprinkle with sea salt and serve at once.

Mix egg yolks and condensed milk together. Cook in a double boiler over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture is thick and smooth. Add 1 cup of chocolate sandwich style cookies. Pour mixture into a glass container or freezer safe bowl and freeze until firm. Beat heavy cream in a small mixing bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold the cream into the mixture. Freeze for another hour. Top with remaining chocolate sandwich style cookies.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large mixer bowl beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add cocoa and beat until smooth. Add egg yolks one at a time beating until well blended. Add salt and water. Beat until smooth. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake for 30 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Chill. Beat heavy cream until soft peaks form. Place in pastry bag and pipe onto pie. Sprinkle with nuts and curls. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Combine coconut milk, orange juice and orange zest in a small saucepan over medium heat. In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients (except for fish). Add coconut milk mixture to bowl. Stir well to combine. Place fish fillets in pan coated with cooking spray. Arrange fish fillet side-by-side in pan. Pour coconut milk mixture over fish and cover pan tightly with foil. Braise fish until cooked through (approximately 12-15 minutes). Serve hot over rice with cilantro leaves sprinkled over each serving.

Heat the butter in a medium pan over medium-high heat. Add the light brown sugar and salt. Cook until the mixture is bubbly. Whisk in the maple syrup. Pour the mixture over the ice cream. Garnish with pecan halves or other nuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Crumble cooked sausage into the bottom of the dish. Sprinkle with the cheese. Beat the eggs with the milk and season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour egg mixture evenly over the top of the other ingredients. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the center is set. Cut into squares and serve.

Wash and cut the tops off of your jalapeno peppers. Make a small cut in each jalapeno and remove the seeds and membrane. Mix together cream cheese and cheddar cheese and spread mixture evenly into each jalapeno. Wrap a slice of cooked bacon around each jalapeno and secure it with a toothpick. Grill over medium heat until bacon is cooked and cheese is melted, about 4 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Sift the dry ingredients into a large bowl. Mix the egg with the orange juice until smooth. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients. Stir until just moistened. Heat an 8 inch pan or skillet over medium heat. Lightly spray with nonstick spray. Pour 1/4 cup of batter into the pan for each pancake. Cook for 30 seconds or until the edges start to turn golden brown. Flip the pancake over with your spatula and cook on the other side for an additional 30 seconds. Remove the pancake from the pan. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve immediately. Serve with butter, maple syrup or fresh fruit.
Heat the olive oil and add the chopped garlic to it. Saute the onions until softened and then add the mushrooms. Add the seasoning and the wine and allow to simmer until the liquid has evaporated.

In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, milk & salt & pepper. Melt butter in a 9-inch nonstick skillet. Pour egg mixture into the skillet. Cook & stir over medium-low heat until just set. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle the top evenly with cheese. Spread one piece of bread with mayonnaise & top with the egg mixture. Repeat with the other slice of bread. Makes 1 sandwich.
Mix breadcrumbs with egg, season with salt and pepper. Heat butter in a frying pan. Add breadcrumb mixture and cook until brown. Add cheese and mix until melted. Serve in buns with hotdogs.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a deep-dish 9-inch pie plate with cooking spray. Lay the pastry on the bottom of the pie plate and crimp edges decoratively, leaving the edges unfanned. Bake for 5 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Remove from oven to cool slightly. Combine rhubarb, orange zest, and 2 teaspoons of jelly in the baking dish. Sprinkle with the sugar and set aside. Mix the remaining 1 tablespoon jelly and the flour together with 1 1/2 cups of the raspberries, and spread over the rhubarb mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining raspberries and bake for 20 to 30 minutes longer, or until the fruit is tender and bubbling, and the top is golden brown. Let cool before serving with whipped cream or ice cream.

Place the dried apples, sage leaf, cinnamon stick, scotch whisky, honey and boiling water in a jug. Stir well to combine. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge to steep for 2 hours. Pour the toddy into serving glasses to serve.

Boil corn until tender. Drain. Cut kernels from cobs. Cook zucchini in boiling water 5 minutes. Drain and cool. Chop pimiento and set aside. Heat oil in skillet. Saute garlic and pimiento 3 minutes. Stir in corn. Add zucchini, and saute 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Spread in shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serves 6.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until just tender. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, heat butter over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add beans and seasonings and cook 1 minute. Add potatoes and toss. Cook 3 minutes more. Serve immediately.
In a mortar and pestle, pound the spices until they are a fine powder. Store in a jar with a tight lid. Use to flavor beans, stews or salad dressings.

In a large pot, saute onion in butter until lightly browned. Add tomatoes and continue to saute for 5 minutes. Add beans and cover with water. Bring to boil and simmer for 30 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in oxtail soup mix and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Serve with rice.

Combine quinoa flour, quinoa, baking powder, baking soda & salt in a bowl & set aside. Peel & slice bananas into small pieces. Mash them & add egg, honey & milk to them. Whisk to combine. Now add the wet mixture to the dry mixture & stir to combine. Spoon the mixture into a greased 12 cup muffin pan. Bake in preheated oven for about 20 to 25 minutes until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool slightly before removing from the pan to wire rack & cool completely. These can be frozen & re-warmed when you wish to eat them. Makes about 12 servings.

beat together the eggs, oil, sugar, vanilla, salt and baking powder. mix well. add the flour gradually to form a soft dough. roll into small balls and place about 1/2 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. make a 1/4 inch indentation in center of each ball with your finger (this is where the filling will go). fill with raspberry preserves or your favorite jam or jelly. press edges together to close. brush with egg wash and sprinkle with confectioner's sugar (or drizzle with melted chocolate). bake at 375 for 10 - 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Dissolve oleo in juiceadd wafer crumbsbeat until smooth. Stir in nuts and coconut. Chill for an hour or sothen form into balls about the size of a walnutroll in powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator or freezer.

Cut fish into small pieces and soak in water for 1 day. Boil the salt pork in water for 20 minutes or till tender. Cut up carrot and potatoes into small cubes. Drain fish well. In an iron pot, put in fish, pork, carrot, potatoes, boiling water and salt to taste. Cook slowly for about 2 hours or till done. When done, add in 1/2 cup of cold milk. If too thick add more water or milk. Add in canned corn niblets. Cook for 5 minutes more. Serve hot with bread or crackers.

In a medium saucepan, combine the heavy cream and sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture begins to steam. Add the egg yolks and whisk constantly until mixture is thickened. Add the Kahlua and Grand Marnier and remove from heat. Add chocolate chips and vanilla and stir until melted and smooth. Pour into individual custard cups and chill for at least two hours. Serve with whipped cream and grated nutmeg or cinnamon on top if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the coconut in a shallow pan. Beat together the eggs and milk in a bowl. Dip both sides of the Hawaiian sweet bread in the egg mixture, then roll them in the coconut mixture. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Fry the bread slices in the butter until golden brown on both sides. Remove from the heat. Top with coconut flakes and the chopped macadamia nuts. Serve with maple syrup and whipped cream.

Cook the noodles in water according to directions on the package. Drain the noodles and set them aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the pot cheese, stirring until melted. Add the cooked noodles to the pot cheese, tossing gently to coat. Add the sour cream and stir. Serve immediately.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove from pan leaving 2 Tbs of drippings. Saute onion until clear in the same pan. Add flour, stirring constantly until browned. Gradually add reserved bacon drippings. Stir until blended. Add tomatoes and juice, stirring constantly over medium heat until thickened. Sprinkle with sugar, bay leaf and celery leaves. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve over biscuits or toast. Makes 8 servings.

Beat together the buttermilk and eggs in large bowl. In another bowl combine the breadcrumbs, mustard powder, and pepper. Coat trout fillet with breadcrumb mixture. Dip in the egg mixture. Coat with the breadcrumb mixture again. Place in pan and bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees or until done. Drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with the parsley and the almonds. Serves 1.
In a large mug combine rum and milk. Add spices. Stir well. Serve.

Heat oven to 350. Mix all filling ingredients in a bowl. Lightly beat the egg and combine with the flour. Place a teaspoon of the filling in the center of each wonton skin. Fold over to form a triangle and press edges together to seal. Place in a buttered pan. Bake until lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

Preheat over to 400 degrees f. In a saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add flour stir until golden. Add milk and cook until thickened. Stir in seasonings and cheese until smooth. Drain hash browns on paper towels. Transfer to a greased 11 x 7-inch baking dish. Top with cheese sauce. Cover with foil spray with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. Wash potatoes and cut into 1/4-inch cubes. Place cubes in a large mixing bowl. Peel and slice the onions into 1/4-inch strips, add to bowl. Mix well. Add salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and mix well again. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown on top, stirring once or twice.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Add to 1/2 cup butter, 1 can diced tomatoes with liquid (not drained), 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Put in 13 x 9 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

In medium bowl combine honey, stir-fry sauce, red pepper flakes, peanuts. Set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of the canola oil in wok over high heat. Add broccoli and mushrooms. Stir fry 1 minute. Add onion and carrot. Stir fry 2 minutes more. Add soy sauce. Add the mixture of honey, stir-fry sauce, red pepper flakes, and peanuts. Stir fry 1 minute or until the liquid is absorbed. Remove from the heat. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon canola oil. Serve over hot rice.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. In a small dish combine the olive oil, lemon juice, sea salt, pepper and 1/4 cup water. Add the fish. Marinate for 30 minutes. Remove the fish from the marinade. Pat dry. In another small dish combine the remaining 1/4 cup water, orange zest and capers. Roast the fish for about 15 minutes. In a large skillet over high heat cook the onion in a small amount of olive oil for about 3 minutes. Add the orange zest mixture and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the arugula. Serve the fish over the arugula with the orange zest mixture. Makes 2 servings.

Cook pasta and set aside. In a large pot, melt butter. Add flour. Gradually stir in milk. Add mushroom soup. Mix well. Add pasta and tuna. Mix well. In a 9x13-inch baking dish, spread pasta mixture. Top with velveeta cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to package directions. Heat the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and cook until light golden, about 1 minute. Add the spinach and cook until just wilted. Add the beans and the broth. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. Remove from the heat. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of the cooking water. Add the pasta to the pan and toss to combine. If the sauce is too thick, add a little of the reserved cooking water. Season with salt and pepper. Top with grated Parmesan and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Chop bacon. Saute bacon in large skillet until crisp. Drain fat. Chop bacon. Add onion to bacon in skillet. Cook until tender. Add chopped mushroom. Cook until tender. In large bowl combine milk, eggs, cheddar cheese, italian seasoning, garlic. Pour egg mixture over bacon and onion in skillet. Cook until mixture is almost set. Drain and chop asparagus. Add to mixture. Remove skillet from heat. Add asparagus. Pour mixture into pie shell. Bake for 30 minutes or until center is set. Cool slightly. Cut into wedges. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine molasses, vinegar, ketchup and Worcestershire in a medium bowl. Rub onion slices on bottom and sides of roasting pan. Into pan, place the turkey legs and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with marinade mixture. Roast for about 2 hours or until cooked through and tender. Turn and baste every half hour or so.
Wash all the salad greens, add the radishes and strawberries. In a bowl add the vinaigrette and toss the greens. Add the spring onions, red pepper and coriander. Toss again and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake cake according to package directions. Cool completely. Poke with fork all over and sprinkle with 2 tsp. of boiling water. Let stand for 3 minutes. Add remaining boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Pour over cake. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Top with cool whip and sprinkle with coconut.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray cookie sheet with non-stick spray. Combine bread crumbs & seasoning in shallow dish. Dip chicken in sour cream, then crumb mixture. Place on cookie sheet, spray chicken with cooking spray. Bake at 400f for 20-25 minutes or until no longer pink & juices run clear. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. In another bowl beat eggs with ranch salad dressing and mustard until fluffy. Add egg white mixturestir to combine. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heatswirl to coat. Add egg mixture. Cook, stirring until thickened and no longer runny. Stir in parsley. Sprinkle with garlic powder and season with pepper. Place 1/3 of egg mixture on each tortilla. Top with mozzarella cheese slices. Fold tortilla over fillingpress edges to seal. Repeat with remaining filling. Cut each quesadilla into 4 wedges. Serve with salsa or sour cream if desired.

Peel and grate the carrots and the lemon peel. Grease an 8-inch square pan with butter and dust with breadcrumbs. Place the grated carrot and the lemon peel in a small bowl. Add the honey and stir until blended. Set aside. Cream together the butter and the sugar until smooth. Add the eggs and beat well. Fold in the carrot mixture. Sift together the flour, the ginger, the baking powder, the salt and the spices. Add the flour mixture to the batter and beat well. Spoon the batter into the pan. Bake at 375 degrees for about 40 minutes. Cool the pan on a rack. Frost the cake with the lemon-cream cheese frosting.
Combine avocado with the sour cream and seasonings. Stir in the peas and the rest of the vegetables. Refrigerate to blend flavors. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine first four ingredients in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add next four ingredients. Cook until thoroughly heated. Add chickencover and simmer for about 10 minutes until done. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in a large nonstick pan over medium high heat. Add light coating of salt and pepper to pork chops. Add pork chops to pan. Cook until browned on each side. Remove pork chops from pan and set aside. Add honey, mustard and wine to pan. Bring to a low boil for 2 minutes. Put pork chops back into pan with sauce. Reduce heat, simmer for 5 minutes. Turn pork, simmer another 5 minutes or until pork is cooked and no longer pink. Serve with sauce drizzled on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mustard and honeystir until smooth. Add fish and cook until browned on both sides. Stir in bread crumb mixture. Spread evenly onto a baking dish. Sprinkle with pecans and parsley. Bake until fish is cooked through and golden, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

In a small bowl combine the orange juice, orange peel, garlic and ginger. Place the fish in the bowl and let marinate for 10 minutes. In a large skillet heat the vegetable oil. Dip the fish in the flour, shaking off the excess. Brown the fish over high heat. Lower the heat and pour in the orange mixture. Cook 3 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with green onions.

Combine 2 cups of the heavy cream and the espresso powder in a small saucepan and heat over low heat until hot. Do not boil. Remove from heat. In a large mixing bowl combine the remaining 2 cups of heavy cream, the sweetened condensed milk, yogurt and the espresso mixture. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Prepare ice cream according to manufacturer's instructions. Garnish with the cinnamon and figs. Serve immediately. Makes 1 quart.
In a blender, puree the first four ingredients for 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Combine raspberry gelatin and boiling water in medium bowlstir until well mixed. Add cold waterstir until well blended. Refrigerate until thickened. Beat Cool Whip until fluffy. Fold in raspberry mixture.

In 12 inch skillet, saute frankfurters in 1 tbsp. butter until browned. Remove from pan. Saute onion in remaining butter until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients except tomato. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover. Simmer 15 to 20 min. or until frankfurters are done. Stir in tomato. Serve over wide egg noodles. Garnish with dried parsley.

To make cream cheese mixture beat together cream cheese, salsa, mustard, & garlic with fork until well blended. Stir in bacon. Spread evenly onto flour tortillas. Top with romaine leaves & tomato slices. Roll up. Serve with your favorite dip.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until tender but firm to bitedrain and set aside. In the same pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and sausage to pan and cook until meat is no longer pink, 10-15 minutes. Add garlic and cook until golden. Stir in the tomatoes and their juice and basilsimmer until heated through. Add the pasta and toss to coat. Divide among plates and sprinkle with asiago cheese.

Boil a pot of water. Add shallot and asparagus and cook until crisp tender. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl mix together the lemon juice, dijon mustard, and olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste and toss in the asparagus. Serve warm or cold. Serves 3-4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix together the seasoning and oil. Place a sprig of rosemary and 2 of the lemon slices in the center of each of the breasts. Then rub the seasoned oil all over the breasts. Place the breasts in a small casserole dish. Cover and bake in the oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake another 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve.

Heat oil in heavy large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until golden brown, about 1 minute. Add green beans and cook until bright green and crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add brussels sprouts and cook until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in vinegar. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 425f. Combine dry breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Add paprika, thyme and garlic salt. Stir to combine. In a shallow dish, combine buttermilk and red pepper. Coat chicken with buttermilk mixture and then dredge in the breadcrumb mixture. Coat with cooking spray and place in baking dish. Bake for 35 minutes.

Heat 2 tbsp of the butter in a skillet over medium heat and saute the shallots until tender about 5 minutes. Add mushroom and saute until tender about 5 minutes more. Add the wine and cook until almost dry about 2 minutes more. Add the remaining 1 tbsp butter and cook until melted. Stir in the chives and pimiento. Add the remaining 1 tbsp of butter to a large skillet over medium heat. When hot add the shrimp, cook until pink about 2 minutes per side. Add the lemon juice, cover and cook just until done about 1 more minute. Pour the shallot mixture over the shrimp. Serve over hot cooked pasta or rice

In a 1 1/2 quart measuring glass pour boiling water over the yeast, stir, let sit for about 5 minutes or until mixture is foamy. Add the sugar, salt, and dry milk. Let sit for 10 minutes. In the bread pan add the shortening, then the dry mix and the boiling water mixture. Select dough cycle. When the machine beeps, remove the dough from the machine and turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Punch dough down and divide dough into 16 equal portions. Form each portion into a ball. Place rolls in a greased or parchment-lined sheet dusted with cornmeal. Dust rolls lightly with flour. Cover rolls loosely with plastic wrap and let them rest for 1 hour. Bake in a preheated oven for about 20 minutes. Serve hot from the oven.

Cook chicken in a large pot of boiling water for 15 minutes. Remove chicken from the boiling water and place in a large bowl of ice water. Cool for 5 minutes and remove from water. Chop chicken into small pieces. In a small bowl combine the relish and the mayonnaise. Fold in the chicken and parsley. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Serve on sandwiches.

Combine the water and coffee in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely. Refrigerate for up to two weeks. Makes about 3 1/2 cups.

Preheat the oven to 180c. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin. In a large bowl stir together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. Beat the egg with the almond extract in another bowl. Stir the egg mixture and milk into the dry ingredients. Fold in the butter. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared cups. Top each with a slice of red plum. Bake until the muffins are golden brown, about 20 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes. Transfer the muffins to a wire rack and cool completely.

Cook potatoes until fork tender. Drain. In a large mixing bowl, mix cooked potatoes, chicken broth, parmesan cheese, butter, salt, and garlic powder. Mix until all ingredients are well blended. Add kale and mix well.

Saute the onions and garlic in the olive oil in a large pot. Add the beef, sausage, green peppers, potatoes, kidney beans and seasonings. Add the broth and simmer for 30 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked. Add the basil. Makes 6 servings.

Bring a large pan of water to the boil and season it with salt. Add the green beans and asparagus spears and cook them for 4 minutes. Remove the vegetables with a slotted spoon and immediately place them in a bowl full of iced water to stop the cooking. Drain the water from the pan and return the pan to a high heat. Add the chicken breast to the pan and fry it on each side until golden brown. Remove the meat from the pan and allow it to cool. Chop the meat into bite-sized pieces. Finely slice the basil. Combine the vegetables with the meat. Add the olive oil, cider vinegar, dijon mustard and pine nuts. Season the mixture with freshly ground black pepper. Arrange the salad leaves on a large plate and place the warm chicken salad on top. Garnish the warm chicken salad with the basil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.In a large bowl combine the eggs, milk, ham, chives, Ortega chiles, sour cream, and 1/4 cup of the cheddar cheeseseason with salt and pepper to taste. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with the remaining 1/4 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese.Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until set in the middle.Serve warm.
Cook grits according to package directions. Add tomatoes and onion. Stir in bacon just before serving.
Mix all of the ingredients together in a crock pot and cook on low for 4-6 hours. Strain off the solids and enjoy.

Make pastry - beat butter with sugar until light and creamy. Add flour and mix to form crumbs. Add 2 tbsp of milk and mix to form soft dough. Roll out to line 20cm tart tin. Bake blind for approx 15 minutes at 200C then remove case and bake for further 5 minutes. Allow to cool while making filling. Beat together fruit, walnuts and sugar until combined then add glace cherries. Beat eggs with lemon juice then stir in to mixture with remaining milk. Pour into case and bake for approx 30 minutes at 200C. When cooked remove from oven, allow to cool then dust with icing sugar.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees f (230 degrees c). Cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch slices. Place in a bowl and toss with 1 teaspoon thyme and 1/2 teaspoon of both cumin and sumac. Season with salt and pepper, and toss again. In a shallow bowl or on a plate, combine 1/2 cup flour with 1/2 teaspoon of each of the dried herbs and a pinch of salt and pepper. In another shallow bowl or on a plate, combine 1/4 cup flour with 1/4 teaspoon of each of the herbs and a pinch of salt and pepper. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons butter and let it melt. In batches, dredge potato slices in flour mixture, then dip them into beaten eggs, letting excess drip off and drain on a paper towel. Add them to skillet and brown on both sides.

Brown hamburger until no longer pink. Drain grease. Add taco seasoning mix and package amount of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Add onion. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in tomato paste. Remove from heat. In 9x13 baking dish. Layer hamburger mixture, chips, then cheese. Bake uncovered at 350f for 15 minutes.
Mix flour with salt & pepper. Add water & cook until thickened. Add onion, bell pepper & garlic. Add diced fresh tomatoes & cook until hot.

Cook rhubarb and sugar in a medium sized pot over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add gelatin and mix well. Remove from heat and stir in lite evaporated milk. Spread in an 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Cool and refrigerate.
In slow-cooker combine macaroni, butter, eggs, evaporated milk, soup. Cook on high for 3 hours. Stir in cheddar cheese. Cook on high for an additional 30 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.

Grate the cucumber on the large holes of a box grater and sprinkle it with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and let stand for 10 minutes to release some of its water. Squeeze out water with your hands, then add cucumber to yogurt along with remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt, the mint and 1/2 teaspoon of each of the remaining spices. Mix thoroughly and chill until serving time.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until browned. Stir in water, mustard and leek soup mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in broccoli and milk. Heat through. Stir in cheese. Top with roasted red peppers and serve over rice.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Season the fish all over with the black pepper and then add the shallot. Sear the fish on one side for 1 minute, then turn and sear for another minute on the other side. Transfer the pan from the heat and place the fish on a small rimmed baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the cherry tomatoes, olives, capers and the oregano. Add the balsamic vinegar, drizzle the fish with the olive oil and sprinkle with the tapenade. Bake until the fish is just cooked through, about 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place chicken in a dish. Stir mustard and yogurt together in a bowl. Sprinkle with ginger, garlic and pepper. Pour over chicken. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl toss together the sweet potato wedges, spanish onion, butter, fresh thyme, and salt. Place in a single layer in a large baking dish. Bake uncovered until golden brown and tender. Sprinkle each serving with a spoonful of low-fat sour cream.
Mix milk and cream cheese together until blended. Add remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until chilled. Serve with crackers or veggies.

Mix crushed pineapple with fruit cocktail, stir in blackberriesspread in a greased 9x12 pan. Sprinkle with pecansset aside. In a bowl combine sugar, buttermix in dry cake mixblend in milk with a fork until crumblyspread over fruitdot with butterbake at 350f for 45 minutes until golden brownlet stand for a few minutes before serving.

Prepare the eggs by combining the milk and the cayenne pepper in a small bowl and whisking together. Separate the eggs into two bowls, add a small amount of salt and black pepper into each bowl and whisk together. Heat a small frying pan and add a small amount of canola oil. Crack one of the eggs into the pan and let it cook for about 30 seconds or so, then turn the egg and let it cook for 10 seconds or so more. Repeat this with the other egg and set the two cooked eggs aside. In another skillet, cook the canadian bacon until it is browned. Put one half of the canadian bacon on top of each english muffin. Spread each half of the english muffin with hollandaise sauce. Carefully place one egg on top of each muffin half and sprinkle the swiss cheese on top of the eggs and the canadian bacon. Cook the other half of the canadian bacon and put on top of each sandwich. Serve immediately.

In large skillet cook butter and oil over medium-low heat until melted. Add sage and garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add chicken. Cook 3 minutes or until browned. Turn to brown other side. Add potato. Cook 3 minutes or until browned. Stir in broth. Cook until liquid is almost evaporated. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in parsley.

Boil potatoes until tender. Mash. Add butter and flour. Cook in milk for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Add salt and pepper. Add paprika and bouillon. Pour into a greased baking pan. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Saute the onions and add the other ingredients and beat together until smooth. Pour into a 9x13 pan and bake uncovered at 350 for 40 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with the crushed cornflakes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter one side of each piece of bread. Spread hot pepper jelly evenly on the unbuttered side. Place 1 slice ham and 1 slice turkey on one half. Spread each with 1/4 cup hot sauce. Place 1 slice each on the other half of bread. Whisk together the eggs and milk in a small bowl. Brush the outside of the sandwiches evenly with the mixture. Place the sandwiches in a baking dish. Sprinkle the top of each sandwich evenly with the cheese and bake for 30 minutes or until the sandwiches are golden brown. Serve warm.

Cook the chicken in a small amount of water until just done. Remove from water and let cool. Chop the cooked chicken into bite size pieces. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and stir until well blended. Refrigerate overnight. Serve as a side dish or spread on bread or rolls.

Wash and dry mushroom caps, reserving stems for another use. Heat oil in skillet and cook sausage until browned and drained fat. Cool slightly. In a medium bowl combine sausage, soy sauce and scallion. Gently mix in egg and breadcrumbs. Fill caps with mixture. Place in shallow baking pan and bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Makes 24 caps.

In large saucepan combine sugar, water and peanut butter. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Reduce heat and cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and stir. Divide evenly into four tall glasses. Top each glass with scoop of vanilla ice cream. Sprinkle each serving with 1 tablespoon salted peanuts. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl combine nuts and brown sugar. Set aside. In another bowl mix together potatoes, evaporated milk and vanilla. In a third bowl mix together egg and flour. Pour in the mixture in the first bowl and stir until well blended. Stir in coconut and nuts. Pour into a greased 9×13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Place fruit, nuts, milk and honey into a small pot on the stovetop. Bring to a boil. Stir in the couscous. Remove from heat and allow to sit for 5 minutes. Stir to combine. Pour into a serving bowl. Top with cream. Add a touch of vanilla extract and cinnamon. Serves 8.

Boil water. Add pastina. Cook 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add milk. Return to heat and heat through. Beat egg lightly. Add to pastina mixture. Cook over low heat until egg is set. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat the grill pan over medium-high heat. Season the steak with black pepper. Add the steak and cook until cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Cut the steak into thin slices and place in a bowl with the sliced steak. Mix the ginger and lemon juice into the bowl and toss well. Heat the oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the sweet potatoes and cook until browned on all sides and tender. Add the sliced steak and sauce. Toss well and serve immediately.

Arrange bottoms of rolls in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Layer each roll evenly with ham and gruyere. Spread each roll top with cream cheese. Place over gruyere. In a small bowl, combine the butter, parmesan cheese, worcestershire sauce and onion. Pour over sandwiches. Let stand for at least 20 minutes. Cover and bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Add peppers, onion, mushrooms, olives, garlic and sauce in a bowl mix well. Cut each biscuit into quarters. Put half the biscuits in the bottom of a 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Spread with half the sauce mixture and half the cheese. Repeat layer. Bake for 23 to 28 minutes or until golden brown. Bottom of pan will not be completely covered with the biscuits.

Brown the meat with the onions and garlic salt. Add the tomato sauce and water and simmer covered for about an hour and a half. While the meat mixture is cooking, slice the bell peppers in half and remove the seeds and membranes from the inside with a spoon. When the meat mixture is done cooking, stuff it into the halved peppers and place them in a shallow baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes to an hour.

Prepare batter as directed on package. Beat in coffee and liqueur. Pour batter into greased and floured bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees 40-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 15 minutes. Invert onto wire rack. Cool completely. Drizzle with frosting.

Sort through the pink beans to remove any debris. Wash the beans and cover with water in a large pot. Add the ham hocks, garlic cloves and onion to the pot of pink beans. Cover the beans with water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce to a simmer. Cook uncovered for 3 to 4 hours, adding water as necessary to keep the pot level. Discard the ham hocks and add the salt and pepper to taste. Serve the pink beans in a soup bowl with a dollop of butter to add flavor and a crusty bread for dipping.

Skin avocados. Place in a bowl. Cut off stem from tomatillos. Cut in half. Remove seeds. Cut into small pieces. Add to bowl. Dice onions. Add to bowl. Dice tomatoes. Add to bowl. Add 1 tablespoon of lime juice and 1 tablespoon of hot pepper sauce. Add to bowl. Add 1 teaspoon of hot pepper flakes. Add 1 teaspoon of hot sauce. Add 1 teaspoon of salt. Add 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Stir until mixed. Refrigerate. Serve with tortilla chips.

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 13x9x2-inch glass or metal baking pan or line with foil and grease lightlyset aside.2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, soda, and saltmix well. Set aside.3. In another bowl, mash the bananasset aside.4. In a large bowl of an electric mixer, beat together the butter and brown sugar until creamy. Add the eggs and beat wellbeat in the mashed bananas.5. Add the dry ingredients to the mixing bowlbeat just until moistened. Stir in the vanilla and the chocolate chips.6. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 22-25 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is just set (the center may seem slightly underbaked). Cool in the pan on a wire rack for a few minutes, then remove to the rack to cool completely before cutting.7. Store in an air-tight container at room temperature. These freeze well, too. Makes about
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine crescent roll dough with miracle whip. Fold in crabmeat, parsley and lemon juice. Divide into squares and bake for 10 minutes. Top with cheddar and green onions.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a shallow bowl combine panko bread crumbs and cheese. In another bowl combine egg and water. Place fish fillets in egg mixture and coat evenly. Place fish in panko mixture. Place fish in a greased baking dish. Bake 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with additional panko mixture. Bake an additional 10 minutes.

Mix flour with salt and set aside. Beat together the dark brown sugar and the egg until very well blended and light and fluffy. Add the flour mixture and beat until well combined. Add the milk and beat until blended well. Add the vanilla and beat until well mixed. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for about 40 minutes or until the middle is set and the top is golden. Cool completely before serving. Serve with fresh whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Bring a large pot of water to the boil. Add 2 tablespoons salt. Add spaghetti. Cook for 14 minutes exactly, then drain. About half-way through the cooking time for the spaghetti, heat the olive oil in a large frypan over a medium heat. Add the garlic, hot red chili peppers - i pound these three ingredients in a mortar and pestle for a minute or so first, but this is not absolutely necessary. Cook the garlic, hot red chili peppers mixture in the oil for a couple of minutes until the garlic is soft but not brown. Reduce heat to low and add parsley. With the pan still on the heat, add the drained spaghetti and toss with a pair of tongs or two forks to combine thoroughly. Serve sprinkled with grated or granulated parmesan cheese.

Rinse and pat dry the chicken breasts. Salt and pepper the breasts and place in a medium size zip-loc bag. Add the rosemary and marmalade and let the flavors combine. Squeeze out the air and seal the bag. Place the bag in the refrigerator for at least two hours. Preheat the grill and when it is hot, remove the breasts from the bag and brush them with a small amount of olive oil. Grill until the breasts are done. Serve with the extra sherry wine vinegar and drizzle the juice from the bag over the chicken. Makes 4 servings.

Cook the potato in boiling water until tender. Drain well and set aside to cool slightly. When cooled, mash the potato with the butter, watercress, peas, corn and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Stir to combine well. Divide the mashed potato evenly between the 4 plates. Sprinkle each serving with more butter and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper to serve. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In 2 quart microwaveable casserole dish, microwave potatoes with 1/2 cup fat-free chicken broth on high 5-1/2 minutes. Stir until smooth. Stir in remaining chicken broth and cheese. Microwave 2-1/2 minutes longer or until heated through. Add spinach. Microwave 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with garlic powder.

preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix jiffy cornbread mix as directed on package. Stir in mayonnaise. Add 1 egg (reserve 1 egg for glaze). Stir in oil and sugar. Pour into greased 8x8 glass baking dish. Bake 350 for 40 minutes or until golden brown on top and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. In a small bowl, beat 1 reserved egg with 1 tablespoon water for glaze. Spread glaze over cornbread while still warm. Serve warm.

Heat olive oil in a large pot. Cook onion, carrot and garlic until tender. Add ham. Cook for an additional 3 minutes. Add water to cover and bring to boil. Stir in peas, marjoram and seasoning. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours or until peas are tender.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and once the butter starts to foam, add the mushrooms and cook until they are brown and tender. Lower the heat and add the caramelized onions to the skillet. Stir to combine. Once the mushrooms and onions are softened and brown, add the ground beef and sprinkle with the kosher salt and the ground pepper. Cook the meat until it is no longer pink and has a brown crust. Remove from the heat and place the cooked meat in a bowl. Slice the buns in half and place the bottom half of the bun on a plate. Top with the chicken gravy and the french fries. Place a slice of mozzarella cheese on top of the french fries. Add the mushroom-onion mixture to the bottom bun half. Top with the burger patty and the top of the bun. Serve immediately.

Puree the peaches until they are smooth. Pour the peaches into a crock-pot and add the rest of the ingredients and stir to mix well. Set the crock-pot on low and cook for 8-9 hours or until thick. Remove from the crock-pot and spoon the mixture into the hot jars. Process the jars for 10 minutes in the boiling water canner.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two round pans and set aside. In a mixing bowl cream the Crisco and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat after each addition. Combine the milk and vanilla in a small bowl and add this mixture alternately with the flour to the creamed mixture. Mix just until combined after each addition. Pour into the pans and bake for about 1 hour or until done. Check by inserting a toothpick in the center of the cakes and removing it and wiping the toothpick clean on the side of the pan. It should come out clean when done. Cool the cakes in the pan for 15 minutes and then turn them out onto a wire rack to cool completely before icing.

In a large salad serving bowl, toss together the spinach, strawberries, kiwis, and almonds. Place chicken breast halves over the top of the salad. Top with feta cheese. Serve with poppyseed dressing for dipping.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. On a baking sheet, combine the onion powder, garlic powder, and the chipotle powder. Heat the pan over medium-high heat until the mixture begins to brown. Remove from the heat and add the tenderloin. Sprinkle with the brown sugar. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cut vegetables into 1/4 inch slices. Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add vegetables to skillet and cook until tender. Add paprika and caraway seed to vegetables. Place brats in skillet and brown well. Add beer to skillet. Bring to boil. Simmer 5 to 10 minutes or until desired tenderness. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in Dutch oven over medium-high heat until hot. Add chickencook 6 to 8 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove chicken from panset aside. Add onion and next 5 ingredients (onion through cauliflower)cook and stir 4 minutes. Add low-sodium, low-fat chicken broth and dried herbs. Bring to a boilcover and reduce heat. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in pasta. Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender and pasta is heated through. Stir in reserved chicken. Season to taste. Serve with Parmesan cheese.

Heat oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and fry until dark brown and fragrant. Remove seeds and add garlic and onion. Fry until brown and crisp. Add green lentils and water, stirring to mix well. Bring to boil and then lower heat and simmer gently for 40 minutes or until lentils are tender. Check that the water has not evaporated and add more if necessary. Season with salt and cayenne and serve immediately.

Cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Combine all the ingredients except for the honeydew melon in a large bowl. Toss together and refrigerate for at least an hour. Slice honeydew melon. Divide pasta mixture among 4 large bowls. Top with honeydew slices and serve cold. Serve with toasted pita wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Season the chicken with the salt and the pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Brown the chicken on both sides. Remove from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, saute the spinach with the garlic and the red pepper flakes until the spinach is just wilted. Remove the spinach mixture from the pan and set aside. To make the filling, combine the spinach with the goat cheese and the egg. Stuff the filling between the slices of chicken. Roll up the chicken. Spread the stuffing on top and around the stuffed breasts. Bake for about 45 minutes. Turn the breasts over after about half an hour. Top with the parsley and serve.

Combine flour with salt and pepper. Dust each breast with the flour mixture. Heat oil over high heat in a skillet. Cook breasts until they're browned on both sides. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add thyme to skillet. Add sherry. Cook 1 minute. Add olives. Add stock. Stir. Add chicken. Cover and cook over medium heat until the sauce thickens. Serve with rice.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the gnocchi according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. Stir in garlic and basil. Add cheese and prosciutto. Toss to coat. Serve warm.

Cut the pork chops into 1/4-inch slices. Sprinkle both sides of the pork with the cinnamon. Melt the margarine in a 9-inch square baking dish. Lay the slices of pork over the margarine. Sprinkle the apples over the pork slices. Drizzle with the vinegar. Sprinkle the remaining 1/3 of the cinnamon over the top. Bake the pork until the slices are no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the pork sit for 5 minutes.

Heat 1 tablespoon of canola oil in a large skillet. Add 1 teaspoon of crushed red pepper flakes. Stir in 1 pound of cooked brown rice and 1 teaspoon of garlic powder. Stir in 1 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of dried oregano. Stir in 1 cup of frozen snow peas. Stir in 1/4 cup of frozen corn kernels. Stir in 1/2 cup of chopped cilantro. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of red pepper flakes. Stir to combine. Serve hot.

Combine dry ingredients (sugar, flour, and cocoa) in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the butter until melted. Stir in the milk, bring to a boil and cook until the mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. Serve over biscuits or toast.

In a medium saucepan combine all of the ingredients except for the almonds and cinnamon and stir over high heat until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from the heat and allow it to cool completely. Place a shallow metal pan in freezer for at least 4 hours, or until it has become firm. Remove from freezer and stir with a fork until it breaks up into large crystals. Add cinnamon and almonds and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly coat an 8-inch cast-iron skillet with cooking spray. In a bowl, combine the cornmeal, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat together the eggs and canola oil until thoroughly combined. Stir the eggs into the cornmeal mixture until just combined. Pour into the prepared skillet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour a 9x5 loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl combine flour and spices. Stir in applesauce and sugars. In another bowl combine egg whites and vanilla and mix until smooth. Gradually add egg whites to dry mixture. Stir in banana. Spread batter into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour. Cool on wire rack.

Melt baking chocolate and butter over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in the eggs until smooth. Stir in the sugar, vanilla and nuts. Gradually stir the cake flour into the mixture until smooth and stiff. Let it cool until it is easy to handle. Roll out on a well-floured board or table top to about 1/8-inch thickness. Use a biscuit cutter or glass dipped in flour to cut out biscuits. Place about an inch apart on well-greased baking sheets. Bake at 325 for about 15 minutes or until the edges are dry and the chews are lightly browned. Remove from the baking sheets while still warm and cool on wire racks. Store in an airtight container or in cellophane bags.

Season pork with dried italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Place potatoes at the bottom of crock pot. Place pork on top of potatoes. Place apples on top of pork. Place kielbasa on top of apples. Sprinkle with dried italian seasoning. Pour sauerkraut over top of meat and kielbasa. Pour sweet white wine over the top. Cover with crock pot lid and cook on low for 6 hours. Increase heat to high for 1 hour. Add frozen peas and cook for another hour. Serve over rice.
Combine cream cheese with 3/4 cup powdered sugar, vanilla. Add 1/2 cup mini chips. Cover & refrigerate 2 hours. Form into ball, roll in graham crackers. Serve with pretzels.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place sweet potato wedges in a large bowl. Combine apple pie filling with golden raisins and spread over sweet potato wedges. In a small bowl combine melted butter, apple pie spice, and pecans. Sprinkle over top of sweet potatoes and toss to coat. Spread evenly into a foil lined 8-inch square pan or any shape or size you prefer. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large mixing bowl combine the garlic, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and the black pepper. Stir to blend well. Slowly add the olive oil and continue to stir. Add the sherry vinegar and stir to mix well. Stir in the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and the water. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the green onion and the jalapeno. Set aside. In a large serving bowl combine the garlic mixture and the jalapeno mixture. Toss well. Add the cilantro and toss to mix well. Serve at room temperature. Serves 6.

In a bowl mix together the fish sauce, pepper flakes and shallots. In another bowl mix together the egg and cornflour. Heat the oil and deep-fry the corn balls till golden brown and crispy. Remove from oil and drain on kitchen paper. Serve hot with sweet and sour sauce.

Saute the ground turkey in olive oil until it is cooked thoroughly. Add the spaghetti sauce to the turkey and let it cook for a minute or two. Add the onion and italian seasoning. Stir well. Add the cooked sweet corn. Simmer for a few minutes. Add the cooked elbow macaroni. Simmer for a couple of minutes. Add a little water to thin it out if needed. Serve immediately.
Place tea bags in boiling water. Steep for 10 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add remaining ingredients. Heat through. Garnish with orange slices. Serve warm.

Toss the potatoes in the oil and season well. Place on baking tray and bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle over the pineapple and nuts. Drizzle with the marmalade and lemon juice and sprinkle over the Dijon mustard. Serve hot.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the carrot, celery, and 2 teaspoons of the salt. Cook over high heat until the vegetables are just tender, 4 to 6 minutes. Add the rice and 2 cups of the chicken stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook the rice according to the package directions until al dente. Stir in the remaining 2 cups of stock. Add the chicken, remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and the parsley. Simmer until the chicken is cooked through. Taste for seasoning. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Place chops on lightly greased baking sheet. In large bowl combine honey, soy sauce, vinegar and garlic. Blend well. Spread over chops and bake approximately 20 minutes or until pork is cooked through. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Spoon some of the juices over the chops and serve.
Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add sour cream and stir until well blended. Fold in fruit, nuts and veggies. Chill. Cut into squares. Serve chilled.

Combine dry ingredients, mix well. Add cream, mix well. Add pepper, garlic, mix well. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 2-inch squares. Brush with cream. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Bake on a baking sheet at 425 for 8 to 10 minutes, or until browned. Cool for 2 minutes before serving.

Wash and trim beets and cut off the top and bottom of each one. Boil the beets in water for about 40 minutes or until tender. Drain the water and let cool. Slice the beets into wedges. Heat butter in a saucepan and add the beets and onions. Stir until onions are soft. Add the sugar and the balsamic vinegar. Continue stirring until the mixture thickens. Add a pinch of salt and pepper. Serve as a side dish or over rice.

Bring brown lentils and broth to boil in saucepan, then reduce heat and simmer until tender, 20-30 minutes. Add peppers and cook 5 minutes more. Mash the lentils until desired consistency. Add cheese, stirring until melted. Add pepper flakes and season with salt.

Peel and slice the onion. Put it in a small sauce pan with the garlic cloves and bay leaf. Add the black peppercorns and whole cloves. Cook slowly until the liquid evaporates and the onion is browned. Cut the pastry into squares that can be layered into the pie dish. Put a small amount of grated cheese onto the bottom layer of the pastry. Put a layer of the onion filling next to it. Add a layer of the cheese again, then the remaining onion and cheese. Brush the pastry edges with egg wash. Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 15 to 20 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare stuffing according to package directions, but do not let stand. Spoon stuffing across the center of a 13x9-inch baking dish. Arrange 3 chicken breast halves on each side of the stuffing. Combine soup, sour cream and mozzarella cheese in a bowl until smooth. Spread evenly over chicken breasts. Sprinkle with vegetables. Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 15 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Serve with additional sour cream if desired.

Mix together all the sauce ingredients in a bowl. Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add in the soba and cook according to package directions. Drain the soba and add it to a large bowl. Add in 3/4 of the prepared sauce. Toss to combine. Add in the remaining 1/4 of the sauce. Divide among 4 serving bowls. Garnish with green onions and serve.
Combine all ingredients and chill. Serve with crackers.
