Preheat oven to 375F degrees. Line 2 cookie sheets with parchment paper. Beat butter, applesauce and raw sugar in large bowl with mixer until combined well. Beat in bananas, eggs and extract until combined. Beat in flour, baking soda and baking powder until combined. Stir in oats and chocolate chips. Drop dough by 1/4 cupfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool 1 minute before removing to cooling racks. Makes 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a heavy skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion to skilletsaute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add garlicsaute until golden, about 2 minutes. Add tomato saucebring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer until thickened, about 8 minutes. In a small bowl, combine parsley, salt and pepperset aside. Lightly oil a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking disharrange fish in dish. Spoon sauce over fish. Top with parsley mixturesprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake until fish is just cooked through, about 30 minutes.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Cook broccoli for 3 minutes in a large pot of boiling water. Drain well and set aside. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, whisk together the flour, 2 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until bubbly. Gradually add the milk, whisking constantly until thickened and smooth. Add the mustard. Remove from heat. Add the broccoli. Toss to combine. Pour the sauce over the pasta mixture. Toss gently to combine. Sprinkle the top with the cheddar cheese. Serve warm.

Heat wok or large skillet over high heat until hot. Add oil. Swirl to coat. Add garlic and stir-fry until golden brown. Add onions and stir-fry 30 seconds more. Add rice and cook 1 minute. Add shrimp and stir-fry until cooked through. Add fish sauce and sugar and stir-fry until heated through. Add pineapple and stir-fry until heated through. Garnish with green onions.

Cut wings in half. Combine hot sauce and vinegar in a small bowl and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the ranch mix, butter and paprika. Add the hot sauce mixture and toss until well mixed. Place the cut chicken wings in a single layer in a shallow roasting pan. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken wings and gently toss. Bake for 15 minutes. Stir and bake for 15 minutes more. Check to see if the chicken wings are cooked through. If not, continue to bake until done.

Mix pretzel sticks and sugar in a 13 x 9 inch pan. Melt margarine in a small saucepan, add the cool whip until well blended. Pour over pretzel mixture and spread evenly to cover pretzels. Beat together the cream cheese with the softened margarine until well blended. Beat in the jello until smooth. Add the boiling water and stir well until blended. Add the frozen raspberries. Pour over the pretzel mixture. Chill until well set.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Let cool. Add cranberry sauce, lemon juice, red raspberries. Chill until set.

Cook the ravioli according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook the ground beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in the spaghetti sauce, the spinach and the Italian seasoning. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until spinach is tender. Layer half the meat mixture and the cheese over the ravioli in a greased 13 x 9-inch baking dishrepeat the layers and top with the remaining meat mixture and the remaining cheese. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until bubbly and the cheese is melted.
Spread cream cheese onto 1 pita half. Arrange vegetables over the cream cheesetop with tuna. Sprinkle with cheddar cheesefold pita half over the top. Broil until cheese is melted. Makes 2 servings.

In a small bowl combine all dressing ingredients except for the green onion. Set aside. Bring 3 cups of water to a boil in a large pot. Add the spinach leaves and cook for 1 minute or until they are bright green and tender but still holding their shape. Drain well in a colander then add to the dressing. Toss well until evenly coated. Serve warm or at room temperature. Garnish with green onion if desired.

Brown the ground turkey with the carrots and garlic powder. Add the Worcestershire sauce and the egg. In a bowl combine the bread crumbs and Parmesan. Mix together the egg and turkey mixture and add the bread crumb mixture. Spread the mixture evenly in a casserole dish. Top with the hashbrowns. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and top with the Cheddar cheese. Return to the oven and bake until the cheese is melted.

In a heavy bottomed saucepan combine egg yolks and sugar over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens and coats the spoon. Pour in vanilla and stir until blended. Add walnuts and lemon rind and stir until nuts are evenly coated with mixture. Turn out onto a greased cookie sheet and bake at 425 for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet immediately and cool on rack before storing in airtight containers.

Break the bread into pieces. In a large bowl, soak the bread in the half-and-half until the liquid is absorbed, about 2 minutes. Mix in the ground turkey, egg, salt, and the 3 tablespoons room-temperature butter. Put in the freezer for about 10 minutes to firm up. Remove the meat mixture from the freezer. It will still be very soft. Form the mixture into four oval cutlets. Mix the bread crumbs and dill in a small bowl and coat the cutlets with the bread crumb mixture. In a large nonstick skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and the oil over moderate heat. Cook the cutlets until golden brown and just done, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Serve with rice or pasta.

In a medium bowl, whisk together all the dressing ingredients. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, apples, cranberries and dressing. Cover and refrigerate until serving time.Serve on croissants or whole grain bread. Makes 4 servings.
Beat butter until smooth. Beat in powdered sugar. Add vanilla. Beat until creamy. Beat in walnuts. Shape into nuggets. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

In a large skillet coated with nonstick cooking spray, saute onions and garlic over medium heat until tender. Add butter and stir until melted. Stir in the brown sugar, salt and pepper. Cook until mixture becomes bubbly. Arrange the slices of meat in the skillet. Brush the tops of the meat slices with the balsamic vinegar. Cook until desired doneness. Transfer to serving plates. Serve hot. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Combine the beef and bread cubes in a bowl. Add the egg and mix with your hands until thoroughly combined. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Shape into balls about the size of a large walnut. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Serve on a bed of cooked pasta or rice.

Grease a shallow baking dish. In a large bowl toss together bread cubes and cranberries. In a small bowl combine the milk, egg, vanilla, honey, and sugar. Pour over the bread cubes. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight. The next morning heat oven to 350 degrees. Remove foil from baking dish and bake uncovered for 40 minutes. Top with brie slices. Makes 9 servings.
1. Mix all together except crust in a bowl.2. Put in a pie crust.3. Bake for an hour or so.4. Let cool for a while.5. Enjoy!

Soak mustard seeds overnight or for at least 12 hours (I use a large mason jar). In the morning, drain liquid and place seeds in blender with rice vinegar, powdered mustard and salt. Blend until smooth. Add beer, and pulse until mixture is smooth. (Add more beer if necessary.) Refrigerate for at least 24 hours before serving. Stir well before serving. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Prepare boxed brownie according to package directions. Cool completely. Cut cooled brownie into small squares. Place small amounts of whipped topping in small paper cups to form bottom of cupcake. Spoon in applesauce and place one brownie square on top of applesauce in each cupcake. Sprinkle with candy corn and serve chilled.

Preheat the oven to 350f grease and parchment paper line a 9 inch cake pan or two loaf pans, set aside. Combine the cornflour, salt and baking powder in a medium bowl and whisk until well combined and there are no lumps. In a large bowl beat the eggs and add the sugar gradually until well blended. Beat in the vanilla extract and melted butter. Add the flour mixture and beat at a medium speed until well blended. Pour batter into the pan and bake for approximately 45 minutes, or until a cake tester inserted comes out clean and the center of the cake springs back when pressed lightly with your fingers. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing from the pan and peeling off parchment paper. Let cool completely on rack before filling and frosting if desired.

Cream butter and sugar until light and creamy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add juice and rind of one orange and beat until smooth. Blend in flour, baking powder and salt until just combined. Pour into a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes or until cake test done. Remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes. Melt butter and pour over top of cake while still warm. Sprinkle with powdered sugar while butter is still hot. Serve with ice cream if desired.

Heat oil in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until soft, about 6 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the potatoes and cook until they begin to soften. Add the chicken stock and bring the mixture to a boil. Add the cauliflower and return to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cover the pot. Cook until the potatoes and cauliflower are tender. Working in batches, transfer the mixture to the blender. Puree until smooth. Return the pureed soup to the pot. Add the water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the salt and pepper and cook until the flavors are well blended. Serve the soup hot in individual bowls. Garnish each serving with the chives.

In a saucepan over high heat, bring the broth to a boil. Add the corn, celery ribs, carrots, onions and tomatoes. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cooked chicken and heat for 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine soy sauce, rice wine, brown sugar, gingerroot and garlic. Add cornstarch. Let stand for 15 minutes. Combine marinade with beef. Marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the beef mixture. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the snow peas. Cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until the beef loses its red color. Serve.

Sautee onions until soft. Add aroma seasoning. Stir until well blended. Add broth. Stir well. Add chicken. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until chicken is tender. Add rice. Stir well. Cover and simmer until rice is tender. In a separate bowl combine cornflake crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over the top of the meat mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until topping is golden brown.

Cook and drain spaghetti. In a skillet brown the ground beef and onion. Add spaghetti sauce. Add tomato sauce. Add drained noodles. Add pepperoni. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Saute the garlic and eggplant until they are tender. Add the marinara sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss together the chicken and marinara mixture. Spread half of the marinara mixture in a baking dish. Top with half of the rigatoni and half of the cheeses. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Top with fresh basil. Serve with warm bread.

Cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and blend well. Combine the flour and nuts and mix into the margarine mixture until well combined. Form into small balls with your hands and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Press the bottom of a glass into each ball to make a dimple. Bake in a preheated oven at 325 degrees f for 10 minutes. Store in an airtight container.

Slice smoked sausages in bite size pieces. Add barbecue sauce to meat. Add water to barbecue sauce. Heat until liquid starts to boil. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, until liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cup. Serve in buns.

Combine 4 tablespoons of the butter, orange concentrate, and 2 of the chipotles in a blenderblend until smooth. Combine the remaining 1 tablespoon butter, the molasses, and 1 tablespoon chipotle puree in a small bowlstir to combine. Grill the corn over medium-high heat, turning occasionally until tender, about 15 minutes. Brush the corn with some of the orange glaze and continue to turn until browned and glazed. Transfer to a serving plattersprinkle with cilantro. Serve with the remaining orange glaze.

Mix dry ingredients together. Add the lard until it is the size of tiny peas. Beat the egg with the vinegar. Add enough cold water to equal 1 cup of liquid. Add the liquid to the dry ingredients until you can form the dough together in your hand. Chill the dough for 1/2 hour before rolling. Roll out the dough to 1/4 inch thickness. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.

Cut white bread into cubes. Beat 5 eggs, add 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of crushed pineapples, 2 sticks of melted butter, 1/2 cup milk, and 1 tsp of vanilla extract. Add the bread cubes and mix thoroughly. Let this mixture stand for 2 hours or overnight. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

In a small skillet saute shallots in butter over medium-high heat until they are soft. Add mushrooms and cook 4 minutes. Add garlic, stirring constantly until fragrant. Stir in tomatoes. Simmer until reduced to 1/2 cup. Stir in seafood, wine, lemon juice and pepper. Spoon mixture into 4 pouches. Fold over 2 opposite sides. Place pouches seam side down on a baking sheet. Bake 8 minutes. Serve with toasted bread.

Slice each tomato into 4 wedges. In a bowl, combine oil with 1 teaspoon of the salt. Add tomato wedges and toss well. Reserve 1/2 teaspoon of the oil. On a large rimmed baking sheet coated with cooking spray, arrange tomato wedges in 2 single layers. Bake at 425 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut each tomato wedge diagonally into 3 pieces. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon oil and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Top each piece with 1 tablespoon of the pesto and 1 teaspoon of the green onion. Sprinkle evenly with 1/2 teaspoon of the parsley and 1/4 teaspoon of the Parmigiano-Reggiano. Serve with remaining 1/4 teaspoon Parmigiano-Reggiano.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a baking dish with non-stick spray. Put chicken in dish in single layer. Mix Miracle Whip, salsa, chili powder in a small bowl. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is done.

Toss the apples with the cranberries and sugar. Pour into an ungreased 10 x 6 inch pan or shallow gratin dish. Combine the oats, flour, brown sugar and nuts. Add the melted buttermix until crumbly. Sprinkle over the fruit mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden and bubbly. Cool slightly before serving with whipped cream or ice cream, if desired.
Cut halloumi into thin slices. Slice tomato in half and scoop out seeds. Place halloumi in tomato halves. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil. Sprinkle with pesto and serve.

In 13x9x2-inch baking pan arrange half of potato mixture, half of sausage and half of eggs, forming 3 layersrepeat layers and sprinkle evenly with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until eggs are set and center is hot.

In large foil packet, combine all ingredients except potatoes, celery, carrots. Place potatoes, celery, carrots around sides of packet to prevent meat from sticking to sides of foil packet. Bake at 350 for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until meat is tender. Serve over rice or noodles.
Dice the fruit and combine with the rosewater and icing sugar in a bowl and mix well. Serve immediately.

In a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat, saute the celery and onion in 2 tbsp. of the butter until the veggies are softened and lightly browned. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and add the broccoli. Simmer the veggies for 10 minutes or until the broccoli is tender. Season with thyme. Stir in half-and-half and the remaining 3 tbsp. of butter. Remove the pot from the heat. In a bowl, combine the mashed potatoes with the milk. Add the milk-potato mixture to the pot and stir gently. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake in a pre-heated oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until the cheese is lightly browned.

Combine biscuit mix, water in a large bowl. Mix together hamburger, onion, cream of mushroom and onion soup mix in a large skillet or dutch oven over medium heat. Stir in biscuit mixture. Add sliced mushrooms. Bake in a 9x13 casserole dish for 30 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.

Beat cream cheese, sugar and cocoa. Beat in the milk and vanilla until smooth. Fold in the whipped topping. Spoon into the crust. Cover and freeze for 20 minutes. Garnish with additional whipped topping if desired.

In a bowl, toss the potatoes with the picante sauce. Add the lime juice and olive oil and toss to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside until ready to serve. In a small bowl combine the tomato and olives with the green onions. Spoon half the potato mixture into a serving bowl. Add the tomato and olives mixture. Spoon the remaining potato mixture over the top and garnish with the cilantro.
Combine all ingredients in blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Serve with pita bread or with raw or cooked veggies.

Warm the ghee in a pan and add rava, keep stirring. When the rava is light brown in colour add the sugar, then add the milk, keep stirring until the rava is cooked and the mixture thickens. Switch off the flame, add the green cardamoms, saffron strands and coconut flakes. When cool enough to handle knead into ladoos. Serve chilled.

In a large pot over medium-high heat add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the shallot and saute until it becomes translucent about 4 minutes. Add the chicken breast halves and saute on all sides until they are browned on the outside but not cooked through about 15 minutes. Pour in the chicken broth. Cover the pot tightly with a lid or foil. Braise in the oven for 1 hour. Add the wine and the tarragon. Cook for 15 minutes longer. Check to make sure the meat is cooked through. Taste for seasoning. Serve the braised chicken over the potatoes with a few springs of parsley.

In a large dutch oven saute sausage until brown. Add rice and water. Stir. Add stock. Add tomatoes. Mix well. Sprinkle with chili powder and garlic powder and salt to taste. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serves 10-12.

Place pears in baking dish. Drizzle with lemon juice, sprinkle with black pepper. Toss with arugula. Add enough hazelnut oil to coat. Divide among 4 plates. Top each plate with a 1/4-inch slice of blue cheese. Scatter each plate with a handful of nuts.

Soak the apricots in water for about an hour. Drain and dry apricots with paper towels. Put the apricots in the saucepan and cover them with cold water. Bring to boil and cook for 5-8 minutes. Add the sugar and the almonds. Cook until the syrup thickens. If you like the compote more watery, you can add more cold water. The flavor of the almonds will infuse into the water. Remove the compote from heat and add almond extract. Transfer the compote in an earthenware pot. You can serve the kayisi kompostosu hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease and flour two loaf pans or line with paper baking cups. Beat cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, pudding and water in large bowl with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. Stir in poppy seed. Spoon batter in prepared pans. Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of loaves comes out clean. Cool in pans on wire racks 10 minutesremove from pans. Cool completely on wire racks. Store loaves in tightly covered containers.

Melt the butter in a pan with the flour. Stir until a smooth paste forms. Add the stock. Bring to a boil, stirring until thickened. Stir in the vinegar, dill and sugar. Stir in the egg yolk to thicken to desired consistency. Season with salt and serve at once. Serves 4-6 people.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix together stuffing mix, ground beef, eggs, onion and seasoningsshape into 16 small balls. Bake for about 20 minutes or until browned. Meanwhile, combine cranberries, chili sauce and sugar. Pour into a large bowlset aside. Combine ginger, salt and peppersprinkle over meatballs. Bake for about 20 minutes longer or until thoroughly heated through. Transfer meatballs to a serving dish and spoon cranberry sauce over them. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake bacon in shallow dish until crisp. Drain on paper towelscool. Cut each croissant horizontally into 4 triangles. Spread each croissant with mayonnaise. Place 2 slices of bacon on bottom of each. Arrange lettuce and 1 tomato slice on each. Season with salt and black pepper. Bake until cheese is melted. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

Soften cream cheese. Blend in salad dressing. Add seafood cocktail sauce and cheddar cheese. Spread in a shallow serving dish. Layer with imitation crabmeat, shrimp and vegetables. Sprinkle with additional cheese. Refrigerate. Serve with crackers.

Place cucumbers in a colander and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of the salt. Toss to combine. Let stand for 15 minutes. Drain well and return to the colander. Add the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and toss to combine. Sprinkle with pepper and let stand for 10 minutes. Whisk the vinegar and oil together in a small bowl. Add the onions and toss to combine. Add the cucumbers and toss to combine. Add the radishes and toss to combine. Toss in the pepper.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute the onions until they are lightly browned. Add the green beans and saute for a few minutes. Add the carrots and continue to saute until the vegetables are soft. Add the vegetable stock, almond milk, herbs and salt. Simmer for a few minutes until the vegetables are very soft. Serve with fresh parsley.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch slices. Layer half of potato slices on bottom of slow cooker. Layer half of the onions over potatoes. Place half the apples over the onions. Sprinkle half of the spices over the apples. Place half of the brisket over the spices. Repeat layers once. Pour cider over the mixture. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with cabbage.

Peel the onion and grate it finely. Add the flour, the mint leaves, 2 tablespoons of the oil, salt and pepper. Beat thoroughly. Add 2 tablespoons of water. Beat again. Add enough water to make a soft batter. Heat the remaining oil in a saucepan. With a tablespoon, drop the batter into the hot oil. Fry the fritters until golden brown. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Roll out dough. Place one-third of the dough in a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Combine the cream cheese, tomatoes, bell pepper, green onions, and baconspread over the dough. Roll up the remaining dough. Cut 2-in. slices. Place on top of the filling in the pan. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

In a bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until very light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition and then add the flour and spices and mix well. Divide the mixture in half and roll into two balls of equal size. Wrap each one in cling film and place in the freezer for 2 hours or overnight. When ready to bake place the balls of dough back on the work surface and roll each one out into a circle about 6mm thick and 18cm diameter. Place the circles of dough into two greased and base lined 9 inch loose-bottomed cake tins and bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until the edges are golden and the base of the cake is just beginning to turn golden. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly. Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a saucepan combine the orange juice and zest, gingerroot and the dried and fresh cranberries and simmer for about 10 minutes until thick and syrupy. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Remove the c

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season chicken with salt and pepper. In a large non stick skillet heat canola oil over medium heat. Add chicken. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. Remove from skillet. Add the rest of the vegetables to skillet. Cook over medium heat until vegetables are crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in tomatoes and juice. Add the chicken back in with the vegetables. Stir to combine. Divide filling equally onto 4 large tortillas. Top each with 2 tablespoons of cheese. Roll up tortillas. Place the filled tortillas in a greased 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Soak the navy beans overnight. Drain and place the beans in a heavy saucepan with a quart of cold water and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Cook the beans until they are tender, about 1 hour. Strain the beans and place them in a large bowl. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 2 minutes. Stir in the bay leaf and thyme and sauté for 1 minute. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add the beans and the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt. Simmer the mixture for 10 minutes.

Mix apricots and cranberries in a medium bowl. Add zest and mix well. Shape mixture into small balls and place on wax paper. Melt chocolate in double boiler. Dip balls in chocolate and place on wax paper. Makes about 2 dozen balls.

In a large skillet heat olive oil and saute onions and garlic until onions are tender. Add ground coriander and red pepper flakes and saute 1 minute longer. Add tomato sauce and cook until slightly thickened. Add chicken and cook 1 minute longer. Serve with rice and sprinkle with chopped fresh coriander.

Preheat oven to 190C/375F/gas 5. Halve leeks lengthways and clean thoroughly with paper towel to remove any dirt. Trim off any tough green leaves, then slice thinly lengthways and wash thoroughly again to remove any residual sand and grit. Melt butter in an 18cm/7in saute pan over medium-low heat. Add leeks, cover with lid and cook for 5 minutes until just softened. Increase heat to medium, add potatoes and cook, stirring regularly, for about 5 minutes until lightly browned but not coloured. Pour over stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover pan with lid and cook for about 10 minutes until tender and the stock has reduced slightly. Transfer to food processor or blender (in batches) and blend until very smooth (or use an immersion blender to blend it directly in the pan). Return to pan and reheat gently. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add double cream to pan and stir until heated through but not boiling. Gently stir in chives.

Brown the meat with the onions. Add the bell peppers, jalapenos. Add the chopped tomatoes and tomato paste. Cook down for about 10 min. Add the beef broth. Add the steamed rice. Add the onion soup mix. Cook for about 15 minutes.

Soak gelatin in cold water. Let stand until softened. Squeeze excess water from gelatin. Measure gelatin into a large bowl. Pour in enough boiling water to dissolve gelatin. Let cool slightly. Add orange juice, sugar and lemon juice. Mix well. Refrigerate until partially set. Whip cream until it just holds its shape. Fold into gelatin mixture. Spoon into 9 inch pie plate. Chill for at least 4 hours or until set. Garnish with fresh oranges.

Melt butter in a small pan over low heat. Stir in chili powder, onion powder, and garlic powder until well blended. Remove from heat. Stir in salt and lemon pepper until well blended. Pour over popped popcorn. Toss until well blended.

Mix together the dry ingredients and add to the other ingredients and mix well. Roll into balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand on cookie sheet for a few minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes approximately 2-1/2 dozen cookies.

Combine the cornstarch with 1 tablespoon of cold water in a small bowlstir well to dissolve and set aside. Combine the apple juice, vinegar, brown sugar and orange zest in a medium bowlstir well. Add the kielbasa and marinade in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours. Heat the grill to medium-high. Thread the peppers and onions alternately on the skewers with the kielbasa. Brush the vegetables with the cornstarch mixturebrush the kielbasa with the marinade mixturediscard the excess marinade. Grill for 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the kielbasa is browned and cooked through, turning frequently and basting with the cornstarch mixture and the marinade as needed. Serve hot with the pineapple chunks on the side.

Prepare pie shell as directed on package. Beat 2 cups of the milk with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon vanillaset aside. In a large bowl, combine remaining 2 cups milk with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. In a separate bowl, combine the pudding mix with 3 tablespoons of the vanilla protein powder. Stir into 2 cups of milk mixture. Spread evenly over bottom of pie shell. Arrange banana slices evenly over pudding mixture. Spoon remaining 1 1/2 cups of milk mixture evenly over bananas. Top with remaining 1/4 teaspoon vanilla protein powder and cool whip. Refrigerate.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water until fork-tender. Drain well and return them to the pot over low heat. Add the butter, garlic, and parsleycook until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the cream, bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the sauce thickens, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and mash the mixture with a potato masher until it forms a smooth sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Saute mushrooms, garlic and butter about 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, white wine and cracker crumbs, stirring constantly until dry. Pour mixture into mushroom caps and sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Bake uncovered about 15 minutes or until tender and golden.

In a bowl, mix together cream cheese, shredded cheddar and bacon. Stuff each pepper half with cream cheese mixture and sprinkle with bacon. Wrap each pepper half with a slice of turkey bacon. Grill until bacon is crisp. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Place squash in a baking dish with 1 inch of water in bottom of dish. Cover with lid or foil, and bake until tender, about 20 minutes.In a large pot, combine squash and peas with water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until squash and peas are tender, about 30 minutes.Drain mixture in a colander. Return mixture to pot and add brown rice and oil. Add garlic, bell peppers and onions and toss to blend. Season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with hot sauce. Serve warm.
Place all ingredients in blender and blend until smooth. Refrigerate for about 2 hours before serving with warm tortilla chips or vegetables. Makes about 2 cups.

Season both sides of each chicken piece with salt and pepper. Melt butter in 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook until brown and tender. Remove chicken from skillet and keep warm. Stir sherry and lemon rind into the skillet drippings in the pan. Cook over medium heat until liquid is reduced. Add lemon juice and heavy cream. Cook and stir until thickened. Place a small amount of sauce on each serving of chicken. Top each serving with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Put the unthawed raspberries into a saucepan and add sugar. Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until all the sugar ahs dissolved. Using a potato masher, mash the raspberries and syrup thoroughly. Pour the mixture through a strainer, extract all the juice. Squeeze two of the lemons and strain the juice, add it to the raspberry juice. Add the boiling water to the raspberry juice. Allow the cordial to cool, then chill it in the refrigerator. Serve cordial with a thin slice of lemon in each glass.

Combine all ingredients in a saucepan, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until beans are tender, 1 hour. If you want the hot dogs crunchy, cut them up into small pieces before adding them to the soup.

Put nuts in a single layer on wax paper. Set aside. Melt brown sugar and butter in saucepan. Boil for one minute. Remove from heat, quickly stir in nuts, spreading nuts evenly over the pan. Let cool completely. Melt chocolate chips over low heat. Spread chocolate over nuts. Refrigerate until firm. Break into pieces.

In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium high heat. Add the onion and celery rib and cook for 5 minutes until the vegetables are soft and translucent. Stir in the garlic and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, broth and paprika and cook until thickened about 15 minutes. Season with the cayenne and rosemary and marjoram to taste and simmer 5 minutes more. Ladle the soup into bowls and serve with sour cream and a sprinkle of paprika and parsley.

Melt butter over medium heat. Add Westphalian ham and cook until crisp. Add tortellini. Toss until heated through. Add heavy cream. Bring to a boil. Add peas. Serve garnished with chives and sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.

Remove one pie crust from package and place into a springform pan. Peel and core apples and slice into thin rings. Place in pan and sprinkle with brown sugar and a pinch of salt and set aside. Unroll remaining puff pastry into a rectangle and roll out with a rolling pin until thin and even. Lay over top of pie crust and remove any excess dough. Trim edges if needed and seal edges with water or egg wash. Bake at 350 for about 40 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Whisk caramel topping and heavy whipping cream together in a small bowl and drizzle over tart. Top with whipped cream and powdered sugar. Serve with vanilla ice cream on the side.

Toast 2 slices of the bread. Spread 1 slice with mayonnaise and place the chicken and bacon strips in the centre of the slice. Top with lettuce and then with the other slice of the bread with the remaining mayo spread on it. Stick the sticks into the top and bottom slices to hold it all together. Cut the sandwich into triangles.

In small saucepan combine sugar and butter. Cook over low heat until butter is melted. Remove from heat. Add eggnog, vanilla, and rum extracts. Cool. In large mixing bowl combine the sugar-butter mixture, eggs, baking powder, salt, flour, and nutmeg. Beat for 2 minutes on low speed until smooth. Pour into two greased 9x5x3 loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until done. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Wrap and store at room temperature up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to one month.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add green curry paste and cook for 1 minute. Whisk in coconut milk and bring to a simmer, stirring constantly to prevent scorching. Add brown sugar and fish sauce and cook until reduced by half and thickened, 10-15 minutes. Add lime juice and red bell pepper and simmer for 3 minutes more. Add mushrooms and simmer until cooked through, 3 minutes more. Stir in basil and serve over jasmine rice. Serves 4.

In a bowl beat eggs with milk. Season with salt and black pepper. In a skillet over medium heat melt butter. Pour in the egg mixture. Cook without stirring until the edges begin to set. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with dill. Spread each round with a layer of smoked salmon. Top each round with an egg. Garnish with dill and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the first five ingredients. Press into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Pour the sweetened condensed milk evenly over the base. Sprinkle the remaining ingredients. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Cool and cut into squares.

Place club crackers in single layer in greased 13x9x2 inch pan. In medium saucepan over low heat, melt margarine and sugar, stirring constantly. Remove from heatstir in milk and vanilla. Spoon mixture over crackers, spreading evenly. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and crunchy peanut butter. Press in gently. Cool completelycut in squares. Store in airtight container at room temp for up to 2 days.
Place all the ingredients into the crockpot. Cook for 4 to 6 hours on low or 2-3 hours on high. When done serve with mashed potatos.

Cut cantaloupe into bite size pieces. Add to a large bowl. Toss together cantaloupe and spinach. In a small bowl mix the vinaigrette together until smooth. Drizzle dressing over the cantaloupe mixture and toss to coat well. Sprinkle pistachios on top. Can also add feta cheese or gorgonzola cheese. I make this for a potluck with ham and it is delicious!

Combine the first five ingredients in a large bowl. Mix together well. Add sour cream, cream and eggs and beat until smooth. Fold in the potatoes and spices. Pour into a greased 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven until set, about 1 hour. Serves 6-8.

Mix together the first five ingredients in a large bowlset aside for a minute or two. Add the remaining ingredients, beat until smooth. Heat a heavy skillet or griddle over medium heat. Grease with a little canola oil to coat surface. Pour about 1/4 cup batter onto heated griddle for each pancake. Cook until the edges are dry and bubbles appear on surface of the batterturn and cook until brown on the other side. Serve with honey or maple syrup if desired.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until done. Add chicken and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until done. Place in slow cooker with ranch dressing. Sprinkle with cheese and cover with lid. Cook on low for 1 to 2 hours or until done. Drain ranch dressing and season with salt and pepper. Stir well to combine. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in same skillet and add the breadcrumbs and cook 1 to 2 minutes or until lightly browned and crisp. Serve on top of chicken and bacon mixture with rolls to serve with it.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Prick each baking potato with a fork. Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let cool until you are able to handle them. Scoop out the insides of the potatoes, leaving about 1/2-inch of the skin intact. Return the skins to the oven for about 10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned. Place the potato skins in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the chives and cook until the chives are just wilted, about 2 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine the sour cream and the cooked bacon. Season with pepper and mix well. Fill each of the potatoes with the sour cream mixture and sprinkle the potatoes with the cheese. Return the potatoes to the oven and cook for about 4 minutes or until the cheese has melted. Serve

Place pomegranates in a bowl with sugar and water. Set aside to macerate for at least two hours. Drain seeds through a sieve or colander lined with cheesecloth. Combine tapioca with 1 cup water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often until tapioca has dissolved and mixture is clear. Reduce heat to low and add sugar syrup, pomegranate seeds and cinnamon stick. Cook until mixture is thickened and translucent, stirring frequently to prevent mixture from sticking to bottom of pan. Remove from heat. Cool mixture slightly. Refrigerate until chilled. Serve with whipped cream and pomegranate seeds.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add bell peppers, onions, seasoning salt and pepper and stir-fry about 3 minutes until tender-crisp. Add hoisin sauce. Stir and cook until heated through. Add water to loosen if desired.

Preheat oven to 400F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Dip each piece of chicken into the honey mixture and then into the corn flake mixtureplace on baking sheet. Spray with nonstick cooking spraybake uncovered 10 minutes. Turnbake an additional 10 minutes or until done. Yields: 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Cut 1-inch cubes of russet potato and toss with 2 tablespoons butter. Spread evenly in a baking dish and season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Roast for 20 minutes. While potatoes roast, heat remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until tender and golden brown. Stir in parsley. Sprinkle cheese evenly over top of roasted potatoes. Spread onions evenly over top. Bake for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a large saute pan heat the oils over high heat. Add the onion and saute until soft. Add the garlic cloves and chili and saute for 30 seconds. Add the allspice and cinnamon and cook for 30 seconds. Add the lime juice and the sugar. Allow the mixture to cook down for a minute or 2. Serve this baste with chicken or fish.

Mix Crisco and molasses in large mixing bowl. Add sugar and mix well. Combine dry ingredients and add to mixture. Stir well and chill 2 hours or overnight. Roll dough into 1-inch balls and roll in granulated sugar or roll in a mixture of 3 cups sugar and 1/2 cup cornmeal. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes.

In a heavy saucepan over medium-high heat, cook bacon until crisp. With a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate. In a large pot with a tight-fitting lid, bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. Add onion and cook until softened. Stir in beer. Add bacon and clams. Covercook 5-7 minutes or until clams open. Transfer to a serving platterdrizzle with reserved bacon fat.

Soften the cream cheese in a microwave or over a pot of boiling water. Cream together the softened cheese with the peppers. Add the crab meat, cheese and peppers. In a small bowl whisk together the rest of the ingredients until smooth. Add to the mixture. Pour into a casserole dish. Sprinkle the parsley on top. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with crusty bread.

Follow the directions on the box for making regular Jello. Add a shot glass full of red bull energy drink to the Jello mixture before pouring it into the shot glasses. Chill for a few hours till firm. Enjoy!

Beat together milk and eggs. Add flour and beat to make a thin batter. Warm a skillet over medium heat. Add a small pat of butter or a few drops of vegetable oil. With a 1/4 cup measuring cup, pour about 1/4 cup of the batter in the center of the skillet. Quickly swirl the batter around with a rubber spatula to make a thin circle. Cook until the edges look dry. Turn with a spatula. When the second side is cooked and dry, slide the crepe onto a plate. Repeat with remaining batter. Stack the crepes. Combine the spinach with the milk and butter and heat through. Drain the mixture through a wire strainer and pat with a paper towel to remove excess moisture. Lay the crepe flat and spoon the cooked spinach in the center. Top with shredded mozzarella. Roll the crepe around the mozzarella. Dot the top with butter. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with shredded parmesan and serve.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Beat butter at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add sugar, vanilla extract, and eggbeat well. Stir in cream cheese and cake mixbeat well. Refrigerate dough for 2 hours or until easy to handle. Lightly grease 1 baking sheet or line with parchment paper. Roll dough into 1-inch ballsplace 1-inch apart on prepared pan. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool for 2 minutesremove from pan to wire racks. Roll in powdered sugar.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet and saute onion and garlic until tender. Stir in pimiento and parsley and cook for l minute. Add 1 cup of chicken broth and potato cubes. Bring to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine 6 cups bread cubes with the cheddar cheese in a large bowl. In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the bread and cheese mixture. Stir gently to combine. Spoon the mixture into a buttered 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Top with the remaining 2 cups bread cubes. Bake for 45 minutes or until the casserole is golden brown. Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large nonstick skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Stir the cooked bacon into the casserole just before serving.
Line bottom of 9x13 pan with crackers, pour mixture over crackers, layer with remaining crackers and pour mixture again over crackers. Spread frosting on top and let sit in fridge overnight.

Beat eggs and milk together in a bowl. Add spices and beat until well blended. Place sliced bread in bowl and let soak for 5 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets or line with parchment paper. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and gingerbread crumbs. Spread evenly over baking sheets. Bake for 5 minutes in preheated oven. Spray a skillet with cooking spray and place bread slices in pan. Cook over medium heat until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Drizzle with syrup and sprinkle with crumbs and gingerbread.

Prepare skewers and marinate dove breasts in teriyaki sauce for at least 2 hours. Drain, discarding marinade. Thread dove and vegetables onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for about 20 minutes until cooked through. Serve over rice.
Dredge pork chops in mixture of flour, salt, and garlic powder. Brown in oil in large skillet. Place browned pork chops in crockpot. Add can of soup. Cover and cook on low 6 to 8 hours.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat with oil and cook the onions until they are caramelized and brown and the pan is filled with a brown liquid. Set aside and allow the pan to cool slightly before adding the beef. Season the beef with the steak seasoning and sear it for a few minutes each side and set it aside with the caramelized onions in a warm place. Place the rolls in the skillet and top with the beef, the onions and the cheese and let it melt for a few minutes and serve with your favorite sides.

Heat oil in large skillet. Cook onion and red bell pepper until tender. Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in mushrooms and cook until tender. Stir in rice. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in water and Cajun seasoning. Cook until tender. Stir in pecans. Cook 1 minute longer or until heated through. Stir in parsley.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the courgettes and cook until golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the tagliatelle. Cook the tagliatelle according to the package instructions, stirring occasionally. Drain the pasta well and toss with the courgettes. Serve sprinkled with the cheese.

Combine flour, baking powder, salt, nutmeg, and milk in large bowl. Beat at medium speed of electric mixer until smooth. Beat in egg. Heat oil in deep fryer or large saucepan until hot. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Remove with slotted spoon. Drain on paper towels. Roll in cinnamon-sugar. Makes about 3 dozen.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water for 15-20 minutes until tender. Drain and let cool slightly. Peel the skins off the red onions. Slice the onions and mix into the potatoes. Peel the eggs and cut them into quarters. Add the parsley leaves. Add the dressing. Toss gently. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Spray a grill pan or skillet with cooking spray. Butter 4 slices of bread on both sides. Place on pan and toast for about 1 minute. Turn off heat and spread swiss cheese on each slice of bread. Spread cream cheese on top and bottom of each sandwich and close the sandwich together. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add 4 slices of bread to pan and cook until lightly toasted on each side and until cheeses are melted. Serve while hot and enjoy.

In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the chicken. Pour mixture into a 13 by 9 inch baking dish. Top with the chicken pieces. Sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. Bake 45 minutes. Serve over hot cooked spaghetti noodles. Top with parsley.

Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Brown ground round in oil. Season with salt and pepper. Drain excess grease. Stir in sauce. Reduce heat to low. Add elbow macaroni and mix well. Divide between 2 lightly sprayed 10-in. pie plates. Sprinkle each pie plate evenly with 1 cup of the cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over low heat. Add the garlic and cayenne peppercook until the garlic is golden and fragrant. Mix in the cream cheese and stir until blended. Add the milk gradually and mix well with a spatula. Add the parmesan and pepper to taste. Heat over medium heat, stirring until smooth. Serve hot with baked chicken, broccoli, or a baguette. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray muffin cups with baking spray. In a large bowl cream together butter and sugar until light and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time. In a separate bowl combine buttermilk, vanilla and baking soda. Mix well. Add buttermilk mixture to butter mixture. Beat until combined. Add bananas and beat until incorporated. In another bowl combine baking soda with all-purpose flour. Stir into batter mixture. Mix well. Gently fold in blueberries. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until tops of muffins spring back when lightly touched. Serve warm or cooled.

Boil potatoes in a large pot of water until tender. Drain and let cool. Peel and slice. Whisk together the oil and the vinegar. Add the dill and the potatoes and toss to coat. Season with the salt and the pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Season pork loin with salt. Combine olive oil, garlic, thyme and basil in small bowl. Rub evenly over loin. Roast 20-25 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 155 degrees. Remove from oven and let stand 5-10 minutes before slicing.

In a small bowl, combine the olive oil and leek and saute over medium heat until softened. Add the butternut squash and continue to saute until tender. Remove from heat and set aside until needed. In another small bowl combine the beans, rotel, and herbes de provence and mix well. Place the butternut squash and beans in the slow cooker and mix well. Add the mozzarella and bacon and mix well to combine. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 180c. Beat the butter and the sugar until light and creamy. Add the eggs and beat well, then add the custard powder and the vanilla. Sift in the flour and mix until combined. Add the chocolate and stir until combined and well blended. Cover and refrigerate for a couple of hours. When ready to cook, place teaspoonfuls of mixture onto a tray lined with baking paper. Press with the back of a wet fork to make an indent in the middle of each cookie. Bake for about 20 minutes or until the edges start to turn golden. Allow to cool on the baking tray for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Prepare pie shells and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring dark brown sugar and water to a boil. Cook and stir for about 3 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. In a medium bowl, combine sugar and flourstir in cooled syrup. Add eggs and beat well. Gradually stir in milk. Pour into prepared shells. Bake at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until set. Cool on racks. Makes 2 pies.

In a medium bowl, whisk together dressing ingredients. Add baby spinach and strawberries and toss gently. Arrange spinach mixture evenly over a platter or individual salad plates. Sprinkle feta cheese and onions evenly over the top. Sprinkle candied pecans around the edges.

Cut the top off of the hot dog buns. In a small bowl, combine the butter, garlic salt and parmesan cheese. Spread the butter mixture on the cut sides of the top of the hot dog buns. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Bake at 350 for 5 minutes. Let cool. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium bowl, combine the onions and the garlic. Add the water and stir well. Pour the water mixture into a slow cooker. Add the barbecue sauce and mix well. Place the pork roast in the center of the slow cooker. Sprinkle the top of the roast with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for about 8 to 9 hours or until the meat is very tender and can be pulled apart easily. Remove the pork from the slow cooker and shred with two forks. Add the shredded pork back to the sauce. Stir in the onions. Serve on hot dog rolls.

Cream together the butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time beating after each addition. Add the flour alternately with the milk. Beat in the vanilla extract. Pour into a greased and floured tube pan or bundt pan. Bake for 1 hour or until the top is golden brown and the cake is firm to the touch in the center. Allow the cake to cool completely in the pan for at least 2 hours before turning out on to a wire rack to cool completely.

Melt 2 tbsp. Butter in saucepan over low heat. Stir in cornstarch until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and mix until smooth. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Serve with fruit, cakes, meringues or shortbread cookies for dipping.

Place cabbage in a bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside for 10 minutes. Drain, then rinse with cold water. Drain again. Add apple juice, salt and set aside for 1 hour. Combine the apples with the remaining ingredients and mix well. Add the apples to the cabbage and mix well. Cover and chill. Serve with dressing.

Cut the turnips into small cubes and place them in a pot of boiling salted water. Cook for about 12 minutes, or until they are soft. Remove and set aside. Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat and saute onions until they are golden brown. Add the thyme and cook for one minute. Add the cooked turnips and stir well. Stir in the milk and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes more, until the mixture is thick and smooth. Serve warm over crusty french bread or on a bed of lettuce. Serves 4-6.

Combine cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and pumpkin puree in a large bowl. Add pineapple preserves, allspice, and nutmeg. Stir until well blended. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or until firm. Remove from refrigerator and roll into a ballrefrigerate again until ready to use. Roll the top half of the ball in nutsplace a pretzel stick across the top of the ball for the stem and serve with crackers.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut off and discard any tough outer fronds from the fennel bulbs. Trim off and discard any tough bottoms from the bulbs. Slice each bulb lengthwise in half. Cut each half into 1/2 inch thick wedges. Heat a large saucepan over medium heat until hot. Add the butter and melt. Add the fennel and saute for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Stir in the thyme and saute for 1 minute longer. Add 1/2 cup of the stock and bring to a boil. Cover tightly and transfer to the oven. Braise for 15 minutes. Uncover and braise for an additional 5 minutes. Add remaining stock to pan and bring to a boil. Cover tightly and braise for an additional 10 minutes. Uncover and stir in the garlic. Braise for 2 minutes longer. Check seasoning and adjust to taste. Serve immediately.

Bake potatoes at 400F about 1 hour or until done. Cool slightlypeel. Peel the eggs and chop finelychop the onion finely. Crumble the gherkins (optional). In a large bowl, combine the dressing and all other ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight. This is a good salad for picnics or cookouts because it can be made ahead of time. Serves about 10.

Beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper together until blended. Heat a small amount of butter or margarine or oil in a frying pan or skillet. Pour a thin layer of egg mixture onto the bottom of the frying pan or skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the bottom is firm enough to turn over. Turn the egg mixture over to finish cooking on the other side. Serve immediately or allow to cool and store in refrigerator for up to 24 hours. Reheat by recooking over low heat or microwaving for a few minutes at a time.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Add pork chops to the bowl and marinate at room temperature for 10 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1/3 of the pork chops to the skilletcook 3 minutes on each side. Remove the pork from the skillet. Add the remaining 2/3 of the pork to the skilletcook 3 minutes on each side. Add the remaining 1/3 of the pork to the skilletcook 3 minutes on each side. Drain the juice from the skillet. Combine the juice and the wine in a small bowlstir well. Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir in the pork and the juice mixtureheat through. Sprinkle with the five-spice powder. Cooking Tip: If desired, add 1/4 cup of frozen peas to the skillet with the remaining 2/3 of the pork. Cook for 2 minutes.

Peel the parsnip. Cut lengthwise into thin strips 1/4-inch wide or a little less. Heat oil to 250-degrees. Add a few strips at a time to the oil. The crisps should float to the surface as soon as they are added. Cook for 2 minutes or so until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and season with salt.

Beat cottage cheese with electric mixer until it is soft and fluffy. Add powdered milk and beat again until well blended. Add remaining ingredients and blend well. Pour mixture into a 8 x 8 baking pan (sprinkle with sugar before pouring the batter). Bake for 45-50 minutes or until firm. Allow to cool, then chill for several hours before serving.

In a large bowl combine the ricotta cheese, mini semisweet chocolate chips and whipping cream. Beat until smooth. Fold in the chopped maraschino cherries and pecans. Spoon mixture into 10 cannoli shells. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Toast the cinnamon stick. Place it into a saucepan along with the dried cranberries. Pour in enough water to cover them. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. Pour into a sieve to drain. Add the remaining ingredients and return to medium heat. Simmer until thickened.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Sift together 1 cup cornmeal, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 1/4 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Combine 3/4 cup buttermilk and 1/2 cup margarine until creamy. Beat in 2 eggs until well mixed. Add the dry ingredients all at once to the wet ingredients, and stir just until blended. Spoon into greased muffin cups to fill three-fourths full. Top each with a tablespoon of jam, then with another spoonful of batter. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely on wire racks.
Cool 30 minutes. Drop mixture by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper or waxed side of foil to form 36 cookies. Chill until firm. Store in air tight container.

Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper. Place in a lightly greased 2 qt crock pot. Top with half the sauerkraut. Layer with the rest of the kraut and the cheese. Pour the dressing over all. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. Slice the chicken and serve on the pumpernickel rolls.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and cook until tender. Add kielbasa, black-eyed peas, navy beans and brown rice. Stir until evenly combined. Add chicken stock, garlic powder, thyme and cayenne. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in parsley.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine pastry crust with the egg yolks, add milk. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into pastry crust mixture. Add the pumpkin, spices and sugar. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 300f. Bake until center is set (20-30 minutes). Cool and serve.

Heat butter in a large skillet. Add onion and cook until tender. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Stir in tomatoes and lemon juice. Cook until tomatoes are heated through. Stir in parmesan cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Toss in pasta. Serve.

Sautee onion in butter or margarine until translucent. Add tomatoes and water. Bring to boil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 20 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Drain and add breadcrumbs. Mix well and enjoy.

Mix all ingredients together with fork or pastry cutter till crumbly. Add more water if needed to form a soft pliable dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface for 1 minute or so, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Makes 2 dozen 5 inch pierogi. To form the dumpling, roll out one piece of dough to about 1/8 inch thickness and use a cookie cutter or drinking glass to cut circles out of it. Place about 1 tbsp of filling in the center of each circle. Fold the dough over to form a half circle, press edges together with your fingers to seal. Place on a lightly oiled baking sheet and repeat with remaining pieces of dough and filling. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil, cook the pierogi till they float, about 2-3 minutes. Serve hot with sour cream or plain yogurt, melted butter or butter and onion sauce.

Beat the milk and cream cheese together until smooth. Whisk the eggs into the cream cheese mixture. Add the chives. Heat 1 tsp oil in a non-stick pan. Pour egg mixture into the pan and cook for 3 minutes or until set. Turn over and cook for 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Peel apples. Mix together butter, sugar, flour and spices. Divide mixture in half and place in a bag or bowl. Add one apple at a time to the bag or bowl and shake until covered. Place in a greased baking dish with the other half of the mixture. Pour milk into a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour until smooth. Bring to a boil and boil for one minute. Pour over the apples and sprinkle with more cinnamon if desired. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Serve hot.

Combine water, lemon juice, cornstarch, and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until thickened. Add soymilk and margarine. Remove from heat. Allow to cool to room temperature. Pour into an airtight jar, cover, and place in the fridge. Store for up to two weeks.

Cut the pineapple into 1/2 inch cubes. Cut the mango into 1/2 inch cubes. Slice the red bell pepper. Chop the cucumber. Cut the jalapeño. Stir the lime juice with the jalapeño. Add the remaining ingredients. Season to taste. Cook the scallops for 1 minute per side. Serve the scallops with the salsa.

Mix butter, cocoa, and sugar together. Add 4 eggs one at a time beating after each addition. Sift together 4 cups of flour and 1 teaspoon of baking powder. Add to batter mixture and beat until mixed. Spread batter into a 9 x 13 greased baking dish. Bake at 325 degrees for 25-30 minutes until set. Cool before cutting into squares.

Cut each pork steak in half lengthwise. Lay out the pieces in a large glass baking dish and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with the paprika and sage. Sprinkle with the garlic. Drizzle the vinegar over the top. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from the refrigerator about half an hour before grilling. Season the steaks with the salt and pepper. Heat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the pork for about 5 minutes per side.

Bring water to a boil, add chicken-flavored ramen noodlesboil according to package directions. Add vegetables, cook for 2 minutes longer. Stir in eggsheat until thoroughly cooked. Add seasoning packet from the noodles. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease 12-cup muffin tin or 12x7 inch glass baking dish. Combine muffin mix with water according to package directionslet cool completely. Meanwhile, combine refried beans with diced green chiliesset aside. Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl, beat the eggs until well blendedstir in the cilantro and half the mexican blend cheese. Place 1 1/2 teaspoons of the refried beans mixture in the bottom of each muffin cup or the bottom of the baking dishtop each with 1 tablespoon of the egg mixture and 1 1/2 teaspoons of the beans mixture. Continue layering the muffin cups or baking dish until all the egg mixture is used. Pour enchilada sauce evenly over the topsprinkle with the remaining mexican blend cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the m

Peel garlic bulbs and reserve the skins in a bowl of water. Place the skins in a medium saucepan with enough water to cover them. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to medium low and simmer gently for about 1 hour or until the skins are very tender when pierced with a knife. Drain the skins and squeeze out the pulp over a bowl. Reserve the pulp for use in the puree. Reserve the oil for use in the roasted garlic oil.

Slice chicken breast into thin strips. Dice cabbage. Mix together mayonnaise, salt and pepperset aside. Scoop a little of the coleslaw mix onto each tortilla, then add a little of the mayonnaise mix and top with the chicken strips. Roll up tortillas and enjoy!

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Set aside. Heat oils in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute 5 minutes. Add ginger, garlic and cilantro. Saute until aromatic. Add pasta, tahini and soy sauce. Stir well. Add 3 Tbsp. of water and continue stirring until well mixed. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with cilantro leaves. Serves 4.

Season fish generously with pepper. Sprinkle onions with lemon juice. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for 1-2 minutes or until onions begin to soften. Add sweet green pepper and continue cooking for another minute or until both vegetables are softened. Sprinkle fish with lemon juice and place in skillet. Cook for about 4 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily when pierced with a fork. Transfer fish to a serving platter and top with lemon juice vegetable mixture. Sprinkle fish with breadcrumbs, basil and drizzle with the oil.

Remove the peel from the lemons with a vegetable peeler. Slice each lemon into thin rounds and then slice each round in half again so you have two half-moons from each lemon. Place in a pan with 500ml of boiling water, 350g caster sugar, a few sprigs of fresh mint and 1-2 tsp bicarbonate of soda. Stir well until the sugar has dissolved then leave to cool for 5 minutes. Strain into a pitcher through a sieve, then stir in the juice of 1 1/2 lemons and 3/4l mineral water. Pour into glasses filled with ice cubes and serve immediately.

In large saucepan bring 4 cups of water to boil. Stir in chicken stock, salt and pepper. Add ravioli. Cook until tender 2-3 minutes. Stir in spinach. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with parmesan. Melt 1 teaspoon butter in small skillet. Stir in parsley. Spoon over ravioli. Serve with italian bread.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper and cook 2 minutes. Add sausage and cook 5 minutes. Add ketchup and cook 2 minutes longer. Add tomatoes and cook until mixture is thick. Stir in ziti and heat through. Place in a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes.

In a large skillet, brown the sausage in the olive oil. Add the tomato sauce, oregano, Chablis and mushrooms. Cover the skillet and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Serve over the pasta of your choice or with hot cooked rice.

In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, worcestershire sauce and water. Mix until the soy is dissolved. Place the sirloin in a zip-top bag. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the steak. Press out all the air from the bag. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat a large skillet over high heat. Remove the beef from the bag and place in the hot skillet. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from the pan and let rest. Whisk together the balsamic vinegar and the sugar in a small bowl. Spoon over the cooked beef. Serve.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and saute 5 minutes. Add carrot and celery and saute 10 minutes more. Stir in salmon and cook 3 minutes. Add barley and rice. Add chicken broth to cover and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 50 minutes. Stir in cilantro. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Place berries in a medium heavy-bottom saucepan. Add sugar and water. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally until berries break down and the liquid thickens, 5-10 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool, then puree berry mixture with a blender or food processor until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve into a bowl. Whisk in port and chipotle. Transfer sauce to a large bowl or platterchill until ready to serve. Garnish with mint or cilantro leaves before serving.

Place butter or margarine, sugar and syrup in heavy medium saucepan. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Add the peanut butter and chocolate morsels and cook for 2 more minutes. Stir until blended and thickened. Remove from the heat and add the cereal, stirring until well coated. Immediately spread the mixture into an ungreased 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray and press down with a spoon or spatula until evenly distributed. Cool completely. Cut into squares and enjoy!

Sauté onions in butter until tender. Add the flour and stir. Add the milk and heavy whipping cream and cook until mixture is thick. Add dry sherry and seasoning to taste. Add the lobster meat. Garnish with chives. Serve.

Wash and rinse rice well. Drain off water. Heat butter in large saucepan. Add onion and celery and saute until softened. Add rice, orange rind, salt, orange juice and enough cold water to cover by 1 inch. Cook over medium heat until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender about 45 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add parsley just before serving.

Combine sauerkraut, water, sugar and caraway seed in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook about 20-30 minutes or until sauerkraut is tender and liquid is absorbed. In the meantime cook the apples and frankfurters together in a saucepan over medium heat until the apples are soft and the frankfurters are browned and cooked through. Serve the sauerkraut over the hot apples and frankfurters with the parsley sprinkled over all.

Combine balsamic vinegar, honey and 1 cup water in a small saucepot over medium heat. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes to reduce the liquid by half. Set aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the chicken in a large bowl and pour the reduced balsamic mixture over the chicken. Toss to coat and marinate for 30 minutes. Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the rosemary and toss to combine. Add the chicken and cook until the chicken is browned on all sides, about 6 minutes. Transfer to a baking dish. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar with the brown sugar and soy sauce. Add the mixture to the chicken and toss to combine. Bake in the preheated oven until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F, about 25 minutes. Transfer the

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the ham on a large baking sheet and sprinkle it with the brown sugar and the mustard. Bake the ham for 10 minutespour the orange juice into a small saucepan and bring it to a boilremove the ham from the oven and baste it with the orange juicereturn the ham to the oven and bake it for an additional 10 minutesrepeat the basting and baking procedure once moreremove the ham from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving it.
Toss together in a large salad bowl. Drizzle with dressing and serve.

Sift together whole wheat flour and unbleached all purpose flour. Add salt and baking soda and stir well. In a cup measure, combine skim milk and lemon juice and set aside. Cut in the shortening with a pastry blender or two knives until it resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the sugar. Stir in the skim milk mixture until a soft dough is formed. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide dough into two equal portions. Pat each portion into a round loaf about 1 inch thick and place on a greased and lightly floured baking sheet. Mark an x with a sharp knife on top of each loaf. Bake for about 1 hour or until the loaves are golden brown and sound hollow when tapped. Remove from the oven and place on wire racks until cool enough to handle. Slice and serve warm with butter and jam or preserves.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until they are fork tender. Drain them and return them to the pan. Mash them with the butter and onions. Stir in sour cream and orange juice. Stir in orange zest and season to taste with salt.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cream margarine and brown sugar together until creamy. Add eggs and beat until light and fluffy. Stir together flour, baking soda, cinnamon and cloves. Stir into creamed mixture. Stir in applesauce and mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes until light brown. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Heat a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion and brown sugar. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved and mixture begins to thicken, about 3 to 5 minutes. Add tequila and cook until liquid has evaporated. Place the pork in a baking dish and pour the sugar mixture evenly over the meat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and place in the oven for 3 hours. Turn the meat over halfway through cooking time. Cool for 30 minutes before shredding with 2 forks. Serve with warm tortillas and your favorite salsa.
Mix all ingredients together and pour into a greased and lightly floured tube pan. Bake at 325 for 1 hour.

Cook elbow macaroni according to package directions. While macaroni is cooking, mix together mayo and shrimp. Set aside. In a large bowl add macaroni, sweet pickles, onion, pickle juice, beef bouillon powder, season salt and garlic powder. Mix all ingredients together. Add shrimp and mayo mixture. Mix well. Chill until ready to serve.

Pound the meat flat with a mallet. Coat with the mayonnaise and Parmesan cheese and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lay the onions in the bottom of the pan and top with the meat. Sprinkle the top with the Lipton's Onion Soup Mix and cover with Pam and put in the oven at 375 for 45 minutes or until done. Serve with the juice spooned over the top.

Put a small amount of water in microwave safe mug. Heat for about 1 minute. Put butter in mug and microwave for 40 seconds. Stir in sugars and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Add egg yolk and beat until well mixed. Add flour and stir until well blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Place in microwave for about 1 minute or until firm. Remove from microwave and let cool. Store in refrigerator. Makes one cookie.

Place the cucumbers and onions together in a large glass bowl with the vinegar, sugar and 2 tablespoons of salt. Cover with cling wrap and refrigerate for 3 hours. Drain the vegetables and combine with mustard seeds, garlic powder, black pepper, and chili pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Arrange the tomatoes in a bowl and top with the marinated vegetables. Makes about 4 servings.

Mix together all the above ingredients except the chicken. Marinate the chicken for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 375F. Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade. Bake the chicken for 20 minutes or until done.
Mix together first 5 ingredients. Taste and add more hot sauce, salt, pepper as needed. Use to top steamed shrimp or crab or scallops or lobster or fish. Serve over rice or pasta.

In a skillet over medium heat, saut the onion in the peanut oil until soft and lightly browned. Add the cardamom and stir to combine with onions. Stir in the smooth peanut butter, brown sugar and soy sauce. Cook and stir until well blended and heated through. Stir in lemon juice and liquid red pepper seasoning. Thin to desired consistency with milk or water and serve over rice or chicken.

Prepare cake batter according to package directions. Add water and pumpkin. Mix well. Divide batter among 24 paper-lined muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full. Bake 18 to 21 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in centers comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes in panremove to wire racks. Cool completely. Frost with 2 tablespoons frosting for each cupcake. Store in an airtight container. Makes 24 cupcakes.

Place flour in a large bowl. Add the honey, oil and egg yolk and mix well with a wooden spoon or your hands. Knead the mixture briefly to form a soft dough. Add the milk and knead again until the dough is smooth but still slightly sticky. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least half an hour. Divide the dough into eight equal pieces. Press or roll each piece on a lightly floured surface to about 2 cm thickness. Brush with milk or beaten egg yolk if you want a more golden color. Bake on a lightly greased baking sheet at 225 C (450 F) for about twenty minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the crust sounds hollow when tapped.

In a large bowl combine chicken breast halves with vinegar, olive oil, garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper. Turn to coat well. Cover bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour or up to 3 hours. Heat broiler to high. Place chicken breast halves on a broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat for 8 to 9 minutes or until no longer pink. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine the salt and pepper, buttermilk, and instant potato flakes. Dip each snapper fillet into the buttermilk mixturedrain. Combine the melted butter and the garlic in a small bowl. Place the fish in a baking dish. Brush the fish with the melted butter mixture. Bake the fish in the preheated oven about 30 minutes or until done. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Season lamb fillets with salt and pepper. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add a little oil. Add lamb and cook until browned. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Heat remaining oil in skillet. Add onion and cook until softened. Add salt. Add pepper. Stir in beef broth and bring to a boil. Add split peas. Simmer for 4 minutes or until peas are tender.
