Stir in apricots and prunes. Serve with lamb.
Thaw green beans in a colander. Put olive oil, garlic, rosemary and salt in a skillet or stir-fry pan and mix. Add green beans. Stir-fry until beans are just softened. Serve immediately.

Cut each pod in half lengthwise and set aside. If there are any pods longer than 4 inches cut them in half crosswise and then lengthwise. Heat the olive oil in a 4-quart saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onions along with the salt and cook until they begin to turn golden, approximately 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the ginger and cook for 1 minute longer. Add the jalapeños. Bring the mixture to a boil. Decrease the heat to low and add the tomatoes and cardamom. Stir to combine. Cook, uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and taste and adjust the seasoning as desired. Serve immediately.

Dissolve the yeast into a cup of warm water. Add the flour and salt. Mix well. Add the yogurt and the egg. Mix and knead well until the dough is smooth and elastic. Let the dough rest for 15 minutes. In the meantime, prepare the soup. Put the yogurt into a large bowl and whisk lightly. Add the water, the mint and parsley. Mix well and serve chilled. Roll the dough into a ball and flatten it into a circle. Put it onto a baking sheet and bake it in a preheated 400° oven for 30 minutes. Turn the oven down to 350° and bake it for another 15 minutes. Brush the top of the bread with the melted butter and sprinkle with the onion. Serve the bread and the yogurt together.

This is a traditional Mexican dish. Beans are cooked along with the tomatoes. The tortillas are broken up into small pieces, the avocado is mashed and added, along with the cheese. The dish is served hot.

Roll pastry out and line a deep pie dish with it. Arrange the cranberries and the apple wedges over the base of the pastry, in concentric circles. Mix together the tapioca, water and orange zest and pour over the fruit. Bake at 180 degrees C for 30-40 minutes, until the fruit is tender and the juices have thickened. Serve with cream.

Pat chicken dry with paper towel. Season all over with salt and pepper. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, add the flour coated chicken to the pan. Cook until well browned on each side. Transfer to a plate. Add the wine to the skillet and cook until reduced by half. Add the sage leaves to the pan and cook for 1 minute. Add the broth and whisk until smooth. Stir in the mustard. Bring the sauce just to a simmer. Return the chicken to the pan. Reduce heat to low and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Stir in the butter until melted and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine sweet potatoes, orange juice and nutmeg. Beat with an electric mixer until well blended. Beat in egg whites until well mixed. Shape the mixture into 1-in. balls. In a shallow bowl combine the remaining 2 cups of sugar with the coconut. Roll the potato balls in the coconut mixture. Place on a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven and place on wax paper. Cool for 5 minutes. In a microwave-safe bowl combine the remaining 2 tablespoons of brown sugar and the butter. Microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes or until melted. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and the cinnamon. Drizzle over the potato balls and serve.

Melt the margarine in a 2-quart casserole dish. Stir in the sour cream and mayonnaise. Add the eggs and seasonings and beat well. Add the broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add the cheese. Spread the mixture evenly in the dish. Cover the dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add the ramen noodles and heat through. Sprinkle with paprika. Serves 6.

Peel and slice pears into thin wedges. Dice blue cheese into small pieces. Toss together with walnut halves and 1/2 of lettuce. Add 1 Tbsp. sugar, 1 Tbsp. raspberry vinegar, 1/2 tsp. salt and a few grinds of pepper. Toss together. Top with remaining lettuce. Drizzle with 1 Tbsp. oil and a few grinds of tabasco sauce.

Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add onions and saute over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes, bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add sliced olives, chopped spinach and parsley. Cook an additional 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook penne according to package directions. Drain and transfer to a serving bowl. Add spinach mixture and toss gently. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In heavy skillet over medium heat melt 2 tablespoons of butter. Add chopped mushrooms. Cook stirring for 5 minutes or until tender. Add remaining butter, garlic, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Cook and stir for 1 minute longer. Stir lemon juice and cream. Cook over low heat until sauce thickens stirring constantly. To assemble, place 1/2 cup sauce on each slice of toast. Sprinkle each with parsley. Serve immediately.

Mix together the flour, salt and black pepper in a small bowl. Dip the chicken piece in the flour mixture coating thoroughly and shake off the excess. Place the chicken in a plastic bag and refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, carefully add the coated chicken pieces to the skillet. Fry for 5 minutes on each side until golden brown and crisp. Remove the chicken from the pan with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine apricots and 2 tablespoons of water in a bowltoss to coat. Transfer to prepared baking sheet. Bake until apricots are tender when pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Let cool slightly. Coarsely chop apricots. Combine apricots and remaining 2 cups water in a medium saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcook until apricots are very soft and mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool completely. Stir in 1/2 cup of the sugar and lemon juice in a blenderpuree until smooth. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup of sugar and almond extract in a bowl until well blendedcover and chill until ready to serve. Freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturers directions.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine oatmeal, raisins, flour, non-fat powdered milk, and cinnamon. In a medium bowl combine applesauce and baking powder. Add to dry ingredients and stir well. Place rounded teaspoons of dough on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

In a large heavy dutch oven or a crock pot, combine all of the dry ingredients. Pour in the beer and the chili sauce. Add meat and cover. Cook at a low temperature for 12 hours or until the meat is very tender. Serve with the cooking juices.

Butter a large bowl and add the flour. Add the beaten egg slowly, blending well after each addition. Add the milk slowly while blending well. Heat the soup until boiling. Add the dumplings to the soup and cook for 10 minutes or until the dumplings rise to the top of the soup. Serve immediately with crackers or bread.

Boil potatoes until tender. Cool slightly, then dice into bite size pieces. In a bowl combine diced red onions and celery. In a small bowl, combine vinegar and water. Slowly add enough olive oil to make a dressing. Pour dressing over diced red onions and celery. Season with salt and pepper and add green onions. Chill and serve.

Roll out pie crust into a 9-inch pie pan. Lay out bacon on the bottom of the pie crust. Cover with sausage. Top with swiss cheese. In a bowl beat together the eggs, sour cream, and parsley. Pour over pie crust. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit. Let cool before serving. Great for a brunch.

Place 1 crust in 12-inch pie plate. Spread spaghetti sauce over crust. Sprinkle with 1 cup mozzarella cheese and 1 cup mushrooms. Arrange chicken on top. Top with remaining cup of mozzarella cheese. Cover with top crust. Bake at 350f for 35 to 40 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream the butter and sugars. Add the eggs one at a time. Mix together the lemon juice and zest. Add to creamed mixture. Mix the dry ingredients and add to mixture. Roll into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
In small bowl combine celery, onion, mayo, tuna, salt and pepper. Spread over top of hamburger bun. Top with mozzarella cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve with tomato and lettuce if desired.

Pour water into a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add sugar and let dissolve. Add coffee, saffron, cardamom pods, and rosewater. Stir well and then remove from heat. Leave coffee mixture for a few minutes for the cardamom flavour to develop. Strain coffee into serving glasses and serve immediately.
cook pasta per instructions on box. In a separate bowl combine the meat, butter, milk and cheese mixture. Add the macaroni and stir. Add the soup. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Rinse and dry the shrimp. Combine parsley, lemon juice and oregano in small bowl. In a small glass dish combine all the remaining ingredients and whisk until well blended. Add the shrimp and coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 4 hours. Remove the shrimp from the marinade and place on a broiler pan or large platter. Brush with the marinade and broil 2-3 inches from the heat for 2-3 minutes per side until the shrimp are opaque in the center. Serve hot.

In a large heavy-bottom saucepan combine the rice, milk, sugar, butter, and vanilla. Cook over medium-low heat until the mixture comes to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and continue to simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture thickens and the rice is very tender. Add the eggs one at a time and stir constantly until the mixture thickens, about 1-2 minutes after each egg is added. Stir in the heavy cream, vanilla, and cinnamon and bring back to a simmer. Remove from the heat and stir until smooth. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oil over medium high heat. Add vegetables to pan. Cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients. Heat to boiling. Simmer 10 minutes. Add chicken to pan. Cook 10 minutes or until done. Serve over rice.
Slice up your tomatoes and combine them with lemon juice, sugar and extra virgin olive oil. Add your savory, salt and pepper. Marinate for 2 to 3 hours and serve chilled.

Blend together the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, mango chutney, and apricot brandy until smooth. Add the fruit and ginger. Blend well. Chill for 30 minutes before serving with crackers or thin slices of baguette bread. Makes about 2 cups.

Stir together sour cream, flour, and sugar. Add cornmix well. Combine with ground beef, onion, seasoning mix, and milk to make a thick mixture. Spoon into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350f for 30 minutes or until heated through. Top with cheese and crushed tortilla chips. Bake for about 5 minutes or until cheese melts.

Rinse broccoli well and drain. Chop into bite-size pieces. Peel onion and slice thinly. Combine onion and broccoli in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine artificial sweetener and cider vinegar. Add to vegetables. Add mayonnaise and mix until well blended. Chill. Stir in seeds and raisins. Makes 4 side dish servings.

Combine 1 teaspoon warm water and 1 teaspoon honey in a small bowl. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon active dry yeast over mixturelet stand until mixture is foamy, about 10 minutes. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in maple-flavored syrup and remaining 1/4 teaspoon honeycook until syrup is reduced to 1/3 cup (120ml), about 3 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup (120ml) warm water and saltbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil until slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Remove from heatstir in 2 cups (250g) oatmeal and remaining 1/2 cup (120ml) warm water. Cool to lukewarm. In a small bowl, mix together 1/4 cup (60ml) warm water and 1/2 teaspoon saltstir until salt is dissolved. Combine 3/4 cup (175g) warm water

Heat oil in large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browndrain. Stir in zucchini, squash, onions and water. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer covered for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add pasta sauce and garbanzo beans. Simmer until heated through. Add beef bouillon cube and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over cooked pasta. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Combine all the ingredients except the mushroom stock. Let stand 5-10 minutes. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the seitan mixture and cook for 5-8 minutes. Add the mushroom stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the liquid is absorbed and the seitan is firm and cooked through. Cut into slices and serve. Serves 6.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the garlic and saute for 5 minutes. Add the chicken broth and cook for 25 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Ladle into bowls and top with bread cubes and an egg.

Boil potatoes in water for 15 minutes until tender. Drain and allow to cool. In a mixing bowl combine the potatoes with the sour cream and cream. Season with the pepper and sprinkle with the cheeses. Spoon the mixture into a greased casserole dish and sprinkle with the chives. Bake for 30 minutes or until browned and bubbling.

Chop chicken into bite-sized pieces in a large bowl. Mix in celery, onion, salt and lemon juice. Stir in grapes, oranges, almonds and lettuce leaves. Serve chilled in lettuce cups or on a bed of lettuce.

Pre-heat oven to 180 Celsius. Line flat oven trays with baking paper. Beat butter until soft. Add castor and brown sugars and beat until mixture is light and fluffy. Gradually add the egg and vanilla essence, beating until well combined. Sift the flour and fold into the mixture. Add the chocolate and stir well. Pinch off teaspoonfulls of the mixture and roll into small balls. Place evenly on trays, allowing for spreading. Bake for 15mins.

Put all ingredients in a blender. Blend for a few seconds on high speed or until ingredients are thoroughly combined. You may want to taste to see if it is sweet enough for your liking at this point. I had to add a bit of sugar to mine because it was a bit tart. Pour into a glass. Makes 1 11-ounce serving.

Line two baking sheets with waxed paper. Melt margarine in a saucepan over low heat and stir in marshmallows and milk. Stir constantly until mixture is smooth and creamy. Pour mixture onto waxed paper and quickly spread evenly to about 1/4-inch thickness. Cool at room temperature for 1 hour or until firm. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cream. Stir in enough water to make glaze thin enough to drizzle. Drizzle over marshmallow mixture and sprinkle with toasted pecans. Cut logs in half diagonally and wrap individually in waxed paper and store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour.

In a food processor fitted with the s-blade, combine the drained beans and all remaining ingredients. Pulse until the beans are well blended and a smooth consistency is achieved. Refrigerate the dip for 1 hour. Serve with pita bread, crudites and crackers.

Soak cod in cold water overnight. Rinse well. Drain. Pat dry. Cut into serving pieces. Cook green peppers. Add tomatoes. Cook until tender. Add bacon. Stir in cod. Serve with scrambled eggs. Sprinkle with black pepper. Serve with toast.

Cut off the top and bottom of each eggplant. Peel off skin and then cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch wide strips. Place in a mixing bowl and toss with sugar and soy sauce. Transfer to a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes. In a small bowl combine chili paste and lime juice. In a separate small bowl add 1 tablespoon of water to dissolve palm sugar. Stir in lime juice mixture and palm sugar water into roasted eggplant. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with cilantro and green onions. Serve with pita or chips.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash the asparagus spears well and snap off the tough ends of each spear. Add the oil and salt and pepper to taste in a shallow baking pan and toss the vegetables well. Roast for 10-15 minutes until the spears are bright green and slightly browned and crisp-tender. Add the balsamic vinegar and toss well. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a medium saucepan, stir together flaked coconut, morton lite salt and water until smooth. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in oatsreturn to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in fat-free sweetened condensed milkcook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in coconut extract. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Heat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bring the chicken stock to a boil in a saucepan over medium high heat. Add the arborio rice and stir until it begins to turn white. Add the saffron strands and stir until the rice is completely coated with the saffron. Stir in the chicken stock. Add the chicken breasts, leek, and lemon zest. Cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove the cover, and stir the peas into the rice. Bake for 15 more minutes. Stir in the lemon juice. Stir the parmesan cheese into the hot rice. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Sauté the onion in the butter till it is clear. Add the broth. Add the rice. Cook till the rice is done. Add the soup. Stir to combine. Cook till it is hot. Add the chicken. Stir to combine. Spoon into a shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake till the cheese is melted. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease two 9 inch round pans. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and lemon rind. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the lemon juice. Stir in the sifted dry ingredients alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Divide the batter evenly between the two prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for ten minutes before turning out onto wire racks to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

In a large skillet, cook the beef over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in the onion, green pepper, garlic, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste and salt and pepper. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes or until the mixture is thick. Stir in the cooked noodles. Sprinkle with the cheese. Heat through in the microwave until the cheese is melted.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. In same pot melt butter. Add thyme, basil and parsley. Cook over low heat until fragrant. Add noodles. Toss to coat. Serve immediately. Sprinkle with chives.

Mix all ingredients together. Roll out on a lightly floured surface to about a quarter of an inch thick. Cut into desired shapes. Bake at 350 degrees until just crispy on the edges. Makes about 3 dozen crackers

Blend the honey and ginger in a blender or food processor until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve into a bowl. Heat the oil in a frying pan, then fry the chicken thighs for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crisp. Add the honey mixture and stir over the heat for about 2 minutes, until the glaze thickens and turns sticky. Spoon the glaze over the chicken and serve immediately.

Brown onions in butter. Add chicken. Brown chicken. Add garlic salt & pepper. Add broth and broccoli. Cover. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Mix in rice. Add milk. Bake 15 min. at 350 degrees. Top with cheese.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the potatoes until fork tender. Drain and set aside to cool. Once they have cooled down, chop into 1-inch pieces. Combine the sour cream and mayonnaise in a medium bowl. Mix in the dill and season with black pepper and salt. Add the diced potatoes and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve cold.

Cut shallot in half lengthwise and finely chop. Melt the butter in a small saute pan. Add shallot and cook over medium heat until transparent and soft. Add garlic and cook for one minute. Add the white beans, stir to blend and continue to cook for one minute. Add parsley and stir. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and mustard. Gradually add the olive oil and whisk to emulsify. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss the white bean mixture with the dressing. Cover and chill for at least two hours before serving.

In a large pot of boiling water, add soba noodles. Cook for 4 minutes. Drain. In a large pot, combine the watercress and shiitake mushrooms. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Add in the chicken stock. Simmer for 5 minutes. In the meantime, slice the fresh ginger. Cut the noodles to fit inside the bowl. Add the noodles to the watercress broth. Add in the fresh ginger. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add in the spinach. Simmer for another 2 minutes. Add in the soy sauce. Serve with a drizzle of lime juice.

Sprinkle polish sausage with 1/2 teaspoon oregano. Cook sausage and crumble. In large skillet cook sausage over medium-high heat 4 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove sausage from skillet. Add remaining 1/2 teaspoon oregano to skillet. Cook 1 minute. Stir in summer squash. Cook over medium heat 3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Stir together dressing and milkpour over sausage mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with bread. Makes 2-1/2 servings.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add onions and saute until translucent and slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Add the bay leaf, salt & pepper, hot pepper sauce and saute an additional 1 minute. Add rice, water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook until almost tender, about 20 minutes. Add peas and cook until peas are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 425. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray and arrange the onion and rosemary in a single layer on the sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the rice in boiling water according to package directions. Cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and fibers with a spoon. Place on a second sheet pan and drizzle with cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes, or until softened. Remove from the heat and add the vegetable stock and 1 teaspoon of rosemary. Stir and bring back to a boil. Add the onion and rice and stir. Cover and reduce heat to low and simmer for 12 minutes until tender but not mushy. Add the red wine and cook until reduced by half. Add the cream and remaining rosemary and cook for another minute. Stir in the butternut squash and cook for another minute. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, sweetened condensed milk and butter for 5 minutes or until smooth. Pour into pie shells. Bake at 325 degrees for about 2 hours or until almost set. Cool. Top with caramel sauce and chopped milk chocolate. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Refrigerate overnight.

Place the dry lentils into a saucepan with the salt, water, and meat. Bring the mixture to a boil. Then cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer for 40 to 45 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Mix the ground beef with the soup mix. Stir the meat mixture into the cooked lentils. Add the remaining ingredients and stir thoroughly. Makes 4 servings.

In large bowl combine potatoes, soup, sour cream and cheese. Mix well and turn into a 2-quart casserole dish. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Remove foil and bake uncovered for 15 minutes longer or until lightly browned. Variation: use condensed cream of celery soup and substitute 1 can of celery for the onion in the recipe.
Rub tuna steaks with spice blend. Marinate in lime juice and oil for 15 minutes. Grill over hot coals turning once. Serve with rice and a side salad.

Soak beans overnight. Drain water. Add catsup, barbecue sauce, dry mustard. Add water. Add beans, cover, cook on low in slow cooker for 4 hours. Cut up one package of bacon. Fry until crisp. Set aside. Pour liquid into pot, add bacon. Cook another half hour. Serve. Serves about 12.

Place the romaine and oranges in a large bowl. Toss with the avocado. In a small bowl whisk together the vinaigrette ingredients until smooth. Pour over the salad and toss. Garnish with a few chopped scallions.

Wash and dry chicken breasts and sprinkle with garlic powder and onion powder. Place in the crockpot. Cover with the soup and milk. Top with the ham and the swiss. Top with the breadcrumbs. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Cook broccoli in salted boiling water for 3-4 minutes. Drain and cool. In a large bowl combine broccoli and almonds. In a separate bowl combine orange juice and zest of one orange with the juice of 1/2 a lemon. Add 2 tbsp of sugar and 1/2 cup of olive oil. Whisk together. Pour dressing over broccoli and almonds and toss to coat. Add green onions. Toss. Let stand at room temp for 1 hour. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350f/180c. Grease a deep 20cm round cake pan and line base with non-stick baking paper. Combine butter, chocolate, sugar, syrup and milk in a medium pan. Stir over low heat until chocolate is melted and sugar dissolved. Transfer mixture to a large bowl and cool for 15 minutes. Whisk in sifted flours and eggs, pour into prepared pan and cook in amoderately slow oven for 1 hour and 10 minutes to make ganache, combine chocolate and cream in a medium pan stir over low heat until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Spread ganche over top of cake and serve.

Place garlic and chives in a food processor and blend until finely chopped. Add chickpeas and process until very smooth (about a minute). Transfer mixture to a large mixing bowl. Stir in cumin and coriander and season with salt and pepper. Form mixture into 14 patties about 4cm thick and place in a single layer on a large baking tray. Preheat the oven to 180°C. Spray patties with olive oil and bake for 45 minutes or until firm and golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature with lemon wedges.

Peel the apple, cut it into quarters and remove the seeds. Put the apple quarters into a deep saucepan or frying pan along with the butter, brown sugar, water and cardamom. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes, or until the fruit is soft. Add the raisins and continue to cook until the fruit is soft all over. Serve immediately or leave to cool down. Sprinkle with more cardamom before serving.

Spread a layer of butter on one slice of bread. Arrange ham slices and sliced pickled onions. Drizzle with pickle juice if you like. Sprinkle with chutney and top with a piece of cheddar cheese. Top with other slice of bread buttered side down. Grill for a few minutes until the cheese is golden brown. Serve immediately with a spoonful of piccalilli or pickled onions. Makes two servings.

Cut ham into 3 inch cubes and fry gently in a non stick frying pan until crisp. Beat eggs with a splash of milk and butter in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Cook asparagus in boiling water for 5 minutes or until tender but still crunchy. Drain and cool. Arrange ham on a serving plate and place asparagus on top. Pour egg mixture over the top and return to the stove for 1 minute or until the egg is lightly cooked and set. Serve immediately.

Dissolve yeast in warm water with a little of the oil and sugar. Set aside. Combine the oil and sugar and let cool to lukewarm while the other ingredients are mixed together. Combine the oil, sugar and eggs and mix well. Sift together the rest of the dry ingredients and add to the oil mixture gradually until the dough is stiff and easy to handle. Knead until smooth and elastic and put back into the container for rising. Cover with plastic wrap and place in a warm place until it doubles in size, about an hour. Then punch down and form into loaf. Place in an oiled loaf pan and rise until doubled again about an hour and bake at 375 for about an hour or until done.
Combine first five ingredients in a bowl. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with lemon zest and fresh basil leaves just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 13x9x2-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine butter and sugar. Beat until well blended. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Stir in flour and cocoa until blended. Stir in amaretto and ground almonds. Spread in prepared baking pan. Bake in a 350 degrees f oven for 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned and set. Cool. Cut into squares.

Brown the ground beef with onion. Drain. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Cool. In a large bowl combine ground beef mixture with bisquick mix. Add milk, eggs and cheese. Spread mixture evenly into 9-inch pie plate. Bake in 400 degree oven for 35 to 40 minutes.

Wash and cut the potatoes into cubes. Put them in boiling water with the bacon. Boil for ten minutes, then remove the bacon and potato cubes with a slotted spoon. Mash the bacon into the potato cubes with a potato masher. Add the milk, onion, eggs, flour, and cheese. Mix well. Heat the bacon grease in a frying pan and form into balls with your hands. Roll the balls in flour then in egg wash. Finally roll in dried breadcrumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a shallow bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. Place cracker crumbs and cheese in a shallow dish. Dip chicken in buttermilk mixturedredge in cracker crumb mixture. Place in a single layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 30 minutes. Sprinkle with sage and rosemary. Bake 5 minutes longer. Remove from oven and place on platter. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Unwrap biscuits and place in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowlsprinkle evenly over biscuits. Melt butterdrizzle evenly over biscuits. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before cutting into bars. Serve warm.

Beat egg whites with wire whisk until soft peaks form. Beat in cocoa powder 1 tablespoon at a time until well incorporated. Add sour cream and beat until thickened. Fold in sugar until just combined. Add coffee and vanilla and fold until just combined. Chill at least one hour. Serve garnished with fresh whipped cream

Slice figs lengthwise 1/8" thick. Place in an ovenproof glass bowl with Marsala wine and oranges. Bake until oranges are soft and figs are tender. Cool slightly. Mix together honey and orange blossom water. Slice oranges in half. Serve 2 slices per person on plates with 1/2 slice of each orange. Spoon honey mixture over oranges. Top with creme fraiche. Garnish with mint leaves. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Cook rice according to package directions. In a sauce pan add the water, onion soup mix, and margarine. Bring to a boil. Stir in cooked rice. Stir well. Let set for a few minutes to absorb the flavor. Serve as is or refrigerate for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

Mix together cherry pie filling, dark sweet cherries and brown sugar in an 8 x 12 inch baking dish. Sprinkle the bisquick mix over the filling and drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with nuts and cinnamon. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes or until top is browned and bubbly. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

In a medium saucepan, stir together the sour cream, chicken base, clarified butter, flour, jalapeno juice and salt until smooth. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring constantly, 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heatstir in jalapeno and 1 cup of the cheese. Spoon into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of cheese. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until lightly browned on top.

Cream the butter with the eggs. Add the sugar and almonds. Beat the egg whites and blend them with the flour and baking powder. Add the white mixture to the rest. Divide into 3 or 4 parts. Roll each part into a long roll. Press each roll down to an 1/8 inch thickness. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or till done. Makes 12 to 14 cookies.

Combine the tempeh, celery, red bell peppers, and dill pickle. In a small bowl whisk together the scallions, fresh parsley, soy mayonnaise, yellow mustard, lemon juice, and salt and black pepper. Pour over the tempeh mixture and toss lightly. Chill until ready to serve. Serve in a large salad bowl with fresh lettuce leaves or your favorite bread. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.In a large bowl, beat together the cocoa, granulated sugar and vegetable oil until smooth. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until well blended. In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Gradually beat into the cocoa mixture. Shape the dough into 1 inch balls. Roll in the powdered sugar.Place the balls 2 inches apart on the prepared sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Transfer to wire racks and cool completely.Store in airtight containers.Makes 48.
Heat oil in pan and add sausages. Fry till browned. Add vegetables and fry till cooked. Add onion and flour. Stir till mixture thickens. Add curry powder. Heat till fragrant. Serve.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.

Bring a large skillet half full of lightly salted water to a boil. Add snap peas and green peas. Return to boil. Boil 1 minute or until snap peas are crisp-tender. Do not overcook. Drain. Rinse with cold water and drain well again. Melt butter in skillet. Add snap peas, green peas, chives, salt and pepper. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring, until hot. Remove to serving bowl. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch square pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper, making sure the paper extends over two sides of the pan. Melt butter and sugar in a medium saucepan over low heat. Whisk in cocoa powder and eggs one at a time until smooth and well combined. Whisk in vanilla and flour until just combined. Stir in chocolate and nuts until evenly distributed. Spread into prepared pan and spread nuts on top. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow to cool in the pan for 30 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

Preheat the oven to 350f degrees and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Cream together the butter and sugars with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time to the mixture, beating well after each addition. Add the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir into the creamed mixture. Add the quick oats and mix well. Stir in the nuts if desired. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from the ovencool on wire racks.
Soften and melt the jell-o. Cream together the jell-o and the cream cheese. Add the cola and the nuts. Put into a mold and chill overnight. Serve with the fruit.
Bring half-and-half to a boil. Add soup. Stir until smooth. Add noodles. Cook according to directions. Add garlic. Add broccoli. Cook until heated through. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Season fish with crushed red pepper and sprinkle with lemon juice. Add fish and cook 4 minutes on each side or until done. Remove fish from skillet. Add garlic to pan and saute 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, olives, capers, wine and parsley. Cook until heated through. Serve fish on top of sauce.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine figs and their syrup with the olive oil, shallot, horseradish and mustard. Cook until the mixture thickens. Set aside to cool. In a small bowl, combine the minced garlic and the chopped parsley. In a skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the shrimp, garlic mixture and parsley. Cook until the shrimp are pink. Stir in the horseradish mixture. Serve warm.

In 3 qt saucepan combine bacon, onion and cook until crisp. Remove from pan. In the same pan brown rice until lightly browned. Stir in stewed tomatoes, black-eyed peas, hot sauce and garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with bacon and onions. Serve with salsa.

Boil potatoes until done. Drain and rinse with cold water until cool enough to handle. Slice. In a small bowl, combine dressing, salt, celery, green onion. Mix well. In a medium bowl, combine potatoes, eggs, mustard, horseradish. Pour dressing mixture over mixture. Fold gently to combine. Add sour cream. Mix well. Chill until serving time. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Prick the potatoes with a fork and bake for 1 hour. While the potatoes are baking, combine the yogurt and herb seasoning. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well. Remove the potatoes from the oven and top with the yogurt mixture. Return to oven for 5 more minutes.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat for one minute. Melt butter in pan and add two slices of white bread in pan. Brown for about one minute on each side. Remove from pan and set aside. Spread mozzarella cheese on both sides of one slice of white bread and top with roasted red peppers and parmigiano-reggiano cheese. Add a little more mozzarella cheese on top of sandwich and top with second piece of white bread and press lightly with spatula to seal sandwich in panini press. Serve warm on plates.

Fry bacon until crisp. Crumble bacon and set aside. Cook onion and garlic in bacon drippings until tender. Add green beans. Stir in chicken broth and sprinkle with bacon crumbles. Cover and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top with Tabasco sauce.

Cut potato in half and place skin side down in baking dish. Place onion and garlic in center of each potato half and sprinkle with garlic salt and parsley. Sprinkle cheese and pimento evenly over each half. Pour stuffing mix evenly over cheese and pimento. Top each half with 2 teaspoons butter. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Makes 6 servings.

Brown bacon in skillet. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute until golden. Add cabbage and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add salt and cover. Cook until cabbage is tender. Add water and cover. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve hot over pierogies. Top with fresh dill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In shallow bowl, mix together egg yolk and 1 tablespoon waterset aside. Place fillets between 2 pieces of wax paperpound to 1/2-inch thickness. Place 1 tablespoon butter on eachfold over and seal edges with toothpicks. In shallow pan over medium heat, heat sherry and soy sauce to boilingremove from heat and add lemon juice and remaining butter. Add parsley and 1 teaspoon watermix well. Place butter mixture on bottom of shallow baking pan or casserole panplace folded fish on top. Bake 15 minutes or until fish is firm and golden brown. Unfold fishspoon lemon butter mixture over and serve immediately.

Cream together the butter and the sugars until light and creamy. Add the egg and extracts and mix well. Add the dry ingredients and mix just until blended. Divide into balls and press a baby ruth into the center of each ball of dough. Roll in the sugar and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes or until done.

Combine oranges with cold water and cook in double boiler until tender. Puree in blender with sugar. Add egg beaten with milk and salt, cook for about a minute over low heat stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in nuts and baking powder. Beat in enough of the remaining flour (1/2 cup) to make a soft dough. Turn into two greased 8×4 inch pans. Bake at 325 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack for a few minutes before removing from pan to cool completely on wire rack.

Heat oil in heavy medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook stirring frequently until cooked through, about 8 minutes. Transfer chicken to bowl. Heat coconut milk and curry paste in same skillet stirring occasionally over medium-high heat about 1 minute. Whisk in sugar, fish sauce and lime zest. Add chicken, eggplant and kaffir leaves and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer covered 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Stir in sugar and cook 1 minute longer stirring occasionally. Cook spaghetti in same skillet in reserved chicken broth in another skillet over medium-low heat 12 minutes or until spaghetti is tender stirring occasionally. Stir in chicken mixture. Serve with cilantro sprinkled over top.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the potatoes and cook for about 10 minutes or until just fork tender. Drain and return to the pot. Add the butter spread and low fat milk. Mash well and stir in the sour cream and bacon bits. Season with salt and pepper. Top with freshly chopped chives and serve hot.

Brown ground beef with mushrooms, onions and garlic powder. Add chicken broth and water. Bring to a boil. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer for 5 minutes. Cook your noodles according to package directions. Drain and toss with sauce. Garnish with grated cheese.
Combine dry ingredients. Add egg, milk and shortening. Stir until well mixed. Add chopped nuts. Stir. Pour into a loaf pan. Sprinkle with stuffed olives. Bake at 350f for 50 minutes.

In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Beat in 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar and milk until smooth. Beat in vanilla. Refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to serve. In a small bowl, combine the remaining powdered sugar and milk to make glazedrizzle over cheese mixture. In a small saucepan, combine the butter, pudding mixes and milkstir with a whisk until blended. Cook over low heat 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Cool slightlyspread over cheese mixture. Top with whipped topping and crushed Oreos. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 170c grease a 1-2 litre baking dish or a 30cm spring form tin with butter. Cut the bread in 4 cm cubes. Stir in the cinnamon, nutmeg and a pinch of salt. In a large bowl beat the eggs, the caster sugar, the vanilla essence, the salt and the melted butter until well combined and slightly thickened. Pour the mixture over the cubes of bread. Stir in the chocolate chips. Bake for 15 20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Leave to cool for 5 minutes before serving warm or cold.

Heat the oven to 450 degrees F. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook until crisp. Drain the bacon, reserving 2 tablespoons of the drippings. Remove the bacon from the skillet. Add the alfredo sauce, the reserved bacon drippings and the sun-dried tomato to the skillet. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Add the pasta to the skillet with the bacon and sauce. Toss well. Sprinkle with the fresh basil and black pepper. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve.

Place Rice Bubbles and coconut in a large bowl and mix together. Add the glace cherries and mix well. Place the mix into a lined baking tray and press down firmly. Place in the fridge to set. Melt the margarine with the golden syrup and dark chocolate in a microwave safe bowl. Drizzle the mixture over the baking tray and refrigerate to set.

Mix together the ricotta cheese and the eggs until smooth. Add the flour and mix thoroughly. Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 1 inch thick rope. Cut each rope into 1 inch pieces. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the gnocchi to the boiling water. Cook for 30 seconds or until the gnocchi floats to the surface. Remove the gnocchi from the water and place in a bowl of ice water. Drain the gnocchi from the ice water and set aside. In a 12 inch skillet saute the tomato sauce over low heat for 10 minutes. Add the gnocchi and parmesan cheese to the skillet and stir until well coated. Serve warm.

Combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt in a sauce pan. Gradually whisk in the half and half. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Boil and stir for one minute. Remove from heat and stir in the butter and brown sugar. Cool to room temperature. Spoon mixture into the pie shell. Sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Chill.

Puree fresh peaches in blender. Strain through fine sieve or strainer. Add brown sugar and salt. Combine in blender or food processor. Add ice cream and blend until smooth. Pour into six glasses and serve immediately.
In a bowl combine the first 4 ingredients and blend well. Spread evenly on crackers or toast. Makes 8 servings.

Peel and slice the potatoes. Wash and chop the onions. Heat the olive oil in a skillet and sauté the onions with the smoked bacon. When the bacon is crisp, add the sliced potatoes and sauté them for about 10 minutes. Add the garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes and transfer to a bowl. In another bowl beat the eggs and combine them with the cream and the potatoes. Preheat the oven to 350f. Lightly grease a deep baking dish and pour in the mixture. Bake for about 40 minutes or until a knife comes out clean when inserted into the centre of the dish. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large mixing bowl combine Bisquick, granulated sugar and eggs until well blended. Add in the milk and stir until just moistened. Fold in the walnuts. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely on a wire rack.

In a large saucepan, saute onion and carrot with oil until soft. Add oregano and saute briefly. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add quinoa. Reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is tender about 10 to 12 minutes. Stir in frozen peas. Fluff quinoa with a fork. Add lemon juice and black pepper. Serve immediately.

Mix first 5 ingredients. Shape into 4 patties. Brown in 1/4 cup vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat for about 6 minutes on each side or until done. Add remaining vegetable oil to skillet. Add soup, sliced mushrooms and garlic powder. Bring to a boilcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Stir in cheese. Place patties in skilletcover and simmer for 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve on buns.

Rinse pigeon peas thoroughly under running water. Add to a large pot with enough water to cover them by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 2 hours. Add seasoning. Add pork. Add butter. Simmer for another 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Mash the pigeon peas. Add cornflour to desired consistency. Serve with rice.

In a large skillet heat the butter over medium high heat. Add the onions and saute them until they are almost golden brown. Sprinkle with the curry powder and flour and stir to combine. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook for about 1 minute to cook the flour taste out. Slowly add the water stirring constantly until you have a thick gravy. Stir in the cake flour 1 teaspoon at a time until you have reached the thickness you want. Season with the salt, black pepper, sugar and vinegar. Turn off the heat and add the hard boiled eggs cut into quarters. Mix well and serve at once or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Separate egg whites and egg yolks. Blend whites, milk, egg yolk, scallions, oil and pepper to make an omelet base. Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and add the egg base. Cook until firm but not browned. Add the shrimp and swiss cheese to the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with scallions, roll up the omelet and serve immediately. Makes one serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Clean and cut off the ends of the butternut squash. Cut the remaining squash lengthwise into 2-inch wedges. Rub each wedge with a little olive oil. Place the wedges face-side down on a sheet pan and sprinkle the cut sides with baking soda and sea salt. Roast until tender when pierced with a knife, about 45 minutes. When the wedges are cool enough to handle, scoop out the seeds with a spoon. Use a potato masher or a fork to mash the wedges. Stir in the onion, carrots and broth. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Simmer until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes. Puree the mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Stir the half-and-half into the puree. Season with black pepper and cinnamon. Serve with croutons.

Mix orange juice, tomato paste, vinegar, brown sugar, garlic and ginger in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until it starts to thicken. Remove from heat and set aside. Preheat broiler or grill. Brush fillets on both sides with vegetable oil. Sprinkle both sides lightly with hot red pepper flakes. Grill or broil about 4 minutes per side or until done. Remove from grill or broiler. Pour sauce over fillets. Garnish with orange zest. Serve immediately.

Grate the potatoes into a large bowl. Add the remaining ingredients except the oil. Mix well. Squeeze the mixture through a colander with a large spoon. Rinse the colander with cold water to remove excess starch. Add the oil and mix well. Preheat the oven broiler to high. Place the potatoes on a baking pan. Broil 5 inches from the heat for 2 minutes. Flip the potatoes with a spoon. Broil for 2 minutes more. Serve immediately.

Place fish, skin side down, on a rimmed sheet pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the salt. Season with remaining 1/2 salt. Heat the oil in a skillet over high heat. Add the remaining 1/2 of the basil. When it just begins to wilt, add the tomatoes. Cook for 2 minutes. Pour the mixture over the fish. Cook the fish for 10 minutes. Flip the fish. Cook for 5 to 6 more minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Transfer the fish to a serving platter. Discard the bay leaf. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Garnish with the remaining chopped basil.

Beat egg white with 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl with a fork until foamy. Add brown sugar and beat until smooth. Stir in remaining ingredients to coat pecans. Spread pecans on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes, stirring after the first 5 minutes. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Mix brown sugar and salt together. Add cream and bring to boil on medium heat. Cook until the mixture becomes the consistency of thick caramel sauce. Stir constantly to prevent scorching. Add almonds and continue to stir until mixture is thick and can be dropped by spoonfuls into a greased 9x13in metal dish. Place dish on a sheet pan and cool completely before cutting into 2x2in pieces.

In a large deep skillet or saute pan saute the onion and garlic in the oil over medium high heat until the onion is translucent and starting to brown. Add the herbes de provence and cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until reduced by half. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add the cannellini beans and dry white wine and cook for 10 minutes longer or until beans are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Prepare crust according to package directions. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumble bacon. Combine bacon, spinach and black pepper. Top crust with pizza sauce, then sprinkle with spinach mixture. Sprinkle with monterey jack pepper cheese. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan. Bake for 5 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray bundt pan with non-stick cooking spray. Mix cake mix, pudding mix, oil and water until just moistened. Stir in nuts. Fold in sprinkles. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in pre-heated oven for 55 to 60 minutes or until cake is lightly browned and cake springs back when lightly pressed. Allow cake to cool 20 minutes in pan. Place cake on a serving platter and sift powdered sugar over the top.

Thaw the frozen spinach. Heat grapeseed oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onions and ginger in olive oil until tender. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, stirring constantly to prevent browning. Add spices and saute until fragrant, 1 minute. Add frozen spinach, stirring to coat with spices. Season with salt. Cook until spinach has thawed, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in yogurt and serve hot with basmati rice.

Peel the potatoes and grate them coarsely into a bowl, add the flour, and beat well together until the mixture is smooth and well blended. Make a well in the centre and add the grated cheese and the egg and beat until smooth. Add the melted butter and salt and mix well together. Turn the mixture out onto a lightly floured board and roll out with a lightly floured rolling pin until the mixture is about half an inch thick. Cut out with a four and one-half-inch cutter and bake on a lightly greased baking sheet at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for twenty minutes until nicely browned and crisp. Serve hot with a salad or tomato sauce or with a salad of young spinach leaves.

Melt the butter in a frying pan. Cut the veal into serving sized pieces. Salt and pepper to taste. Brown the veal on all sides. Add the scallions. Saute for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms. Saute for another minute. Blend the flour into the mixture. Stir until the flour is cooked through. Stir in the white wine. Add the whipping cream. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat. Cook the mixture for about 15 minutes or until it is thick. Season to taste. Serve the mixture over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Beat together the eggs and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the pecans, maple syrup, and cinnamon. Combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and xanthan gumstir into the egg mixture. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm. Let cool before cutting. Drizzle with honey before serving, if desired.

Cook the potatoes in a large saucepan of salted boiling water until tender but still firm. Drain and rinse with cold water and drain again. Toss together broccoli and beans in a large bowl. Whisk together olive oil, lemon and a pinch of salt. Pour over vegetables and toss to coat. Divide vegetables among serving plates. Top each serving with a spoonful of goat cheese and sprinkle with dill and pine nuts. Makes 4 servings.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil. When hot, add the sausages. Cook until brownedthen add onions. Cook until translucentadd bell peppers. Stiradd poblano chile and cook until softenedabout 3 minutes. Add tomatilloscook until softenedabout 2 minutes. Add winestirringcook until reduced by halfabout 2 minutes. Add ricestir until blendedabout 1 minute. Add beanscook until heated throughabout 1 minute. Stir in cilantroseason to taste with salt. Serve with hot sauce if desired.

Cut squash and onion in pieces, boil together, then reduce heat until tender. Drain & mash squash some. Combine squash, onion, eggs, bread bits, butter, sugar, salt. Put into a 3 quart dish that has been oiled. Bake at 350 until lightly browned. Sometimes i toss in some velveeta - when the kids were small they liked it with the cheese.

Season halibut with salt and pepper. Saute in hot oil for 2 to 3 minutes per side or until opaque throughout. Remove fish from pan and set aside. Add zucchini to pan and saute for 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Add garlic and cook for an additional 30 seconds. Add tomato, parsley, lemon juice, and white wine or broth to pan. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until liquid has reduced slightly. Serve fish over vegetables and top with fresh parsley if desired.

Combine melted butter and corn syrup in a bowl. Add the sugar. Beat vigorously with a wooden spoon for 1 minute or until it forms a thick paste. Set aside. Beat the egg yolks together with the almond extract. Add flour. Mix well. Add the sugar mixture and mix well. Pour into greased mini-muffin cups and place 4 pecan halves on top of each. Bake for 15 minutes. Allow it to cool and dust with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large skillet, over medium high heat, heat the oil until very hot. Sprinkle the skinless duck breasts with the lemon pepper. Sear the duck in the skillet for 3 minutes per side. Transfer the duck to a baking sheet and place in the preheated oven. Bake for 8 to 12 minutes depending on the thickness of the breast, until the center is no longer pink. Remove from the oven and allow the duck to rest for 3 minutes before slicing. Serve with lemon juice squeezed over the top.

Saute onions in oil. Add flour and stir constantly for 3 minutes. Add Anaheim chilies, garlic, and stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Strain through sieve and stir in salt.

Slice margarine into slices. Heat on skillet on low. Fry bread slices one at a time and spread margarine on bread. Cut up apples and sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Layer on bread slices and serve warm.

In a medium bowl, mix 2 cups sugar, cornstarch and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Stir in 2/3 cup boiling water. Stir until mixture thickens. Add 1/4 teaspoon vanilla. Cool. Makes 1 cup. Refrigerate. Use as a topping for bread pudding, or with ice cream or fruit. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup. Makes 1 cup.

In a large bowl, beat together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cayenne pepper, and chives. In another bowl, beat together the milk, eggs, and butter. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Add brie and mix well. Heat a non-stick or well-buttered griddle or skillet over medium heat. Pour about ¼ cup batter onto griddle, making sure you space them at least an inch apart. Cook about 2 minutes on each side until puffed and lightly browned. Serve hot.

Peel potatoes. Cut into 1/4 inch thick slices. Toss in bowl with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Heat 1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil in 10 inch skillet. Add potatoes. Cook 5 minutes over medium heat until potatoes turn golden. Stir. Cook 5 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon dill weed. Lay potatoes in skillet in a scalloped pattern. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cut 3 small slits in each chop. Put 1 tablespoon sour cream in each slit. Sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon dill weed. Put in skillet. Spoon 1/4 cup cream of mushroom soup over potatoes. Put 2 teaspoons parsley over each chop. Bake at 400 for 30 to 35 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the garlic and saute until the onion is golden. Stir in the red pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute. Add the anchovy fillets and cook until they begin to dissolve. Stir in the crushed tomatoes and cook until the sauce is thickened. Stir in the capers and the tuna. Remove from the heat. Cook the pasta according to the package directions and drain. Stir the pasta into the sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Press thawed pie dough into pie dish. Bake 10 minutes. Brown ground beef and onions. Add beef broth and simmer until it has almost evaporated. Drain. Stir in onion salt and mash in a bowl. Add sharp cheddar cheese. Pour over pie dough and bake for 20 minutes. In a separate bowl, whisk together the heavy cream and egg. Season with salt and black pepper. Pour over meat and potatoes and bake for 20 minutes more.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine all ingredients in a 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool completely. Serve warm or cold.
Preheat oven to 375f. Stir soup, water, rice, onion powder, and vegetables in shallow baking dish. Add chicken. Season as desired. Cover. Bake for 50 minutes. Top with cheese and let stand.

Grease a 23cm square cake pan or line with baking paper. Cream together butter, brown sugar and egg until smooth. Add cocoa, vanilla and milk stirring well. Sift together the plain flour and bicarbonate of soda, then stir through the mixture until combined well. Spread into prepared pan and sprinkle with coconut. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until firm to the touch. Remove from the oven, cut into squares while still warm and dust with icing sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, cream together the light brown sugar, self rising flour, eggs and vegetable oil until well combined. Add the vanilla extract and beat for 1 minute more. Fold in the chocolate morsels and pecans. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the pan from the oven, let cool for 10 minutes, then cut into 24 bars with a sharp knife.

Cook white rice in boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain rice thoroughly. Heat margarine or oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and capsicum, cook for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add chopped tomatoes, cook for 5 minutes. Add cooked rice and pepper, stir gently to combine. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until heated through.
Combine all the ingredients except for the cheese in a large mixing bowl. Mash with a fork or potato masher. Fold in cheese. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve with tortilla chips.
Mix all ingredients except the last one. Place in greased baking pan. Bake for about 1 hour or until set. Top with the last one. Bake for a few more minutes or until set and the top is golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine first 5 ingredients. Combine next 5 ingredients. Mix dry and wet ingredients together. Spread in a greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes. Cool. Cut into 16 bars. Store in airtight container.

Heat oil in a medium pot over medium-low heat. Add onions& garlic& saute until onions are translucent. Add the curry powder& stir for 1 minute. Add the zucchini& potato& saute for 1-2 minutes. Add the broth& bring to a boil. Reduce the heat& cover& simmer until the vegetables are tender& the liquid has reduced to a thick sauce. Season with salt& pepper. Puree until smooth& serve.

Whisk together horseradish, lemon juice and zest, fennel seed and mustard in a small bowl. Coat the bottom of a baking dish with a little vegetable oil. Arrange the fillets in the dish and sprinkle with the horseradish mixture. Cover with the panko bread crumbs and bake for about 12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
Bring water to boil in saucepan. Add salt and carrots. Cover pan and cook until water is evaporated. Remove from heat. Add brown sugar and butter. Stir until melted. Add vinegar. Mix and serve.

Clean the mushrooms well. Melt 2 tbsp of the olive oil in a pan. Add the mushrooms, season well, then cover the pan. After 3 minutes remove the lid. Add the water and cover again. Cook for a further 3 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and cover for a further 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the remaining olive oil and the mustard. Garnish with a squeeze of lemon juice.

In a large mixing bowl combine the dry ingredients and blend well. In a separate bowl combine the peanut butter and margarine. Add the bananas and the egg and vanilla and beat well until smooth. Add the dry ingredients and beat until well mixed. Shape into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten each ball with a fork dipped in flour to make a crisscross pattern on each cookie. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until set and lightly browned. Let cool on wire racks. Makes about 16 servings.

In a food processor, process the tomatoes until they are smooth. Add the olive oil, garlic and cayenne. Blend until smooth. Add the mint leaves and pulse a few times until they are mixed into the salsa. Taste for seasoning. Let stand for 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.

Preheat oven to 375f. Beat together sugar, eggs and kahla. Add in melted butter. Stir in flour. Add in pecans. Sprinkle chocolate chips over bottom of crust. Pour filling into crust. Bake pie until filling is puffed around edges and just set in center, covering edge of crust if browning too quickly, about 45 minutes. Transfer pie to rack and cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and cinnamon. Set aside. Mix the oil, milk, eggs, and vanilla together. Pour 1 cup of the batter into the prepared pan, and spread evenly. Arrange the apple slices in a single layer over the batter. Pour the remaining batter over the top of the apples, spreading it evenly to cover. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar just before serving.

Preheat oven to 425f. In a large bowl combine morsels and brown sugar. Stir in the flour and cinnamon. Drain excess water from the can of pie filling. Mix the filling into the morsel mixture. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir in the nuts and quick oats. Bake another 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Slice the sausages into smaller pieces. Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the dried oregano and garlic cloves. Cook over a low heat for about 2 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and beef stock. Bring to the boil then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the black olives and the mushrooms. Cook for a further 5 minutes. Serve hot.

In skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add pork chops and cook 4 minutes. Turn and cook 4 minutes. Combine red wine and beef broth. Pour over pork chops. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile combine cornstarch and water until thoroughly blended. Stir into wine mixture cook 1 minute or until thickened and bubbly. Spoon over chops and serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, celery and garliccook for 4-5 minutes or until onion is soft. Add vegetablesstir in spicescook for 4-5 minutes. Add tomatoescover and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in cilantro. Spoon into a 9-inch pie dish. Top with a pastry lidcrimp edges to seal. Bake in preheated oven for 40-45 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a heavy saucepan combine all the ingredients except almonds. Cook for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, saute almonds in butter until golden. Add to saucepan. Bring to a boil. Simmer about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add parsley. Cook 2 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with white fish fillets. Garnish with lemon wedge.

Cook the beet slices in boiling salted water for 20-25 minutes or until the beets are fork tender. Drain the beets and place them in a greased baking dish. In a small bowl combine the margarine, maple syrup and lemon juice. Stir the mixture well until smooth. Spread the mixture evenly over the top of the beets. Bake in a preheated oven at 350F for 30 minutes or until the topping is golden brown.

In a bowl combine the ground lean pork with the onion, apple, fresh parsley, garlic and egg. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the breadcrumbs and mix well. Divide the mixture into 2 equal parts and shape into 2 loaves. Place on a baking tray and bake in the oven for about 40 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from the oven and brush with the barbecue sauce. Serve hot.

Marinate thawed tofu for 20 minutes in frozen orange juice concentrate and fresh lime juice. Coat tofu with curry powder and place in shallow pan or casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees F. Turn over and continue baking another 10 minutes or until done. Serve as a vegetarian main dish or appetizer.

Clean the brussel sprouts by removing any yellowing or wilted leaves. Slice them off the stems. Cook the sliced sprouts in boiling water for about 10-15 minutes until tender. Drain them. Melt the butter in a skillet and stir in the nutmeg. Add the sliced sprouts and cook on high heat for a couple minutes until they begin to brown. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Place beans in a bowl. In a skillet, brown bacon and drain well. Add butter and stir over medium heat for a few seconds. Pour in brown sugar and stir constantly for about 5 minutes. Stir in beans and soy sauce and heat through. Stir in bacon and garlic powder and heat through. Serve hot.

Combine the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, egg, shallots, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and 1/2 teaspoon parsley in a bowl. Form the mixture into a loaf shape. Wrap in aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cut into 3/4 inch slices. Slice the portabella mushrooms in half. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the chicken breasts and cook until lightly browned. Add the sliced portabella mushrooms to the skillet. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and 1/2 teaspoon parsley. Top with the sliced chicken loaf. Sprinkle with the mozzarella cheese. Broil in the oven for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Combine cranberries, sugar, whipping cream in a bowl. Cool in refrigerator. After 4 hours add apple and walnuts to mixture. Serve.

In a cast iron skillet or large saute pan heat the oil and melt the butter. Saute the onion and green bell peppers for 5 minutes or until they are soft and translucent. Stir in the garlic and continue to cook for another minute or until the garlic is fragrant. Add the frozen potatoes to the pan along with 1/4 teaspoon salt and the black pepper. Cook the potatoes until they are browned on the bottom of the pan. Stir them well and cook until they are browned on the other side. Remove the pan from the stove top and stir in the ham and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir well. Top the potatoes with the cheese and put the pan back on the burner to finish cooking the cheese for a couple minutes. Serve immediately.
Mix the first 4 ingredients together, taste for seasoning and adjust to your preference. Toast the bread, spread with mayonnaise, then add the tuna salad. Makes 2 servings.

To make the sauce, heat the oil in a saucepan, add the onion and cook until soft. Add the celery and cook for 30 seconds. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the curry and cook for another minute. Add the broth and cook until thick. Add the apple. Season to taste.To make the stuffing, combine the celery with the apple sauce. Stuff the celery and arrange in an ovenproof serving bowl. Bake for 10 minutes.

Grease and line a 20 x 20 cm square tin with baking paper. Melt the dark chocolate and butter together over a gentle heat. Whisk in the eggs one at a time followed by the espresso and caster sugar. Sift in the flour and salt. Pour into the tin and bake for 30 minutes. Remove and allow to cool before cutting into squares.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute the vegetables in the vegetable oil until they are tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the dried mushrooms. Turn down the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in the wine. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the port. Simmer for 10 minutes. Strain the soup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first 5 ingredientsreserve 3/4 cup of the mixture for topping. Beat egg whites in a large bowl until stiff. Add remaining mixture to egg whitesfold in walnuts. Spoon batter into pan. Bake 45 minutes or until done. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Sprinkle with reserved mixture.
